loans.name: Tatiana Raquel

texts.es:
Tatiana de 33 años de edad, estudio hasta 9º grado, debido a la situación económica dejo de estudiar, esta casada y su esposo trabaja de albañil, tienen 3 hijos, 2 están estudiando, y nadie mas vive con ellos.

Tatiana comenta que ella ha trabajado de varios oficios, trabajo como domestica varios años, también vendiendo tostadas, enchiladas, tamales y mas.- pero hace unos 6 meses tiene una pequeña granja de pollos y dice que la necesidad y el deseo de sacar a su familia adelante la ha llevado a hacer de todo un poco.- Su día de trabajo comienza a las 5:00 am, pues se levanta temprano para ponerle desayuno a su esposo y despachar a los hijos que estudian, y luego atiende su pequeña granja.- Ella dice que no tiene horario, pero por su  familia lo hace con mucho gusto.


El crédito  es para comprar  6 laminas, 3 cuartones, 18 yardas de cedazo, una bolsa de cemento, 100 pollos y 6 quintales de concentrado.

Los sueños de Tatiana son comprar un terreno y construir su propia casa, ya que hoy vive en terreno de la suegra, que sus hijos se preparen en una carrera universitaria y con la ganancia pagar el crédito.
texts.en:
Tatiana is 33 years old, she studied up to 9th grade, due to her economic situation she left school, she is married and her husband works as a bricklayer, they have 3 children, 2 go to school, nobody else lives with them.

Tatiana says the she has worked in various jobs, she worked as a domestic maid, she also sold tostadas, enchiladas, tamales, etc., but 6 months ago she got a small farm and she says that need and the desire to get her family ahead drove her to try all sorts of jobs. Her working day starts at 5am, she gets up to make breakfast and get her children off to school. Then she tends to her small farm. She days she doesn't have a timetable, but for her family's sake she does it with pleasure.

The loan is to buy 6 sheets of steel, 3 wood beams, 18 yards of lattice, a bag of cement, 100 chickens and 6 bushels of feed concentrate.

Tatiana's dreams are: to buy a plot of land and build her own home, as she now lives on the land of her mother-in-law; that her children will go to university and with the profit she makes, replay the loan.

loans.use: to buy 6 sheets of steel, 3 wood beams, 18 yards of lattice, a bag of cement, 100 chickens and 6 bushels of feed concentrate.

loans.name: Lumière Group

texts.fr: Tina est commerçante depuis 4 ans, membre de la banque communautaire «Lumière», entrepreneur, âgée de 40 ans, mariée et mère de 10 enfants dont 3 étudient et 7 autres se débrouillent.  Elle est vendeuse des poissons frais. Elle étale sa marchandise dans le marché pirate  de la ville. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre ses activités. Elle va acheter 38 poissons. Son conjoint est un technicien charpentier. Elle commença ses business avec de fonds reçu de son mari. Dans l’avenir, elle souhaite scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien, qu’elle apporte aux femmes entrepreneurs non bancables. Il sied de signaler qu'une cliente porte son bébé.
texts.en:
Tina has been a merchant for four years. She is an entrepreneur and a member of the banque communautaire Lumiere. She is married and a mother of ten children, of whom three go to school and the other seven are getting by. Her husband is a carpenter technician.

Tina sells fresh fish. She displays her goods in an informal market in town. She started this business with funds she received from her husband.

She is seeking a loan with Hekima in order to increase her business. She is going to buy 38 fish.

In the future, she wishes to educate and feed her children.

Tina thanks Hekima for their support of female entrepreneurs who lack access to banking services.

It should be noted that one of the clients [in the photo] is holding her child.

loans.use: to buy 38 fish

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
Antonio de 45 años de edad, desgraciadamente no asistió a la escuela, sus padres tenían una pobreza tan grande, que no les permitía, enviar a estudiar a su hijo. Sin embargo, inculcaron en él, el trabajo y que se convirtiera en una persona responsable y trabajadora. Esta acompañado, su esposa es ama de casa y tienen dos hijos quienes también trabajan en agricultura y ganadería.

Antonio inicio a trabajar junto a su padre como jornalero, en las haciendas algodoneras que requerían mano de obra, para realizar diferentes actividades y ademas sembraban 6 tareas de maíz, para el consumo de la familia. Toda la vida ha trabajado en la agricultura, y gracias al apoyo de su esposa, han logrado sacar adelante a sus 2 hijos, dándole la oportunidad de que estudien y se preparen academicamente. Ahora Antonio produce 14,000 metros cuadrados de maíz y una de sorgo y el trabajo lo realiza junto a sus dos hijos. El terreno esta casi a un kilómetro de su casa y el recorrido lo hacen en caballo y trabajan de 6:00 am hasta la 1:00 pm. Ademas, trabaja como jornalero, cuando hay trabajo en época de siembra de cultivos como maíz, sorgo y frijol.


El préstamo sera utilizado en la compra de semilla, abono, pesticidas y herbicidas, para sembrar un área de 7000 mts de cultivo de sorgo. De esta forma, se esta ayudando a que Antonio pueda obtener ingresos cuando obtenga la producción.


El sueño de Antonio es mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, para que no les falte nada, por ello es necesario tener siempre salud, para realizar las labores diarias, para llevar a casa el sustento diario, el cual no debe faltar nunca. Antonio tiene la ilusión de crecer en el negocio del ganado, para así no depender solo de la siembra de maíz y sorgo, ya que muchas veces existen perdidas en los cultivos y es mas alto el riesgo de que en su hogar la alimentación pueda faltar. Para sus hijos desea lo mejor y que sean personas honestas y responsables tal como él les ha enseñado.
texts.en:
Antonio is 45 years old, unfortunately he didn't go to school. His parents were so poor that they were not able to send their son to school. Nevertheless, the instilled a work ethic into him and he became a responsible and hardworking person. He is married, his wife is a housewife and they have two children who also work in farming and cattle raising.

Antonio started working with his father as a day laborer, on the cotton plantations that required labor, to do different jobs and also he sowed 6 fields of corn, for the family consumption. All his life he has worked in farming, and thanks to the support of his wife, they have been able to bring up their 2 children, giving them the opportunity to go to school and prepare themselves academically. Now Antonio produces 14,000 cubic meters of corn and one of sorghum and the work is done with his sons. His land is almost a kilometer from his house and he travels the distance on horseback and works from 6am to 1pm. Also, he works as a day laborer, when there is work in the corn, sorghum and bean harvest season.

The loan will be used to buy seeds, fertilizer, pesticides and herbicides, to plan an area of 7000 meters of sorghum plantation. In this way, Antonio will get help to get the income he needs when he gets production.

Antonio's dream is to improve the quality of life of his family, so they won't lack in anything, it is necessary for him to be healthy, to do his daily work, to bring home the daily bread, which they must never lack. Antonio has the dream of growing a big cattle raising business, so he won't have to depend only on sowing corn and sorghum, as many times harvests are lost and it is higher risk as his family mustn't lack food. For his children, he wants the best and that they will be honest and responsible people as he has taught them.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, pesticides and herbicides, to plant an area of 7000m2 area of sorghum.

loans.name: Betis Rubenia

texts.es:
La señora Betis  es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable vive junto a sus hijos en una comunidad en la zona  de Honduras. Su negocio es la venta sandia el cual es muy conocido en su comunidad. 
Doña Betis necesita el préstamo para la compra de sandias producto que   necesita para seguir vendiendo su producto espera que gracias al préstamo poder contar con los productos necesarios para seguir realizando su negocio y así cubrir la demanda de sus clientes y de igual manera que las ventas tengan un gran aumento.
Doña Betis espera que gracias a esta inversión mejore su calidad de vida y la de su familia, espera que su negocio  siga creciendo y convirtiéndose en el más conocido de la comunidad para de esta manera poder seguir apoyando a su familia y  que  sus hijos continúe con los estudios y tengan mayores oportunidades en la vida.


Choluteca, Honduras – Agosto  del  2014
texts.en:
Betis is a very hard-working and responsible woman who lives with her children in a community in Honduras.  Her business involves selling watermelons and she is very well-known in the community. 

Betis needs a loan in order to purchase watermelons. She hopes that thanks to the loan she will be able to have sufficient merchandise to cover the demand from her customers, and also she hopes that sales increase.  

Betis hopes that through this loan she will improve her quality of life and that of her family.  She hopes that her business will continue to grow and will become the most well-known in the community and in that way she will be able to support her family and her children, who are students, and thus offer them better opportunities in life. 

Choluteca, Honduras – August 2014

loans.use: To purchase watermelons for her business.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty has mastered the skill of making snacks. Not only does she enjoy baking, she also earns income from her hobby. Betty is thankful to Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for trusting her with the capital she needs for her snack making business. She has signed up as a Microfinance Member and consequently she has received a loan to buy more raw ingredients. Betty hopes to open a new snack area to boost her business.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for her snack making business

loans.name: Mark Anthony

texts.en: Mark Anthony is 19 years old and from Anao, Tarlac, in the Philippines. He is studying Automotive Servicing and chose this course because he believes there will be a lot of work opportunities for him in this field. He wants to take out a loan of 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) from KIVA lenders to pay his tuition fees. Mark hopes that lenders will support this loan.

loans.use: to pay his tuition fees

loans.name: Ma. Teresa

texts.en:
Ma. Teresa is 45 years old and married with seven children. With four of them currently in school, she works very hard to provide for the family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her general store. She has been in this business for 7 years and sells a variety of items such as bath soap, detergent, shampoo, canned goods, eggs, biscuits, etc. 

In the future, Ma. Teresa would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Ma. Racil

texts.en:
Maria (Ma.) Racil works hard to support her family. She is married, lives on Cebu island in the Philippines and has had a business selling clothing and footwear for 10 years now.

Ma. Racil has requested a 21,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of goods for her business like sandals, slippers, blouses and shorts. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy more stocks of clothing and footwear

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en: Marilou works hard to support her family. She has a live-in partner and a business buying and selling scrap materials in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 4 years now, and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more scrap materials to sell. In the future, Marilou would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more scrap materials to sell

loans.name: Tupatane Group

texts.fr: Ngulu est une  brave commerçante et membre d’un groupe d’affaires «Tupatane», entrepreneur, dynamique, âgée de 32 ans et mère de 6 enfants, dont 4 étudient et 2 sont encore gosses. La cliente est vendeuse des pagnes. Elle installe ses marchandises dans le marché central de la ville. Elle commença ses affaires avec l’assistance de son mari. Son conjoint est un enseignant. Plus tard, elle bénéficia le  prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a 3 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 18 pièces de pagnes. Ainsi, elle souhaite scolariser, et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs non bancables, surtout; pendant ce moment critique post conflits à l’Est du pays.
texts.en: Ngulu is a brave shop owner and member of the Tupatane business group.  She is an entrepreneur, dynamic, 32 years old, and mother of six children, four of which attend school while two are still too young.  Ngulu sells pagne cloth.  She displays her merchandise in the city's central market. She started her business with the help of her husband, who is a teacher.  Later, she received help from an IMF Hekima loan.  She has been in business for three years.  This new loan will enable her to buy 18 pieces of pagne cloth.  She wishes to feed her children and send them to school.  Finally, she thanks Hekima for empowering female entrepreneurs not served by traditional banks, especially during this critical, post-conflict moment in time in the east of the country.

loans.use: to buy 18 pieces of pagne cloth.

loans.name: Kalamo Group

texts.fr: Mulilirwa est femme ambitieuse, membre du collectif de crédits Kalamo, cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée, âgée de 38ans, mère de 4 enfants dont 2 vont  à l’école et 2 encore gosses. Elle commença son businesse avec de fonds de reçu de Hekima. Elle est vendeuse des denrées alimentaire dans un dépôt sur la route secondaire. Elle va s’approvisionner en pommes de terre. Son conjoint est sans emploi. Elle souhaite obtenir plus des crédits pour accroitre son activité, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables. Il sied de signaler que certaines clientes portent leurs bébés.
texts.en: Mulilirwa is an ambitious woman and member of the Kalamo borrowing group, which is a client of IMF Hekima.  Mulilirwa is married, 38 years old, and mother of four children, two of which attend school while two are still too young.  She started her business with funds received from Hekima.  She sells food products from a stall on the secondary road. With this loan, she will buy potatoes.  Her spouse is unemployed. She wishes to obtain more loans to grow her business and pay for food and school fees for her children.  Finally, she thanks Hekima for supporting entrepreneurs not served by traditional banks. It should be noted that certain members are carrying their babies (in the photo).

loans.use: to buy potatoes.

loans.name: Monalisa

texts.en:
Monalisa is 40 years old, married, and has five children, four of whom are currently in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 7 years. 

Monalisa has requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients and materials for her business. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients and materials for her business

loans.name: Lukman

texts.en:
Meet Lukman, a single man who lives in Indramayu, a small city located in the north coast area of West Java. He runs a small shop that sells mobile phones, phone accessories, phone credit and utility bill payment services for his customers. He began working with microfinance organisation Ruma two months ago because he wanted to increase his income. 
Lukman feels really excited about expanding his business in selling mobile phone credit. Nowadays, he can process up to 75 transactions per day. He hopes to take out a Kiva loan for working capital that will enable him to do even more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: to increase the working capital of his mobile phone business

loans.name: Ulep

texts.en: Ulep runs a small stall that sells snacks, drinks, mobile phone airtime credits, and utility bill payment services. Ulep lives with his wife and their three children in Tasikmalaya, a city located at the southeast of West Java. He was introduced to Ruma by one of Ruma's staff who visited his stall, and he quickly became interested in joining Ruma. Nowadays, he can process 40-79 transactions per day.  As the business continues to grow, he hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva to enable him to process more airtime sales on the weekends. This loan would help him running the mobile airtime business and consequently support his plan to seek more business opportunities in the future. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone airtime credit and utility bill payment transactions on weekends

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Mariées uniquement dans des ménages polygamiques, les quatre membres du groupe Danaya ont en moyenne 42 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Banconi-Flabougou l’un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu à Banconi-Flabougou. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, produits alimentaire (bonbons, lait en poudres, sucres…), bleues colorantes et des parures. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Bintou  (femme arrêtée en 2ème position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse des produits alimentaires (bonbons, lait en poudres, sucres…). Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 4 paquets de bonbons, 2 sacs de lait en poudre et 3 sacs de sucre en gros à Bamako. La revente se fait en détails à Banconi-Flabougou à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Bintou compte avoir avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 150 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et satisfaire les petits besoins du foyer.
texts.en: The four members of Danaya Group are married and all living in polygamous households. They have an average age of 42 and they have an average of three children.  They all live in Banconi-Flabougou, one of the neighborhoods in Bamako. The met through neighborhood ties and their income-generating businesses in Banconi-Flabougou.  The group members run small businesses selling food (candy, powdered milk, sugar), blue dye, and ornaments.  To increase their working capital, the group members decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their third loan.  Ms. Bintou, second from left to right in the photo, is a big seller of food products (candy, powdered milk, sugar, etc.)  She plans to use her loan to buy four packages of candy, two bags of powdered milk, and three bags of sugar in bulk, in Bamako.  She will resell retail in Banconi-Flabougou to a clientele of mostly women.  Ms. Bintou expects to earn an average monthly profit of 150,000 FCFA that will be reinvested in her business and used to meet the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy food (candy, powdered milk, sugar).

loans.name: Omar Dario

texts.es:
Omar se desempeña exitosamente en su negocio de cerrajería y soldadura de metal, siendo una persona muy reconocida en el barrio por su buen trabajo y servicio. 

Ya que ha laborado 8 años con los conocimientos que adquirió por medio de su trabajo en distintos talleres, ha tenido la oportunidad de mantener su trabajo y ha intentado mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia. 

Por esta razón quiere solicitar un crédito para la compra de herramientas para facilitar su trabajo como un equipo de soldadura y algunas herramientas manuales.

Con estos elementos podrá continuar prestando su servicio ya que la herramienta que utiliza esta en mal estado y hay otra que le hace falta.

Actualmente es soltero y vive con sus padres a los cuales siempre trata de ayudar económicamente para que puedan sustentar su hogar y mejorar su vida. 

Su mayor sueño es poder tener un gran taller con varios empleados y poco a poco podrá lograr su objetivo. 

Ayuda a un joven emprendedor con ganas de salir adelante con un préstamo!
texts.en:
Omar is successful in his business as a locksmith and metal solderer. He is well-known in the local area for his good work and service.

As he has worked in different workshops for eight years and acquired knowledge of this trade, Omar has been able to keep up his business and tried to improve his family's quality of life.

As a result he is currently applying for a loan in order to buy tools that will make his work easier. Omar will buy items such as a soldering iron and some hand tools.

Omar is applying for a loan in order to buy these items.

Omar is currently single and lives with his parents, whom he tried to help financially so that they can support the household and improve their lives.

Omar's biggest dream is to have a big workshop with a number of employees; he can achieve this dream step by step.

Loan to Omar and help a young entrepreneur with a desire to get ahead!

loans.use: to buy a soldering iron in order to improve his word and be more efficient for his customers.

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is 32 years old, married, and has six children, all of whom are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur who has a repair shop business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years. 

Roselyn has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional tools and equipment for her business. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional tools and equipment for her business

loans.name: Nicolás Ambrosio

texts.es:
Nicolás de 59 años de edad, estudio hasta 3° grado, desgraciadamente por la pobreza de sus padres, ya no pudieron ayudarle para que continuara estudiando, esta casado y no tiene hijos y solo vive con su esposa quien es agricultora.

Desde la edad de 12 años inicio a trabajar en la agricultura junto a su padre y sus hermanos, también a la edad de 18 años trabaja como ayudante de albañilería. Ahora es un buen albañil y ayuda a su esposa en la siembra de maíz y frijol. También posee una pequeña tienda de donde obtienen ingresos adicionales, para cubrir con los gastos del hogar.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar semilla de frijol, pesticidas, herbicidas, para sembrar un área de 3,500 mts de cultivo de frijol, de esta forma, podrán asegurar este producto para su alimentación.

El sueño de Nicolás es tener hijos y a la vez le gustaría estudiar en la nocturna, para formarse academicamente, ya que la falta educación la ha traído muchas dificultades, también le gustaría mejorar su vivienda y crecer en el negocio de la tienda.
texts.en:
Nicolás is 59 years old and has a third grade education. Unfortunately, given that his parents were poor, they could not help Nicolás to continue studying. Nicolás is married. He has no children and lives just with his wife, a farmer.

Nicolás started working in farming with his father and siblings when he was twelve years old. At the age of 18, he also started to work as a building labourer. Now he is a good builder, and helps his wife to grow corn and beans. Nicolás also has a small shop from which he earn an extra income to cover household costs.

This loan from CrediCampo will be used to buy bean seeds, pesticides and weed-killers in order to grow beans on 3500 square metres of land. This loan will provide food for Nicolás and his wife.

Nicolás' dream is to have children. He would also like to attend night classes in order to have some academic training as having little schooling has caused him many difficulties. Nicolás would also like to make improvements to his home and expand his shop.

loans.use: to buy bean seeds, pesticides and weed-killers in order to grow beans on 3500 square metres of land.

loans.name: Dionisia

texts.en:
Dionisia is married and works hard to support her family with her food vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a 9,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more ingredients.

Dionisia has been in this business for 20 years now and would like to build and expand it to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an overstitch sewing machine to provide a job and increase clothes production.

loans.name: Ariane

texts.en: Ariane is taking up computer programming at St. Paul Colleges Foundation. She wants to finish her studies to find a good job and help her parents. Paying for her tuition fees is hard as they do not have enough money. That’s why she is requesting 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) of financial assistance from KIVA lenders. She is hopeful that lenders will approve her loan so she can continue pursuing her studies.

loans.use: to pay for her tuition fees

loans.name: Saeti

texts.en:
Saeti is 56 years old and married. She lives with her husband and two sons. She has five children but three children are already married and living with their spouses. Her husband is a food supplier, he sells and delivers food to shops.

She has asked for a loan from KPP-UMKM Syariah of 8,000,000 Rupiah. This loan will be used to improve access to water and sanitation for their family. She will build a bathroom, septic tank and water closet in their home. 

The sanitation will help her and her family to have better health. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank all of the lenders.

loans.use: to build a bathroom, septic tank and water closet in their home.

loans.name: Maryani

texts.en:
Maryani is 35 years old and married. She lives with her husband and their children. She has 5 children but two of the children are already married and living with their spouses. Her husband is a conductor so every day her husband helps public transport drivers to ask for fares from passengers.

She has asked for a loan from KPP-UMKM Syariah of 8,000,000 Rupiah. This loan will be used to improve access to water and sanitation for their family. She will build a bathroom, septic tank and water closet in their home. 

The sanitation will enable her and her family to have better health. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank all of the lenders

loans.use: to build a bathroom, septic tank and water closet in their home.

loans.name: Adam

texts.en: Adam lives with his wife and their two children in Garut, the capital city of Garut regency located in West Java. Adam runs a small stall that sells groceries, mobile phone airtime credits, and utility bill payment services. He was introduced to Ruma by one of Ruma's staff who visited his stall and he quickly became interested in joining Ruma. Nowadays, he can process up to 40 transactions per day. As the business continues to grow, he hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva to enable him to process more airtime sales on the weekends. This loan would help him run the mobile airtime business and consequently support his plan to seek for more business opportunities in the future. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone airtime credit and utility bill payment transactions on weekends

loans.name: Sa'anah

texts.en:
Sa'anah is 37 years old and married. She lives with her husband and their children. She has one son (10 years old) and one daughter (4 years old). Her husband is an employee in a factory where he works checking items to be exported.

She has asked for a loan from KPP-UMKM Syariah of 8,000,000 Rupiah. This loan will be used to improve access to water and sanitation for their family. She will build a bathroom, septic tank, and water closet in their home. 

The sanitation will means she and her family will have better health. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank to all of the lenders.

loans.use: to build a bathroom, septic tank, and water closet in their home.

loans.name: Murni

texts.en:
Murni is 45 years old and married. She lives with her husband and three sons. The three sons have already graduated from high schools. Her husband is a trader. He trades coconuts in the market.

She has asked for a loan from KPP-UMKM Syariah of 8,000,000 Rupiah. This loan will be used to improve access to water and sanitation for their family. She will build a bathroom, septic tank and water closet in their home. 

The sanitation will enable her and her family to have better health. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank all of the lenders.

loans.use: to build a bathroom, septic tank and water closet in their home.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is 53 years old and married with six children. She works very hard to provide for them and has been running a general store in the Philippines for four years, selling grocery items such as canned goods, soft drinks, noodles, coffee, sugar and juice.

Francisca has requested an 8,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy more groceries for her store. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell

loans.name: Usna

texts.en:
Usna is 45 years old and married. She lives with her husband and their children. She has one daughter (18 years old) and one son (10 years old). To support the needs of her family, she usually sells food every day such as meatballs, chicken noodles and other dishes. She is happy to be able to help her husband to improve their life. 

She has asked for a loan from KPP-UMKM Syariah of 8,000,000 Rupiah. This loan will be used to improve the family's access to water and sanitation. She will build a bathroom, septic tank and water closet in her home. 

The sanitation will help her and her family to have better health. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank all of the lenders.

loans.use: to build a bathroom, septic tank and water closet in her home.

loans.name: Edison

texts.en:
Edison is 18 years old and from Paniqui, Tarlac, in the Philippines. He is planning to study a course in Automotive Servicing at college.
Edison has four siblings and his family makes a living from farming. Sometimes their income is not enough, especially because it is seasonal. So for Edison to be able to go to college, he wants to receive a 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) educational loan from KIVA lenders.

loans.use: to pay for his tuition fees

loans.name: Maura Erenia

texts.es:
Maura de 42 años de edad, es una mujer luchadora. Vive con su compañero de vida quien se dedica a prestar sus servicios como vigilante en varios lugares desde hace 10 años, y un hijo de 23 años que es empleado en una distribuidora de bebidas, quienes le ayudan con los gastos del hogar.

Maura es una mujer, humilde, trabajadora y muy responsable. Desde hace 10 años se ha dedicado al comercio (tienda) y también le gusta la crianza de animales domésticos  tales como gallinas, patos, cerdos y vacas, ya que con esta crianza da animales ayuda a mejorar la dieta alimenticia dentro del hogar y recoge algunos ingresos para sus gastos personales

El préstamo que está solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para cancelar un crédito que tiene, ya que le cobran demasiado alto el interés y lo demás lo invertirá en la compra de productos varios para surtir más su pequeña tienda.



En un futuro Maura quiere extender aún más su tienda, para tener más productos que ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Maura, 42, is a persevering woman.  She lives with her life partner (who has earned a living for 10 years offering security services in various places) and her son, 23 (who is employed in a beverage distributorship), both of whom help her with the household expenses.

Maura's a modest, hardworking, and very responsible woman.  She has earned a living in commerce (a store) for 10 years.  She also likes to raise domestic animals such as hens, ducks, pigs, and cows because it helps improve her household's nutrition and brings in some income for her personal expenses.

The loan she's requesting from CrediCampo is to pay back a debt, because the interest they charge her is too high.  She'll invest the rest in a variety of products to stock her little store.

Maura wants to expand her store even more in the future so she has more products to sell to her customers.

loans.use: to pay back a debt and to buy products to stock her store

loans.name: Valeria Andrea

texts.es: La joven Valeria es muy trabajadora, casada madre un niño pequeño, su esposo es Mecánico de profesión, ella se dedica a la actividad comercial, vende Ropa Usada, desde hace dos años aproximadamente, su mayor sueño es poder tener una Tienda donde pueda exhibir su mercadería para obtener mayores ganancias, con el crédito que se la financiado comprara tres pacas una para niños, adultos y hombres, para vender mas y captar nueva clientela, Agradece el apoyo que Kiva en conjunto a Afodenic le están brindando.
texts.en:
The young Valeria is very hard-working, a married mother of a little child. Her husband is a mechanic. She makes a living from commerce. She sells used clothing. For approximately two years, her greatest dream has been to be able to have a store where she can show her merchandise to make a larger income. 

With the loan that has been funded to her, she will purchase three packs of clothing: one for children, one for adults, and one for men, to sell more and gain new clientele. She is thankful for the support that Kiva, in conjunction with Afodenic, is providing to her.

loans.use: to purchase packs of used clothing.

loans.name: Ma. Cerevil

texts.en:
Ma. Cerevil is 43 years old, single, and has three children.   She is separated from her husband.  Two of her children are currently in school.  She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Ma. Cerevil has a tailoring business in the Philippines. Ma. Cerevil has requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF, to buy more fabric, threads, zippers, buttons, etc. for her business.

Ma. Cerevil has been in this business for 7 years. In the future, Ma. Cerevil would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fabric, threads, zippers, buttons, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a lumber business in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 8000 through NWTF, to purchase additional lumber and materials for sale.  Gemma has been in this business for 5 years. 

Gemma earns additional income from food vending.  Gemma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF.  She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional lumber and materials for her business

loans.name: Altansukh

texts.en: Mr. Altansukh, 23 years old, lives with his parents in Ulaanbaatar,capital city of Mongolia. Just after graduating from his university, he began working as teller at a bank. His parents run a grocery store next to their house. The house they live in has deteriorated over the years and needs some serious repair. So he is requesting a loan of 3000000 MNT to buy building materials such as bricks, cements and planks for house renovation. After renovation, his family will live in a comfortable and warm place, where less coal is burned and less pollutants are released into the air. The borrower is a very young, hardworking individual.

loans.use: to renovate his house in order to burn less coal for heating

loans.name: Willard Anderson

texts.es:
Willard es un joven emprendedor, tiene 24 años de edad, es soltero y vive en San Juan de Lurigancho junto a su familia.
Es una persona con muchas ganas de salir adelante, por iniciativa propia comenzó su negocio de venta de ropa y le va muy bien porque ofrece productos de calidad, es muy trabajador y amable con los clientes. Sus padres son su mayor motivación para salir adelante, es por ellos que lucha constantemente para mejorar su calidad de vida.
Willard está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá comprar mercadería por temporada de invierno, de esta manera sus ventas mejorarán, tendrá más productos para ofrecer Y de esta manera seguirá luchando por el bienestar de su familia y más adelante poder tener su propia empresa de ropa.
texts.en:
Willard is a young entrepreneur. He is 24 years old, single, and lives in San Juan de Lurigancho along with his family.

He is a person with a great desire to succeed. Through his own initiative, he began his business selling clothing, and it is going very well for him because he offers quality products. He is very hard-working and kind to his customers. His parents are his greatest motivation to succeed. It is for them that he constantly struggles to improve their quality of life.

Willard is very thankful to the Kiva lenders because, with the support that they have provided to him, he will be able to purchase merchandise for the winter season. In this way, his sales will improve, he will have more products to offer, and with this, he will continue fighting for the well-being of his family and to later be able to have his own clothing business.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for a business that sells clothing.

loans.name: Ian Dominic

texts.en: Ian Dominic is taking up Computer Programming in St. Paul Colleges Foundation. His dream is to find a stable job and help his parents with their finances. Their family is struggling financially, so to be able to achieve his dream, Ian is requesting a P10,000 educational loan from the KIVA lenders. It will be used to pay his tuition fee.

loans.use: to pay for his tuition fee

loans.name: Edliza

texts.en:
Pictured above is Edliza, a small farmer based in Zamboanga del Sur. The 38-year-old has been a farmer for over four years. Edliza is a native of Zamboanga del Sur. She is currently growing and selling rice.

Edliza has joined GDMPC, to apply for a loan of 7,000,000 Philippines pesos to purchase fertilizer. This wife and mother of one child, will use this loan to expand and improve her farm, to make additional income. She wants to have a comfortable living with her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Claudio

texts.en: Claudio is a 50 year old, who lives in Siquijor. He works hard to survive and to meet the needs of his family. His primary source of income is fishing. In order to expand his business and acquire more capital, he joined the Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative. He is grateful to Paglaum because his most pressing financial needs have been met. Now he is applying for a loan to buy a 2nd hand motor boat unit for fishing. He believes he can look forward to a comfortable life in the future, if he can expand his business.

loans.use: to buy a 2nd hand motor boat unit for fishing

loans.name: Supatmi

texts.en:
Supatmi, her husband, and their two children live in Yogyakarta, the capital city of Yogyakarta Special Region in Java, Indonesia. To support their family, Supatmi and her husband manage a small shop that sells mobile phone airtime credits, and utility bill payment service for their customers.

Supatmi joined Ruma because she wanted to try out the mobile airtime business. She feels really excited about expanding her business. As the business runs, she hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva, in order to do more transactions on weekends. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone airtime credit and utility bill payment transactions on weekends

loans.name: Munkh-Od

texts.en: Mr. Munkh-Od, 24 years old, lives with his parents in Darkhan, second largest city of Mongolia. He began working as Vocational Training Coordinator at a training center, five months ago. His mother runs a tailoring workshop. He is requesting a loan of 4000000 MNT to buy an electric car. The advantage of an electric car is, that it emits harmless pollutants and wastes less fuel. He will use his car for his office commute, which is quite a long distance.

loans.use: to buy an electric car in order to emit less pollutants and save money

loans.name: Jeana

texts.en:
Jeana has mastered her hog raising business in Larena. This is how she makes a living and is able to support her family. 

She was at her lowest point when she didn't have enough capital for her business. When she joined PMPC, she was truly grateful to receive credit to fully support her business. Just as she takes care of her hog raising business, so with her membership with PMPC. She wants to maintain her membership in good standing so she can always run for any financing needs. 

Now, the loan will help her build a concrete pig pen that would support sanitation and care for the environment.

loans.use: to build a concrete pig pen.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 50 years old and married with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Jocelyn has a general store in the Philippines. Jocelyn requested a PHP 11000 loan amount through NWTF, in order to purchase more items like snack foods, canned goods and other groceries for her store.

Jocelyn has been in this business for 18 years. In the future, Jocelyn would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more snack foods, canned goods and other groceries.

loans.name: Kimsorng

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of the Kampong Thom province’s Sandan district, Kimsorng is a 28-year-old single man who has been making a living through growing cassava for 10 years. The current business earns him about US $6 per day to support his living. 

This is the first loan for Kimsorng with VisionFund. Now he is asking for a loan to pay his school fee. He hopes this loan will enable him to get a good job after graduation.

loans.use: to pay his school fee.

loans.name: Yuleydis

texts.es: Yuleydis  de 23 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de comidas rápidas en el municipio donde habita. Hace 2 años inició su negocio de origen familiar, pues pertenecía a  su hermana, quien terminó vendiéndoselo, porque se dedicó a otra actividad. Yuleydis  había aprendido y tenía ahorros con los cuales lo compró el negocio de su hermana y hoy su meta es hacerlo crecer. Los principales productos de su oferta son las papitas, perros calientes y carnes azadas, productos que vende de contado, dese las 6 de la mañana hasta las 11 de la noche a vecinos del sector y transeúntes. Su meta es mejorar la imagen del negocio y la calidad de vida de su familia, pero su mayor desafío es lograr fuentes de financiación para alcanzar sus metas. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento  que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará pan harina, papa y carnes. Con esta inversión incrementarán la productividad porque tiene mas insumos y esto representa mas ingresos, lo que hace que esta inversión impacte positivamente el negocio de Yuleydis.
texts.en:
Yuleydis is 23 years old. She makes a living selling fast foods in the municipality where she lives. Two years ago, she began her business through her family. It belonged to her sister who ended up selling it to her because she made a living from another activity. Yuleydis had learned and had savings with which she purchased the business from her sister, and now her goal is to make it grow. 

The main products that she offers are potato chips, hot dogs, and roasted meats, product that she sells for cash from 6 in the morning until 11 at night to neighbors in the sector and to passers-by. Her goal is to improve the image of the business and the quality of life of her family, but her greatest challenge is to find sources of funding to reach her goals. 

Currently, she is applying for a Kiva loan, her first loan that she has taken out from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, through which she will purchase bread flour, potatoes, and meat. With this investment, her productivity will increase because she has more supplies and this represents a higher income, which makes this investment impact Yuleydis’s business positively.

loans.use: to purchase bread flour, potatoes, and meat.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is 58 years old and married with nine children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Aida has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Aida requested a 14000 PHP loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell.

Aida has been in this business for thirty years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Zubaida's Group

texts.en:
Zubaida, 59, is a mother of five children, living in Lahore, Pakistan. She is very hard working, gracious and an honest person. Her husband owns a small tea stall in which he sells tea. He has been running this stall for many years and earning little profit from this business.

Now, he wants to establish his business by purchasing plastic furniture and tea cups etc. Due to household expenses his savings are not enough to buy these things. Therefore, Zubaida has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner brac Pakistan, so that her husband can buy plastic furniture, tea cups and milk. She thanks kiva and appreciates the warmth support to her family.

loans.use: To buy milk, plastic furniture and tea cups.

loans.name: Honorato

texts.en: Honorato is 54 years old. He is known in the Lazi, Siquijor area for his fishing activity. He is actively participating in the various programs and services that the co-op offers. He hopes to live comfortably, with a decent house, for which he applied for a loan to purchase plywood, nails, and sticks. He hopes to maintain his membership in good standing with a good repayment record. It matters that he has been given a priority as a microfinance member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC). He is thankful that all his business financing needs are supported by PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase plywood, nails, and sticks for his house.

loans.name: Maria De Los Santos

texts.es: María tiene 42 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su madre y sus dos hijos de 20 años y 9 años de edad. Ella es una mujer emprendedora quien se dedica a la al negocio de tienda desde hace mucho tiempo. El negocio de tienda lo tiene en su hogar de habitación  es así como lleva el sustento en su hogar. Gracias al crédito que recibió de FUSAI en el pasado ha logrado mantener su negocio activo y con la visión de seguir brindando sus productos de tienda y mejorar sus ventas e ingresos solicita nuevamente este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de productos de tienda como: cereales, golosinas, bebidas frías, café,azúcar, sal y de más productos demandados por sus clientes.
texts.en: María is 42 years old and lives in her own house with her mother and her two children who are 20 and 9 years old. She is an entrepreneurial woman who has made a living in the shop business for many years. She runs the business out of her home and that is how she supports her household. Thanks to the loan she received from FUSAI in the past, she has succeeded in keeping her business active. With the vision of continuing to provide her store products and improving her sales and revenue, she is requesting another loan from FUSAI to invest in the purchase of store products such as cereals, candy, cold drinks, coffee, sugar and other products demanded by her customers.

loans.use: buy cereals, candy, cold drinks, coffee, sugar, salt, etc.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen, age 40, is a responsible mother living happily in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.
 
Her husband deals in scrap goods at home because he does not have a proper place to continue this business. He has been running this business for many years, and a lot of scrap is scattered in his house. He has to construct a room for a sibling, and this is the reason not enough space remains for the scrap business.
 
Therefore, Nasreen has requested a loan for her husband, so that he can hire a scrap shop to continue his business and make some savings to meet sudden needs or incidents.
 
Nasreen thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to hire a shop for her husband to continue his recycling material business.

loans.name: Sarwa Wiguna Group

texts.en:
Ni Ketut is the head of the Sarwa Wiguna group.  She makes her daily living as a pig farmer. And now she has a new business as a canteen owner at a school. She lives with her husband. 

Ni Ketut worked on developing her pig business by borrowing 2,000,000 IDR from MUK.  From the sale of her pigs in this period, Ni Ketut managed a profit of 750,000 IDR. This gain was very helpful as the family's finances are currently experiencing difficult times due to increasingly expensive necessities of life.

Ni Ketut, along with the Sarwa Wiguna group, decided to continue loaning from MUK as this has been especially helpful in developing the pig business. Ni Ketut wants to increase her pig business by keeping pigs for a local pig barbecue. She needs a new loan to purchase three pigs and feed. She will also buy some merchandise for her canteen. The pigs, used in pigrolls, are usually only kept for 2-3 months and then are sold. Her husband supports her business by helping her feed the animals and clean the barn. Ni Ketut saves her profit because she has a dream to renovate her kitchen.

One member couldn't attend the meeting because of illness.

loans.use: to purchase three pigs and feed.

loans.name: Daya Pertiwi Group

texts.en:
The Daya Pertiwi group is receiving a loan of the same size as before. As one of the groups that received the most loans from MUK, the purpose of the group is venture capital. This has been evidenced from the cessation of two members because they have been able to manage the business well and continue with their own capital. Other members still need new loans for their businesses because they have a strong will to become successful pig breeders. The loan will be used to improve their businesses by purchasing superior piglets or sows. To replace the two members, the group received two new members.

Dewa Ayu is using the loan to buy three superior piglets. She has a plan to maintain them for fattening. Her husband helps her business by finding  traditional feed such as banana leaves everyday from his garden. With this business, she hopes she can save and renovate her kitchen. 

One member is not in the picture because she attended her brother’s funeral ceremony

loans.use: to buy three superior piglets.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es: Lucila de 56 años, habita con su esposo y sus hijos adultos en un municipio cercano a la ciudad de Barranquilla. Allí desde hace 20 años inició su negocio comercial, mediante el cual vende ropa, accesorios femeninos, perfumería etc. Utilizando el sistema de crédito a clientes ubicados en la comunidad donde habita. Desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche, Lucila trabaja con el fin de mejorar sus ventas e incrementar sus clientes  y lograr aun más calidad de vida. Su mayor desafío es conseguir fuentes de financiación, para lograr sus propósitos;  por eso se ha acercado a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo a solicitar su primer financiamiento, mediante el cual comprará ropa, accesorios y perfumería. Con esta inversión mejorarán sus inventarios y su negocio también, haciendo de su credikiva una exitosa inversión.
texts.en: Lucila is 56 years old and lives with her husband and her adult children in a municipality near the city of Barranquilla. She started her business there twenty years ago, through which she sells clothing, feminine accessories, perfume, etc, using the credit system for customers located in her neighborhood. From 8 o'clock in the morning to 8 o'clock at night, Lucila works with the purpose of improving her sales, increasing her customers and achieving a better quality of life. Her greatest challenge is finding sources of financing to achieve her goals. Because of this she has approached Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to request her first loan, with which she will buy clothing, accessories and perfume. With this investment she will improve her inventory and her business too, making her Kiva loan a successful investment.

loans.use: to buy clothing, accessories and perfume

loans.name: El Sol De Cupiche Group

texts.es: El grupo “EL SOL DE CUPICHE” está conformada por socios dedicados al comercio minoristas y a prestar servicios. Juana tiene 36 años de edad es soltera con 01 hijo dependiente. Ella se dedica a su negocio de lavadero de carros y a la vez a tiene su restaurant en donde ofrece desayuno almuerzo y cena golosinas bebidas. Años atrás se dedica a la venta de ropa. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de arroz azúcar aceite al por mayor para tener u stock  para su restaurant. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Juana es la segunda del lado izquierdo
texts.en: The group “El Sol De Cupiche” is made up of members who make a living in retail trade and by providing services. Juana is a 36-year-old single mother with one child. She makes a living by running a car wash and also has a restaurant where she offers breakfast, lunch, dinner, candy and drinks. Years ago, she made a living by selling clothing. She will use the loan to invest in the purchase of rice, sugar and oil at wholesale to have a supply for her restaurant. The group thanks Kiva investors for the loan provided. Juana is the second from the left.

loans.use: buy rice, sugar and oil at wholesale.

loans.name: Francisco Reymundo

texts.es: Francisco solicitó un crédito el cual sería usado para empezar la remodelación y construcción de las puertas de su vivienda, les instaló verjas, para poder estar junto a su familia en una casa más segura. Con este nuevo crédito pretende terminar esa obra que comenzó, quiere cambiar las puertas de madera, ya que las que actualmente tiene están en un muy mal estado. La mejora que puede observar en su casa ha sido grande, ya que de pasó de ser de madera a concreto, y otras mejoras más, y esto lo ha logrado a través del esfuerzo de su trabajo como guarda de seguridad.
texts.en: Francisco is requesting a loan which would be used to begin to remodel and construct the doors of his house, installing metal grills so he and his family can be more secure in their house. With this new loan he wants to complete the work that he has started changing the doors on his house as the ones he has are in very poor condition. The improvement that you can see in the house are great as it has gone from being constructed from wood to concrete and other improvements too. He has managed this through his efforts at work as a security guard.

loans.use: to finish repairing the door of his house.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 49 years old and a native of Lazi, Siquijor. She has a fishing business that she is hoping will eventually grow and develop so that she can save more for the family.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 4,000 to purchase more kilos of fish to sell. She said that if they have a good catch, they can easily repay her investment from it. She is so thankful to Paglaum because of the trust they have given her.

loans.use: to purchase more kilos of fish to sell

loans.name: Ana Cecilia

texts.es: Ana es una persona muy trabajadora, tiene 38 años de edad, es soltera y vive en Ica junto a su familia. Gracias al apoyo de sus padres estudió la Carrera de Biología y hoy ejerce su profesión en una prestigiosa empresa. Su mayor motivación en la vida son sus padres, es por ellos que siempre ha luchado para poder brindarles un futuro mejor. Ana está muya agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá comprar una refrigeradora para regalarle a su mamá. De esta manera podrán guardar sus alimentos y mantenerlos por más tiempo apto para su consumo. Así estará mejorando la calidad de vida de su familia y luchará para poder más adelante poder abrir su propio negocio.
texts.en: Ana is a hard-working  38 year old. She is single and lives in Ica with her family. Thanks to the support of her parents she studied Biology and today works in her profession in a prestigious company. Her main motivation in life is her parents and it is for them that she always struggles to provide them with a better future. Anna is very grateful to the lenders at Kiva as thanks to their support she will be able to buy a refrigerator to give to her mom. By doing this they can store their food and keep it longer in condition to eat. This will improve the quality of living for the family and Ana will strive to be able to open her own business in the future.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator for her house.

loans.name: Purevtsetseg

texts.en:
Purevtsetseg, 39 years old, lives with her husband and two sons in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been working as an accountant at a private firm she founded together with her colleagues since 2006. Her husband works for a coal mining company. Their sons go to high school. 

She is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT to buy building materials such as bricks, cement and fiberglass for house renovation as her house has become deteriorated over the years. After renovation, her family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned and then fewer pollutants are released into the air.

loans.use: to buy building materials for house renovation in order to burn less coal.

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en:
Shehnaz is 49 years old and lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has grown old and stays at home. She is the mother of three children. 

To feed her family, she sews bags along with her two daughters and a son. She has two sewing machines, for sewing school and hand bags, which are operated by her daughters. Her son takes orders from the customers. Bags are sewn on order.

Shehnaz wants to sell her bags directly at the market, so that she can get maximum reward for their efforts. But she does not have initial capital to buy raw materials for making the bags.

Shehnaz has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, in order to buy raw materials such as Rexine, zippers, buckles, etc. for sewing purses and bags.

She thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as Rexine, zippers, buckles, etc. for sewing purses and bags.

loans.name: Omar Mauricio

texts.es:
Omar es un hombre joven de 20 años de edad soltero sin hijos y se dedica a la reparación y mantenimiento de computadoras.
Él es emprendedor, entusiasta, divertido, amable, responsable, decidido y muy trabajador. Su trabajo lo realiza a domicilio dentro de su ciudad. Él tiene un anuncio en el periódico que indica su nombre y teléfono, recibe llamadas de clientes y se apersona a la dirección que le indiquen con su mochila llena de herramientas y software.
Omar es de tez morena, estatura mediana, cabello corto negro, su lengua natal es el español a diferencia de sus padres que hablan aymara. Sus estudios los comparte con su trabajo, él sueña realizar una buena carrera para poder trabajar de manera profesional y mejorar sus ingresos económicos. La necesidad que enfrenta en este momento es la falta de una computadora para poder estudiar y titularse.
Es por esos motivos que Omar solicita un préstamo para la compra de una computadora y poder terminar sus estudios superiores.
texts.en:
Omar is a 20 year old young single man and doesn’t have any children.  He repairs and maintains computers.

He is an enthusiastic, happy, friendly, responsible, dedicated, and hardworking entrepreneur and works within the city.  He advertises in the paper, which includes his name and phone number.  He gets calls from customers and he arrives with his backpack full of tools and software.

Omar has an olive complexion, medium height, and short black hair.  Spanish is his native language, which is different from his parents who speak Aymara.  He attends school at the same time he works and his dream is to have a good career so he can work professionally and improve his income.  This means that he needs a loan to buy a computer so he can study and graduate.

He is asking for a loan to buy a computer so he can complete his higher education.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Rotchcil Ann

texts.en: Rotchcil Ann is single and lives with her parents in Zamboanga del Sur. Her parent is a government employee and earns enough for their daily living. She has seven siblings and only one of them has their own family. Some of them are still her parents' dependents. She studies in the university, taking up Bachelor of Science in Hotel  and Restaurant Management. She keeps moving forward to achieve her goal of finishing her studies since she wants to have a better career in the future.

loans.use: to pay school tuition fees for the semester

loans.name: Bayanmunkh

texts.en: Mr. Bayanmunkh, 38 years old, lives with his wife and two daughters in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. He has been working as an engineer at a construction site since 2010. His wife is an assistant hair dresser. As the new academic year begins, his elder daughter is advancing to tenth grade but he has no cash for his daughter's tuition. So he is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT to pay for tuition. From the profile picture, you can see Mr. Bayanmunkh and his family.

loans.use: to pay for tuition

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion is 57 years old and married. She works very hard to provide for her family.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell like bread, chips, soft drinks, canned goods, etc.

Concepcion has been in this business for 5 years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell like bread, chips, soft drinks, canned goods, etc

loans.name: Faride Esther

texts.es: Faride recibió anteriormente un credikiva, con el que le fue bien pues logró comprar mercancías variadas, con las que respondió a su clientela.  Con esta inversión pudo mejorar la imagen del negocio porque se incrementaron sus inventarios.  Desde que recibió su crédito su microempresa mejoró estructuralmente  impactando su calidad de vida. Ella Dice a sus financiadores de Kiva: Muchas gracias por su apoyo y espero seguir contando con ese apoyo”. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva nuevamente,  para aumentar una vez mas sus inventarios de ropa accesorio y útiles escolares, ajustándolos a la temporada para tener un nuevo éxito con su inversión.
texts.en:
Faride received a loan previously via Kiva, which went well for her since she bought varied merchandise to meet her customers' needs.  Through this spending she was able to improve her business image because her inventory was larger.  After receiving a loan, her small business improved structurally, affecting her quality of life positively.    She says to the Kiva lenders, " Many thanks for your help, and I hope to keep counting on that assistance."

Now Faride is applying for a loan again. to once more increase her inventory of clothing, accessories and school supplies.  She will tailor her choices to the time of year in order to have new success with her investment.

loans.use: to buy clothing, accessories, and school supplies

loans.name: Chhovy

texts.en:
A villager from the Kampong Cham province’s Dambae district, Chhovy is 43 years old and married with two children, who are still in school. To make a living, she has been working as a nurse and supplementing the income by growing cassava for 12 years. She can earn about US $20 per day to meet the family’s needs. 

Chhovy is just with VisionFund for this cycle and now she is asking for a loan to pay for her daughter’s school fees to study nursing. She hopes her daughter will find a better job after graduation.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter’s school fees to study nursing

loans.name: Anwar

texts.en:
Anwar lives with his wife and their 3-year-old daughter in Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. Anwar runs a small stall that sells mobile phones, mobile phone accessories, mobile phone airtime credits, and offers utility bill payment services. He was introduced to Ruma by one of his neighbors and he quickly became interested to join Ruma. 

Anwar realized that he has to increase his income to support his family. Nowadays, he can process up to 75 transactions per day.  As the business continues to grow, he hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva to enable him to process more airtime sales on the weekends. This loan would help him run the mobile airtime business and consequently support his plan to seek more business opportunities in the future. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone airtime credits and utility bill payment transactions on weekends

loans.name: Gunay

texts.en: Gunay is a 25-year-old married woman with two sons. Gunay is an IDP (internally displaced person). She is a farmer who raises seasonal fruits and vegetables. She is a skilled person in this field with six years of experience. Her husband is a builder, but his salary of 100 AZN is too low to cover the family's needs. He helps her with the farming. Gunay usually sells her crop in the central bazaar every two weeks. People use fresh vegetables every day and consider them healthful. Many national dishes are made of vegetables, like pilau and dolma. Fresh fruits are served at every table in Azerbaijan and are also used to make fresh punch. Her monthly income is 230 AZN. She needs additional capital to invest in seeds, fertilizers and new garden tools. This will allow her to improve the quality of products she raises and increase her monthly turnover. For this purpose she applied for 1,500 AZN. This will be her 5th loan and she has a good client history.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and new garden tools

loans.name: Mika

texts.en: Mika is a first year student from Paniqui, Tarlac studying Computer Programming at St. Paul Colleges Foundation. She has five siblings. She wants to finish her studies to be able to help her parents and siblings. She wants to access an educational loan of P10,000 from KIVA lenders through ASKI’s SNPL program so that her parents won’t have difficulties in paying her tuition fees. She is hopeful that lenders will approve her loan, for this will help her in chasing her dreams.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fee

loans.name: Lennie Rose

texts.en: Lennie Rose has two siblings and her parents are working as farmers. She often helps them work in their farm for a living. She studies in the university, taking up Hotel and  Restaurant Management. She joined GDMPC and has recently borrowed a new loan to pay her school tuition fees for the semester. She is thankful to GDMPC for helping students pursue their ambition to become a better person in the future through education.

loans.use: to pay her school tuition fee for the semester

loans.name: Jethela

texts.en:
Jethela is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell frozen foods business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of frozen foods to sell for her business.

Jethela has been in this business for 7 years. She earns more income from selling clothes.

Jethela has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of frozen foods to sell

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 64 years old and married with five children.  With  children in school, Lucia works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to purchase stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, etc.

Lucia has been in this business for eight years. 

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, etc

loans.name: Safia

texts.en: Safia is 41 years old, married and a mother of four. She is a hard-working and responsible person. As their family income was low, she started sewing clothes in order to contribute to her family. Through this business she has become empowered to pay for her family's daily  expenses. She sews clothes for her customers in the local community. She works seven days a week. After successfully completing a loan cycle with BRAC Pakistan, she has applied for a second loan through BRAC Pakistan to buy a new sewing machine as the old one is not functioning properly due to depreciation.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Sagrada Familia Group

texts.es:
Sagrada Familia es un grupo que viene trabajando hace 10 ciclos de manera unida y conjunta. Son mujeres jefas de familia, que luchan por sus hijos. Las integrantes tienen capacitaciones y seguimientos. 
Zunilda integra este grupo, ella es una persona muy trabajadora y luchadora que está luchando día a día para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia. Ella se dedica a las ventas, ya que tiene una despensa que con mucho sacrificio ha montado y que hoy dia ya tiene una clientela bien formada.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de verduras, frutas, panificados, enlatados, y demás, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo. Esta agradecida por la oportunidad que esta recibiendo y que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
“Sagrada Familia” (Sacred Family) is a group that has worked together for 10 loan cycles in a united and cooperative manner. The members are the heads of their families and strive on behalf of their children. They receive training and monitoring.

Zunilda is a member of this group. She is a hardworking and determined individual who strives each day to improve her living conditions and that of her family. Zunilda works in retail. She has a food pantry that she started with great sacrifice. Today her clientele is already well-established.

Zunilda is requesting a loan so that she can invest in the purchase of vegetables, fruits, baked goods, canned goods, and other products. This will enable her to continue her sales just as before. She is grateful for the opportunity she has received since it will be of great help.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, fruits, baked goods, canned goods, and other products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers and herbicides for his crop.

loans.name: Supaldo

texts.en:
Salpado lives with his wife and their two children in South Bandung, a regency area in West Java. He runs a small stall that sells snacks, drinks, mobile phone airtime credits, and a utility bill payment service. He was introduced to Ruma by one of Ruma's staff who visited his stall and Salpado quickly became interested in joining Ruma. 
Nowadays, he can process 75-150 transactions per day.  As the business continues to grow, he hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva to enable him to process more airtime sales on the weekends. This loan would help him in running the mobile airtime business and consequently supporting his plan to seek more business opportunities in the future. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone airtime credits and utility bill payment transactions on weekends

loans.name: Musviq

texts.en:
Musviq is 28 years old, married, and has a daughter. Musviq is an IDP (internally displaced person). He lives with his parents because he has  not enough funds to buy a new home. For this reason he is working every day  without rest. From a young age he learned all about farm work, thanks to what his parents taught him and the main crop being farmed  is fruit. It's going well for him because he has lots of experience in this field and he sells high quality produce. His monthly income is 180 AZN. 

Musviq usually sells his  crops to the local market vendors. People use fresh fruits every day and consider them healthy. Fresh fruits are served on every Azerbaijani family's table and also used to make fresh punch.  His wife helps him a lot in raising his crops. Musviq   applied for a loan of 1200 AZN to buy more seeds and fertilizers. This will be his  first loan.

loans.use: to buy more seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Las Divinas Group

texts.es:
Este es un grupo nuevo, está en su primer ciclo, cada una tiene la idea de poder crecer y mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de sus familias.
Una persona que se destaca es la Sra. Alicia, quien es la tesorera de este grupo, ella se dedica a hacer y vender comidas de todo tipo, y en lo que le está yendo muy buen pues tiene muy buena clientela. Ella pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos varios para sus comidas, como ser verduras, carne, hortalizas y demás, de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
This is a group that is in its first loan cycle. Each member joined with the idea of being able to grow and improve their living conditions and those of their families.

One person who stands out is Sra. Alicia, the treasurer of this group. She prepares and sells food of all types. Alicia is doing very well and has a good clientele. She is requesting a loan in order to buy various supplies for her dishes such as greens, meat, vegetables, and other products. This will allow her to continue her work just as before.

loans.use: to buy greens, meat, vegetables, and other supplies.

loans.name: Remely

texts.en: Remely is a new member of Paglaum Multipurpose Cooperative in Siquijor.  She wish to access the various products and services of the Cooperative.  She and her husband are full-time tricycle operators for 10 years already.  Now, she is applying for a loan to finance the repair of their motorcycle and the renewal of the annual registration. Her plan after this loan is to exchange her motorcycle for a new and additional one in order for long-lasting operation. That should lead them to a higher quality of life and be helpful for their children's future.

loans.use: To pay for motorcycle repair and renewal of registration

loans.name: Oyuntsetseg

texts.en:
Mrs. Oyuntsetseg, 23 years old, lives with her mother in Darkhan, the second largest city of Mongolia. Her father left her and her family a long time ago. Her mother has raised her all on her own. Her mother, with the help of Oyuntsetseg, succeeded in running the pharmacy for 14 years. 
Currently her mother is working at a medical college and Oyuntsetseg herself is running the pharmacy. She is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT (Mongolian Tugrik) to buy drugs, tablets and antibiotics in large amounts. By doing so, she can continue to run her business without worrying about inventory shortages.

loans.use: to buy drugs, tablets and antibiotics in order to continually run her pharmacy

loans.name: Lucita

texts.en:
Lucita works hard to support her family. Lucita is married and has a candy-making business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like flour, sugar, milk, etc.

Lucita has been in this business for five years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like flour, sugar, milk, etc

loans.name: La Zambrano Group

texts.es:
Don VIDAL desde hace 19 años vive con su compañera sentimental. Cuando iniciaron su relación su compañera tenia 6 hijos de un primer compromiso. Hoy todos tienen su propia familia. VIDAL tiene un hijo también de un primer compromiso. En la unión de hecho no tiene hijos pero son muy felices criando 2 nietos de 9 y 7 años ya que sus padres se encuentran en proceso de separación.
Los niños van regularmente a la escuela que queda a 5km de distancia de su casa (viven en un sector marginal).  
Don VIDAL desde muy temprana edad trabaja en el cultivo de la tierra y no tuvo oportunidad de estudiar por la falta de escuelas en el pueblo donde vivía . Don VIDAL tiene 65 años de edad se dedica a limpiar fincas y terrenos. En acuerdo con sus vecinos y compañeros decidieron realizar un crédito en FODEMI con el propósito de sembrar coco y criar pollo.  Con el crédito anterior se dio inicio a esta actividad que será fortalecida con este nuevo crédito.
Comprara más semilla de coco y una nueva especie de pollos y gallinas ponedoras  con sus respectivos alimentos para continuar y crecer en esta actividad.
Desea conseguir a futuro- un galpón grande donde pueda criar un número considerable de pollos.
Agradece la oportunidad que da FODEMI a la gente de escasos recursos en el Ecuador.
Nuestra comunidad no cuenta con servicios de agua potable y alcantarillado. La escuela queda a 3km y el centro de salud a 5km.
Todos los integrantes de este grupo se caracterizan por ser gente amable - servicial – y muy colaboradora.
texts.en:
VIDAL has been living with his partner for 19 years.  When they began this relationship, she had six children from a previous marriage.  They don’t have any children together but they are very happy raising two grandchildren, ages 9 and 7, while their parents are in the process of separating.

The children attend school, located 5km from the home (they live in a marginal sector).

VIDAL has been cultivating the land since he was very young.  He didn’t have the opportunity to attend school due to a lack of schools in the area where he lived.  VIDAL is 65 years old and clears land and farms.  He and his neighbors and co-worker decided to ask for a loan, though FODEMI, in order to plant coconuts and raise chickens.  He used the previous loan to start these activities and will use this loan to strengthen it.

He will buy more coconut seed and a new species of chicken and laying hens, along with feed so that they can continue this activity.

He wants to buy a large chicken coup in the future so he can raise more chickens.  He is grateful to FODEMI for helping people of scarce resources in Ecuador.  Our community doesn’t have running water or sewage.  The school is located 3km away and the health center is 5km away.

All the members of this group are known for being gentle, friendly, service-minded people who cooperate very well.

loans.use: to buy coconut seed and chickens.

loans.name: Nargis' Group

texts.en:
Nargis is a 45-year old lady; she is living with her spouse, three daughters and two sons in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.
 
Her husband is a turner by profession and manufactures vehicle spare parts. He has been operating a lathe machine for many years and can easily renew or manufacture the spare parts of various vehicles. His lathe machine is out of order and some tools have become worn out due to continuous use, which is why they need replacement.
