She has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for renovation of the workshop and purchase a sewing machine.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
La socia Carmen continua dedicándose al negocio de  venta de productos de primera necesidad en su tienda de abarrotes, la socia  lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día su negocio, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando  a su familia.
La socia Carmen solicita el préstamo para comprar gaseosas, arroz entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida con el apoyo brindado y por el crédito otorgado  y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de las cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Carmen has a business selling basic need items in her grocery store. Her business is going well thanks to the hard work she puts into it every day. She is very responsible and hard-working. She wishes to be able to continue working and in this way continue supporting her family.

Carmen seeks a loan to buy soda pop, rice, and other items. She is very grateful for the provided support and for the loan, and promises to make the established payments.

loans.use: to buy soda pop, rice, and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer to maintain his cocoa crop.

loans.name: Valarpirai Shg - Idaiyanallur Group

texts.en:
Kavitha (featured borrower) and twelve of her friends hail from Idaiyanallur village of Tanjore District in Tamil Nadu. All of them are working to help supplement their family income. These women, apart from working hard all day long, also need to labour in front of the traditional “chulha” stoves while cooking. These stoves emit a lot of smoke, which is a health hazard for the whole family and especially the women. Also, the families need to spend an average of Rs. 200 for the firewood and additional expenses towards medical needs.

So, Kavitha and her friends have approached People’s Action for Transformation (PAT), MicroGraam’s field partner, which promotes fuel-efficient cookstoves as part of their energy initiative. The benefits of the Greenway cookstove are fuel savings, using all solid fuels, minimized emissions of CO and CO2, fast and convenient cooking, and high durability; they are also maintenance-free and smokeless. The stove operates on all solid fuels, such as wood, agro-waste, charcoal, coal, and dry dung, and does not require any refurbishing or recurring cost.

In order to buy these cookstoves, Kavitha (holding a board with the SHG group name) and her friends have formed the Valarpirai Self-Help Group and are seeking a group loan of INR 1,400 each, which is repayable in easy installments. Your loan will not only help these women in preventing respiratory diseases, but also help the environment.

loans.use: to buy a fuel-efficient cookstove.

loans.name: Naheed's Group

texts.en:
Naheed, 32, lives with her husband and four children in the area around Lahore. She and another woman form this group asking for a joint loan of 70,000 PKR through BRAC Pakistan.

To earn an income for his family, Naheed’s husband, a young and energetic person, has a business selling tires. He wants to expand his business, but he doesn’t have sufficient cash in hand to buy more stock. Therefore, Naheed humbly requested the above-mentioned loan, which will be divided between this group’s two members.

Very happy this loan, Naheed wishes to thank Kiva and its lenders for their support.

loans.use: To buy tires to sell

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
La socia sigue dedicándose al negocio de venta de cereales, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia continua vendiendo trigo, cebada entre otros, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
 La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de trigo entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Gregoria has a business selling grains. She is a responsible and hard-working woman. She sells wheat, barley, and other grains. She wishes to continue working and in this way support her family.

She seeks a loan to buy wheat and other items. She is thankful for the loan and promises to make the loan payments.

loans.use: to buy wheat and other items.

loans.name: Martin

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal "LAS LEONAS DE SAN JERONIMO",el banco está situado en el distrito de San Jeronimo,provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
El socio Martin continua trabajando como maestro de obra para las distintas obras que solicitan sus servicios, él socio es una persona responsable y empeñoso, siendo de esta manera que el socio saca adelante a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para la compra de martillos entre otros tipos de herramientas.
EL socio se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Martin belongs to the communal bank called "LAS LEONAS DE SAN JERONIMO", located in San Jeronimo district in Cusco province and state. Martin works as a independent contractor for various worksites that seek his services. His is responsible and diligent, supporting his family.

He seeks a loan to buy hammers and other kinds of tools. He is thankful for the awarded loan and promises to make the established payments.

loans.use: to buy hammers and other tools.

loans.name: Solaya

texts.en:
Solaya is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell dried coconut meat business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of dried coconut to sell for her coconut meat business.

Solaya has been in this business for eight years. She earns additional income from buying and selling nipa roofing.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Solaya has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock for her dried coconut meat business.

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en:
Bahati is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has electricity and piped water.

Bahati sells meat to neighbors and passersby. Her biggest challenge in her business is the undependable nature of the seasons.

Bahati decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. She is applying for a 50,000 KES loan, which she will use to buy additional meat to sell at a profit.

loans.use: to purchase meat for resale at a profit.

loans.name: Mohby

texts.en:
Mohby began her own business of farming four years ago. She lives in an agricultural region of Tajikistan, where people mainly are busy with farming and animal husbandry. 

Mohby grows cotton and vegetables. She had worked on a collective farm before, so she has great experience in this way. Mohby’s husband and daughter-in-law help her with growing vegetables and cotton. She makes two sowings in a year. 

Mohby is going to make a second sowing, and with this aim, she is asking for a loan of 2,000 US dollars to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers, and to pay for rental workers. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers, and to pay for rental workers.

loans.name: María Carmen

texts.es:
La socia continua dedicándose al negocio de restaurant, la socia elabora diferentes tipo de platos para sus clientes que le solicitan, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante  a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de arroz, aceite entre otros.
 La socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
María Carmen continues to work at her restaurant. She makes various dishes to meet customer demand. This is how she supports her family.

María Carmen is asking for a loan to buy ingredients such as rice and oil. She is grateful for the loan and promises to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as rice and oil.

loans.name: Khalida

texts.en:
Khalida is a 47-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of four children. 

Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. He has been running an auto rickshaw for the last ten years. For the past many days, his rickshaw is not working properly because of regular use. He feels that most of its parts are out of order. So, he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to buy a new auto rickshaw. However, due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of new rickshaw. 

Therefore, Khalida has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to help her husband to cover the cost of a new rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Khalida is so much thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new auto rickshaw for her husband.

loans.name: Kubra

texts.en:
Kubra is 55 years old, married and the mother of seven children. She lives with her family in Lahore.

Kubra’s daughter runs a beauty parlor in her community. With ten years of experience in this field, her daughter is known for her quality services. She offers services such as haircuts, coloring and styling, facials and makeup. She is skilled and talented and has made many loyal customers.

Currently Kubra’s daughter wants to attract more customers and make sure she retains her existing clientele. She would like to add supplies to her beauty parlor such as creams, bleaches, dyes, makeup kits, a hair dryer, manicure pedicure kits, a warmer, etc. To help her with this, Kubra has requested a 50,000 PKR loan from BRAC Pakistan to do so.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her daughter's beauty parlor

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more fruit to sell at her business

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is a married woman. She has two children. She operates a retail business, where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a good area, and her primary customers are individuals. She says her biggest business challenge is a lack of financing. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock, namely, clothes.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Sosote  (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
En Sosote localizada a unos pocos kilómetros de la ciudad de Portoviejo, ciudad de gente dedicada en gran parte a la agricultura y al cultivo y venta de cocos se reúnen cada quince días el Grupo De Crédito Sosote. Los mismos que se dedican a diversas actividades tales como el comercio de comida, venta de productos de belleza y prendas de vestir. Ellos unieron sus esfuerzos para poder acceder a los beneficios que presta la Fundación Espoir.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la señora Jacqueline, tiene 43 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 23, 22  y 16 años, el menor estudia en colegio. El marido es cerrajero.
Doña Jacqueline es una mujer muy luchadora que le gusta trabajar para salir adelante y con sus ganancias  ayudarle a su marido con  los gastos del hogar y los estudios de su hijo, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa y ropa interior de la marca Leoniza, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella sale a recorre por la localidad vendiendo sus prendas las mismas que tienen mucha salida ya que es ropa que se la envían del extranjero por lo cual sus ventas son muy buenas y rápidas, lleva 6 años con este negocio el cual espera mejorarlo con los créditos.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa de todo tipo. Este es su primer ciclo en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos  y sin tantos requisitos. Sus sueños son tener un local para vender sus productos.
La foto pequeña es de un socio que no pudo estar presente cuando se tomo la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
In Sosote a few kilometers from Portoviejo, a city whose inhabitants are primarily farmers and who sell coconuts, every 15 days the Grupo De Crédito Sosote meets. The members have diverse business such as selling food, selling beauty supplies, and selling clothing. They united in their efforts to be able to access the benefits that Fundación Espoir provides.

One of the members of the group is Jacqueline. She is 43 years old, married, and has three children ages 23, 22 and 16. The youngest is in high school. Her husband is a locksmith. Jacqueline is a very hard-working woman who likes to work and in this way support her family into the future. With her earnings she helps her husband with the household expenses and her child's education expenses. She sells clothing and Leoniza undergarments. She sells door to door in her neighborhood. Her customers buy for themselves as well as to send abroad, as the quality is very good and she delivers product quickly. She has had this business for 6 years and hope to continue expanding it through loans.

This loan is to buy all kinds of clothing. This is the first loan cycle for this Group, and she enjoys that the loans are quickly granted with few barriers. Her dreams are to have a locale to sell her products.

The small photo is of a member who couldn't be present when the group photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Quinter

texts.en: Quinter is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself as business-oriented. She operates a retail business, where she sells fish. She has been involved in this business for seven years. Her business is located in a marketable location, and her primary customers are the general public. She says her biggest business challenge is insufficient funds. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of fish. Her business goal is to have a bigger business, within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a successful family and business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fish.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be hardworking. 

She operates a tailoring business where she makes clothes. She has been involved in this business for three years. She describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy a tailoring machine and fabrics. Her business goal is to own a big tailoring shop within five years. She will use the anticipated profits to buy more tailoring machines.

loans.use: to buy a tailoring machine and fabrics.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair his motorcycle.

loans.name: Benigna

texts.en: Benigna lives in a town that is about 81 kilometres from the capital. She is a businesswoman, so she always finds ways to improve her business. Benigna has a kiosk that she opened many years ago. She started to do business with her own working capital of $ 350.00. She is also selling bread, fried bananas, and doughnuts. She will use the loan to buy goods to keep in her store, such as cane milk, biscuits, candies, sugar, coffee, and flour.

loans.use: to buy inventory for her store, including biscuits, coffee, and flour.

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel is 35 years old and a married woman who has two children. She has run a general store for five years. She earns income from this, that helps to meet the family's needs. Her husband is earning by providing transportation services.

To increase sales, Rachel borrowed a loan from GDMPC. She will use the loan to purchase additional grocery products to sell. She wants to expand her business, as well as improve the general living standard of the entire family in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery products to sell

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en: Everlyne is a married woman. She has three children. She operates a tailoring business, where she makes clothes. She has been involved in this business for eight years. Her business is located in a marketable location, and her primary customers are the general public. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of tailoring materials. Her business goal is to have a bigger tailoring shop, within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a stable business. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tailoring materials.

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 20 years, now.

She requested a PHP 9000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan funds to purchase fishing net.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fishing net

loans.name: Unión Y Fortaleza  (Montecristi) Group

texts.es:
EL Grupo de crédito Unión Y fortaleza se reúne cada quince días en Montecristi  conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla. Este grupo está integrado por 10 mujeres y 2 hombres. Este es un grupo personas muy humildes y trabajadoras que al enterarse de los beneficios que les brinda la institución decidieron unirse tiempo atrás  y formar este grupo el cual les ha ayudado mucho para salir adelante. Se dedican a diversas actividades tales como la artesanía, comercio en general, entre otras actividades.
Forma parte de este grupo la señora Nelly, tiene 62 años de edad, esta casad y de esta relación tiene 6 hijos mayores de edad, uno de ellos aun viven con ella. Su marido es maestro jubilado. 
Doña Nelly  y su esposo tienen una tienda de víveres en su casa, la tiene bien surtida con muchos productos de primera necesidad así como también con ciertos productos de bazar y papelería, en su negocio sus clientes encuentran de todo, razón por lo cual su clientela es muy buena y ella por su parte les brinda el mejor servicio junto a su esposo que le ayuda en su negocio, llevan más de 5 años con su negocio el cual lo comenzaron una vez que su marido se jubilo, este les permite salir adelante.
Este crédito es para comprar víveres para surtir su tienda. Este es su primer ciclo en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque ahora con los créditos esperan mejorar su negocio. Sus sueños son seguir aumentando su tienda cada vez más.
texts.en:
The "Unión Y Fortaleza" (Union and Strength) group meets fortnightly in Montecristi, which is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its handicrafts, which are recognised at a national and international level. It is the birthplace of the famous Panama hat. This group consists of 10 women and 2 men, who are very humble and hard-working. When they found out about the benefits of the institution, they decided to form the group some while ago, and it has been a great help in helping them to succeed. They work in different jobs such as crafts and commerce in general.

Nelly is a member of this group. She is 62, married, and has 6 grown-up children, one of whom still lives with her. Her husband is a retired school teacher. Nelly and her husband run a grocery shop from their home, which they stock well with many basic items, as well as various household products and stationery. Their customers find everything and anything in their shop, which is why they have a really good clientele. For her part, Nelly provides the best service she can, together with her husband, who helps her in their business. They have had the business, which they set up when her husband retired, for more than 5 years. This is how they have managed to get ahead..

Nelly is asking for this loan to buy supplies to stock her shop. This is her first loan cycle with the credit group. She likes it because they hope to improve their business through the loans. Their dream is to continue to grow their shop more and more.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Ismoil

texts.en:
Ismoil, who was born in 1996, lives with his mother. A very clever boy, Ismoil graduated from high school with excellent marks and was one of the best students in his school. He likes math, computers, geography and other subjects. His hobby is playing basketball, and his classmates liked him very much. He is purposeful and hardworking.

This year Ismoil has applied to the Economic University, the Faculty of Management. Because his mother, a worker, has too small an income to pay for his studies, Ismoil is requesting a loan to help pay his tuition. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To pay for tuition

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself to be hardworking. 

She operates a retail business where she sells fish. She has been involved in this business for four years. She describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of fish. 

Her business goal is to be successful within five years. She will use the anticipated profits to expand the business.

loans.use: buy more stock of fish.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a married man. He has one child. He describes himself as a risk-taker. He operates a butchery, where he sells meat. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located in a competitive area. He says his biggest business challenge is a lack of good storage for meat.

He will use the KES 70,000 loan to buy more stock of meat. His business goal is to have high returns, within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have a stable business. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of meat.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a married man. He has five children. He describes himself as focused. He operates a retail business, where he sells fish. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a vibrant location, and his primary customers are of all kinds. He says his biggest business challenge is a lack of capital.

He will use the KES 60,000 loan to buy more stock of fish. His business goal is to buy a fridge to store fish, within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will buy land and build rental houses.. This is his fifth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fish.

loans.name: Linet

texts.en:
Linet is a married woman. She has five children. She describes herself as hardworking. She operates a retail business, where she sells fish. She has been involved in this business for five years. She says her biggest business challenge is a shortage of fish.

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of fish. Her business goal is to be a large supplier, within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fish.

loans.name: Molly

texts.en: Molly is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be hardworking. She operates a retail business where she sells fish. She has been involved in this business for four years. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a shortage of fish. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of fish. Her business goal is to be a large supplier within five years. She hopes that in the future she will be successful.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fish.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a married woman. She has 4 children. She describes herself to be hardworking. She operates a retail business where she sells cereal and drinks. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. She describes her biggest business challenge as price fluctuation. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more stock of cereal. 

Her business goal is to own a large cereal stall within 5 years. She hopes that in the future she will expand the business and be successful.

loans.use: buy more stock of cereal.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 26 years old and married with one child in school. Teresita works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell.

Teresita has been in this business for three years. 

In the future Teresita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Basher

texts.en:
Basher is a 28-year-old married man. He studied until secondary education, but he couldn't complete his study. Basher lives with his family in their own house in Dhamar city, Yemen. 

Basher is an employee in the army with a small salary. Also, he has a taxi and works as a driver to transport people from one place to another to earn money to help him in improving the living condition of his family. 

The house where he lives with his family was without enough home appliances and furniture, and most of these were very old. Basher purchased many of them. These things cost him a lot of money. Now, he wants to purchase the rest of the furniture for the house, but he doesn't have enough money to do that. For this reason, Basher applied for a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase the rest of the furniture for his house to make the house more comfortable and suitable for living.

Basher looks forward to opening a savings account with AMB in order to help him to provide his family with a better future.

loans.use: to purchase the rest of the furniture for his house to make it more comfortable and suitable for living.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more stock of bananas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of meat.

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en:
Sharon is a married woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself to be hardworking. She operates a retail business where she sells books and spare  parts. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. She describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuation. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more books and spare motorcycle parts. 

She hopes that in the future she will own a big shop. She will use the anticipated profits to open a bigger spare parts shop.

loans.use: to  buy more books as well as spare motorcycle parts.

loans.name: Zubaida

texts.en:
Zubaida is 52 years old and a mother of five children. She is a housewife. Her husband runs a spare parts business in a busy market area. He sells different types of auto spare parts. He has been running this business for over seven years. His business has grown over the years and helped him cover his expenses effectively.

Zubaida has requested a loan in order to help her husband to purchase different kinds of auto spare parts for reselling. The extra income from this loan will allow him to take care of his family's welfare. In the future, he plans to expand his business. They thank Kiva for their support!

loans.use: to help her husband purchase auto spare parts, for resale at his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials such as cement, sheet metal, and doors.

loans.name: Edill

texts.es:
Edill es de la ciudad de Luque, está estudiando la carrera de Medicina, es empleado de una firma, y también cometa que sus padres son comerciantes.
Su sueño es llegar a terminar su carrera especializarse en Pediatría y algún día montar un consultorio para poder ayudar a las personas que necesitan atención en su salud.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su universidad, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios, ya que tiene una carrera muy cara.
texts.en:
Edill comes from the city of Luque. He is studying a medicine degree and is an employee at a company. He also says that his parents are shop-keepers. His dream is to finish his degree, specialising in Paediatrics, and one day to set up a consultancy to be able to help people in need of medical attention.


Edill is asking for this loan to be able to pay his university fees, and in this way to continue with his studies, as his degree course is very expensive.

loans.use: to pay for university fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more shoes, fragrances, blouses, and cosmetic products to sell.

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en:
Brenda is a 52-year-old, married woman, and the mother of three children. She is trying hard to provide for their needs, including food, health care, clothing, and education. She is in the retail business, selling grocery goods in their village. Her husband is earning by operating a PUJ [public utility jeepney, for passenger transport]. Brenda earns a good amount of income to support the household's expenditures.

In order to grow her business in the near future, she has requested a loan to buy more grocery goods to sell. She expects this to boost her earnings and profits. In the future, she wants to improve the general living situation of the family.

loans.use: to buy more grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a single man. He describes himself to be focused. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a busy market area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be bad weather. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to service his motorcycle and fuel it. He hopes that in the future he will alleviate poverty. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to service his motorcycle and fuel it.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to service his motorcycle and fuel it.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 44 years old and married. She has two children She works very hard to provide for them, running a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 15 years.

She has requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF. She will use the borrowed funds to purchase more stock to sell at her store, like soap, shampoo, eggs, milk, and sugar.

In the future Rosemarie would like to save money, to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell, like soap, shampoo, eggs, milk, and sugar

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline appreciates for the previous loan that helped her expand her business.

For the past three years, she has operated a clothes and shoes business, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of stiff competition in her business. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future.

With the loan that she is requesting of 20,000 KES, she wants to purchase bales of clothes and shoes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Jehad

texts.en:
Jehad is a 25-year-old single man, living with his family in a rented house in the capital city of Sana'a, Yemen. He is a university graduate. Now, Jehad is an employee in the public sector. The salary that he receives from his job is not enough to cover all the expenses of his family.

He is a talented and responsible professional young man. He has a high determination inside himself to go ahead to improve the living standards of his family and to prepare his house with all the needs that the family wants. From this side, He decided to start his own business beside his work in the public sector. So he wants to purchase a taxi to work as a driver to transport people from one place to another in the city. This will help him earn more money in order to provide his family with a better future. 

Jehad believes that this business will be very profitable for him and he can earn a lot of money. Unfortunately, Jehad's current salary is not enough to purchase the taxi he needs. As a result, he applied for loan of 1,000,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase a taxi as another income source for his family.

Jehad looks forward to purchasing another taxi in the future and renting it with a monthly salary to earn a lot of money that will help him in make a better future for his family. He hopes to open a saving accounts with AMB.

loans.use: to purchase a taxi as another income source.

loans.name: Aurora

texts.pt: A Senhora Aurora é casada e vive com o marido e 3 filhos.  Ela é avicultora  e gestora de um centro infantil. Com o presente empréstimo quer adquirir pintos, racções. Tem  sonho de grande fornecedora de ovos para as grandes pastelarias. Tem como desafios terminar a construção dos aviarios e conquistar o mercado
texts.en: Aurora is married and lives with her husband and three children. She raises chickens and works as a supervisor at a daycare center. With this loan, she plans to buy roosters and chicken feed.  Her dream is to become a major supplier of eggs to the big bakeries. Her challenges are in completing construction of her coops and in establishing herself in the market.

loans.use: to buy roosters and chicken feed.

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es:
Alberto es una persona que se esta esforzando por poder salir adelante y ser un profesional exitoso, esta estudiando la carrera de contabilidad, y comenta que por medio de su préstamo anterior de kiva pudo pagar las cuotas de su carrera, lo que le fue de mucha ayuda.
Hoy pide un nuevo préstamo ya que quiere poder cubrir los gastos de su tesis, pues está a punto de terminar su carrera y necesita de esta ayuda.
texts.en:
Alberto is a person who is making an effort to be able to get ahead and be a successful professional.  He is studying Accounting, and says that through his previous loan from Kiva he was able to pay his education costs, which was a lot of help.

Currently, he is asking for a new loan since he wants to be able to cover the costs of his thesis, as he is at the point of finishing his studies and needs this help.

loans.use: to pay for the cost of his thesis to finish his studies.

loans.name: Carina

texts.pt: A Senhora Carina é casada, vive com o marido e 3 filhos.  Ela é negociante. Com o presente empréstimo quer adquirir material de construção tais como tijoleiras, azuleijo e portas. Tem  sonho construir um condominio habitacional. Tem como desafio ter um financiamento
texts.en: Carine is married and lives with her husband and three children. She is a vendor and with this loan she wishes to buy construction materials such as clay tiles, azuleijo tiles, and doors. Her dream is to build a comfortable home. Her major challenge is in securing financing.

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as clay tiles, azuleijo tiles, and doors.

loans.name: Alvaro

texts.es:
Alvaro es del chaco, actualmente está viviendo con sus Abuelos. Trabaja en una expendedora de combustibles hace dos años.
Él quiere cumplir con su meta de ser un contador exitoso, para luego llegar a cumplir con su sueño que es de llegar a tener su propio negocio de Estudios Contable para también así llegar a culmina uno de sus meta de llegar a tener su propio hogar.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en las cuotas de su facultad, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en: Alvaro is from Chaco and currently lives with his parents. He has worked in a gas station for the past two years. He wants to obtain his goal of being a successful accountant and then fulfill his dream of having his own Accounting business. That would allow him to achieve his goal of owning his own house. He is requesting this loan to invest in his university tuition and by doing so continue to with his studies as he has been doing.

loans.use: to pay university tuition.

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en: Sharon is a widowed woman. She has 1 child. She describes herself to be spiritual and educated. She operates a bookshop where she sells books. She has been involved in this business for 30 years. Her business is located in an urban area and her primary customers are students and institutions. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stock of books. Her business goal is to open three additional outlets within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to reinvest.

loans.use: buy more stock of books

loans.name: Linet

texts.en:
Linet is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself to be hardworking. 

She operates a retail business where she sells fish. She has been involved in this business for five years. She describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of fish. 

Her business goal is to be a supplier within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fish.

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.en:
Cresencia works hard to support her family. Cresencia is married and has a business selling sea shells in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more shells to sell.

Cresencia has been in this business for 24 years now. She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

In the future Cresencia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more shells to sell.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos es una persona muy luchadora y trabajadora que está estudiando y trabajando al mismo tiempo, ya que ve que es la única forma de poder salir adelante.
 Está estudiando la carrera de contabilidad, y es por medio de esta carrera que quiere poder llegar a ser un profesional exitoso y con ello poder ayudar a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de una notebook, que le será de mucha utilidad para sus estudios.
texts.en:
Carlos is a very persevering and hard-working person who is studying and working at the same time, since this is the only way in which he can get ahead.  He is studying Accounting, and it is through this study that he would like to be able to become a successful professional and help his family.

He is asking for this loan in order to be able to invest it in the purchase of a notebook computer, which will be very useful in his studies.

loans.use: to purchase a notebook computer for use in his studies.

loans.name: Sona

texts.en: Sona is a 33-year-old married woman with one child. She is a garment-factory worker. She has been a garment-factory worker since 2011. Her husband is 34. He’s got an electric generator and bass box set for rent. They all live in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. Together, they can earn approximately $20 per day. Now Sona would like to request a loan to buy more music instruments for rent. In the future, she is going to open a shop selling music instruments for her husband, build a new concrete house and support her children to go to university.

loans.use: to buy more music instruments for rent

loans.name: Edu

texts.pt: O Senhor Edu é solteiro, vive com a mãe e a irmã.  Ele é docente. Com o presente empréstimo quer adquirir material de construção tais como chapas de zinco, barrotes, cimento. Tem  sonho de concluir a faculdade e formar a sua própria familia. Tem como desafio terminar os estudos o mais rápido possível.
texts.en: Edu is single and lives with his mother and sister. He is a teacher and with this loan he plans to buy construction materials, including sheet metal, rafter beams, and cement. He dreams of finishing his university studies and starting a family of his own. His main challenge is to finish his studies as quickly as possible.

loans.use: to buy construction materials, including sheet metal, rafter beams, and cement.

loans.name: Ariunbold

texts.en:
Ariunbold, who is 35 years old, lives with his wife and son in Kherlen, the easternmost town of Mongolia. He has been running a building company since 2009. His wife is a policy analyst with the town administration.

His company has won a tender to repair roofs but is short on cash, so he is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT to buy building materials such as shingles, steel and planks. Using those materials, he can complete the roof repair, which can lead to getting more tenders. This is an opportunity for his company to shine.

loans.use: to buy building materials in order to complete the task of roof repair of apartment

loans.name: Katherine

texts.es:
Katherine es la menor de dos hermanas, su mama la ayuda por medio de un negocio de fabricación y ventas de productos para limpieza como detergentes, desodorantes para ambientes, suavizantes, etc., su mama es su inspiración, ya que ella es una mujer muy luchadora.
Ella está estudiando la carrera de hotelería y turismo, y es por medio de su trabajo que está procurando para poder ser alguien en la vida y salir adelante.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en sus gastos de titulación, ya que por medio de ello podrá cubrir ese gasto que tiene.
texts.en:
Katherine is the youngest of two sisters. Her mother helps her by means of a business that produces and sells cleaning products such as detergents, air fresheners and fabric softeners. Her mother is an inspiration to her, as she is a real fighter. Katherine is studying a degree in hotel management and tourism. It is by means of her work that she is trying to be someone in life and get on.

Katherine is asking for this loan to invest in paying her degree fees, as this is how she will cover this cost she is facing.

loans.use: to pay for degree fees.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en: Lolita, a widow with two children has been running a fishing business for more than four years and is earning a good living. She has successfully repaid her previous loan used for improving the business. Her children helped her in running the business. Recently, she took a new loan to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets. She wants to have a better future with her family.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of maize.

loans.name: Selpher

texts.en: Selpher is a married woman. She has one child. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells cereal. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in an area with potential for business growth and her primary customers are regular customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate finances. She will use the Kes 100,000 loan to buy more stock of cereal. She hopes that in the future, she will have an increased income and have stable living standards. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to increase stock in the business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cereal.

loans.name: Kiran

texts.en:
Kiran is 30 years old, married and a mother of three. She is a supportive and caring housewife. Her husband has a small business where he sells religious articles like holy books, tasbih, religious magazines, holy posters, etc. He is responsible for paying for all the expenses of the family. Their children go to school. He covers all these costs with difficulty.

Her husband is now planning to enhance his business by buying more variety of religious books and magazines and other related items to sell. Kiran has therefore requested a loan through BRAC Pakistan to help her husband in his business.

loans.use: to help her husband buy religious articles to enhance his business.

loans.name: Tobias

texts.en: Tobias is a married man. He has six children. He describes himself to be hard-working. He operates a carpentry where he makes furniture. He has been involved in this business for four years. He describes his biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of carpentry materials.

loans.use: to buy more stock of carpentry materials.

loans.name: Salma

texts.en: Salma lives in Lahore. She is a married mother of eight children. Her husband has a small dairy farm from where he supplies milk to different households in Lahore everyday. He has been in this business for more than three years. He has to work really hard in order to support his family as they have a big family. Therefore he has planned to buy another cow to generate more income. Through this he will be able to serve more households, thus increasing his sales. As he does not have sufficient income to save, his wife has applied for a loan from Kiva through BRAC Pakistan to help her husband with his business.

loans.use: to help her husband buy a new cow for his dairy farm.

loans.name: Luis

texts.pt: O Senhor Luis é casado e vive com a esposa e 5 filhos.  Ele é comerciante  e pertence ao quadro das forcas de defesa e seguranca. Com o presente empréstimo quer adquirir mercadorias tais como peixe, lulas para revender. Tem  sonho de ter uma formação superior para poder progredir na sua carreira profissional e espera um dia poder ter a sua Mini-Mercearia e tranporte pessoal. Tem como desafios aumentar o nivel de escolaridade.
texts.en: Luis is married and lives with his wife and five children. He is a vendor and also serves in the defense and security forces. With this loan he seeks to buy merchandise like fish and squid to resell. His dream is to have a better eduction so he can advance in his professional career and he hopes some day to be in a position to have his own mini-market and vehicle. His main challenges are in furthering his education.

loans.use: to buy merchandise, including fish and squid to resell.

loans.name: Iskandar

texts.en:
Iskandar is a very clever man. He comes from the northern part of Tajikistan. Iskandar is married with one child. His wife is a homemaker and has been busy with bringing up their child. Iskandar’s parents and sister also live with him.

Earlier this year, his sister applied to the Medical University. She is a first year student now. Iskandar must pay for his sister’s tuition and is asking for a loan of 1,400 USD to do so. He awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to pay for his sister's tuition

loans.name: Erma

texts.en:
Erma is 60 years old and married with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She has a buy-and-sell spices and vegetables business in the Philippines. Erma has been in this business for 21 years. She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business. 

Erma requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more stock of spices and vegetables to sell. In the future, Erma would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy-and-sell coconut wine business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 15 years now.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional gallons of coconut wine to sell. In the future, Evangeline would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional gallons of coconut wine to sell,

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina is requesting a loan of $ 800.00 to improve her business. She will use the loan to buy some additional supplies to keep in her kiosk, such as soft drinks, noodles, cigarettes, and biscuits. Regina opened her kiosk in 2008, with her own working capital of $ 250.00. She is happy with the loan that was offered from Tuba Rai Metin, for her to have more working capital to buy more goods. And with this loan, she will improve her business in the future. She also keeps animals, like cows, pigs, chickens, and goats.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell, such as noodles, cigarettes, and biscuits.

loans.name: Sughran's Group

texts.en:
Sughran is 37 years old and the mother of four children. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a housewife and looks after her family at home. Her husband works in dairy products, selling milk, curd and butter. He owns a small dairy farm consisting of buffaloes and cows. He sells milk daily to different tea stalls. He is an honest man. 

He manages his household necessities with his earnings from milk sales. He speaks in a monotone which is impressive, and he easily wins the trust of his clients. He was in need of one more buffalo to increase his income through his milk sales business. So, Sughran demanded a loan. In this way she can support her husband’s milk sale business. She thanks Kiva and the field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a buffalo for her husband's milk sale business.

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en:
Nadia is 25, married, and a mother of 2. Her husband has a garment business. He has been operating this business for 3 years, selling ready-to-wear clothes. He has to work hard with determination to have a better income. 

To improve sales, her husband wants to apply for a loan to purchase additional merchandise to increase his product inventory. This loan will help him in purchasing more quantities of men's, women's and children's clothing and other products needed in his business. They are sincerely grateful and appreciate Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for this assistance.

In the future, they hope that the business will continue to operate, grow and help with their everyday needs and expenses. They dream for their children to complete their studies.

loans.use: to enhance her husband's garment sale business.

loans.name: Thenkodiamman Shg - Kathiramangalam Group

texts.en:
Indhra, 49 years old, is a leader of the Thenkodiamman Self Help Group, which was formed by the local NGO, People Action for Transformation (PAT) in Tamil Nadu, India. She lives in Kathiramangalam village, Tamil Nadu. Indhra lives in her own house with her children and husband. Her husband is a farmer. Indhra has been taking loans from the PAT and she is regular in her repayment of the loans on time.  

Indhra wants to buy a smokeless stove for her family. The stove is manufactured by Greenway Grameen Infra Pvt, Ltd. It costs INR 1400. It is more efficient than the traditional mud stove. Traditional stoves consume more time and money. Burning of biomass fuels causes almost 500,000 deaths every year in India alone. (Source: WHO 2009). Smokeless stoves prevent sickness and deaths from indoor air pollution due to cooking activities.

Indhra and the other member of the group are requesting a loan to buy a smokeless stove and have a healthier life.

loans.use: to buy a smokeless stove

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is 46 years old and a married woman. She is mother of five children. She lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan, with her family. Her husband owns a clothing business. He has been running a clothing-sale shop in the market for the last three years. He supports his family through this clothing business. He purchases a variety of clothes from different areas, and sells them at a profitable price in the main market, from his shop. He deals with his customers politely.

Presently, he needs to purchase some more clothes to sell. However, due to a lack of financing, he is facing a problem. Therefore, his wife, Parveen, has requested a loan from Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. Parveen is thankful to Kiva lenders and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy clothing for her husband to sell, at his business.

loans.name: Gangaikaveri Shg - Kathiramangalam Group

texts.en:
Lalitha is a 47-year-old lady residing in Kathiramangalam, a small village in Tamil Nadu, India. She has five children. Lalitha is the leader of the “Gangaikaveri” Self-Help Group (SHG) with seven other women. The group has been receiving loans from the local NGO “People’s Action for Transformation” (PAT) for the last five years.

Lalitha and her group are requesting a loan to purchase a Greenway smart smokeless stove. The stove is a single burner, highly efficient cook stove designed for long-term, everyday use. The stove can use any type of solid biomass fuel including wood, cow dung and agricultural waste. It also produces 70% less smoke while using 65% less fuel than traditional mud cook stoves. Lalitha and her group have the opportunity to save time and cut a recurring fuel expense while being able to cook in a healthier environment. This stove has also been tested and certified by the Ministry of New & Renewable Energy (MNRE), Government of India.

loans.use: to purchase smokeless stoves

loans.name: Bano Bibi

texts.en: Bano Bibi is the age of 30; she is the mother of two children. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. He has been running an auto rickshaw for the last five years. From the past many days his rickshaw has not been working properly; because of this he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However due to the lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. Therefore,  Bano Bibi has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Bano Bibi is so thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to cover the repairing cost of her husband's rickshaw.

loans.name: Martolino

texts.pt: O Senhor Martolino é casado e vive com a esposa e 2 filhos.  Ele é militar. Com o presente empréstimo quer adquirir material de construção tais como chapas de zinco, barrotes, cimento. Tem  sonho de ver a sua casa totalmente reabilitada e abrir um negocio e pretende progredir na sua carreira profissional tornando-se Tenente pois agora é alféres. Tem como desafio idealizar o tipo de negócio que irá abriR.
texts.en: Martolino is married and lives with his wife and two children. He is in the military and with this loan he plans to buy construction materials like sheet metal, rafter beams, and cement.  He dreams of seeing his house completely renovated and opening a business.  He also plans to advance his career, making Lieutenant, as he is currently a sergeant. His main challenge is in refining the type of business that he will open.

loans.use: to buy construction materials like sheet metal, rafter beams, and cement.

loans.name: Janette

texts.en: Janette is single and lives with her family. She has four siblings and her father is earning with transportation services. She studies in the university, taking  classes to be an Associate in Information Technology. She wants to finish her studies in order to find a better job in the near future. Janette wants to support her family with her effort and be able to share her success with them. She used her previous loans for her studies, and she is recently taking a loan to pay her school tuition fees for the first semester of this current year.

loans.use: to pay her school tuition fees for the first semester of this current year.

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is 46 years old and married with five children, two of whom are in school, Leonida works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has been in this business for 28 years.

She requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell, like canned goods, eggs, noodles and soap, etc. In the future Leonida would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell, like canned goods, eggs, noodles and soap, etc.

loans.name: Maribe

texts.en:
Maribe is 42 years old and married with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and has been in this business for 7 years. 

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business. Maribe requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish, ice and plastic bags. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fish, ice and plastic bags.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a married mother of one child who attends school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.	

For the past three years, Eunice has operated a sales business at the market, selling clothes and shoes to her neighbours and passersby. Her business faces a major challenge of stiff competition. Eunice decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. With the loan of KES 30,000 that she is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of clothes and shoes for resale. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes and shoes for resale

loans.name: Ayat

texts.en:
Ayat is a conservative lady. For that reason, she asked her sister to take her place in the picture. Ayat is a 25-year-old single lady living in Irbid-Jordan with her family that consists of four members. 

Ayats’ family has been facing financial crisis since her father's death. Her sister Sara, who is appearing in the photo, is a university student majoring in child teaching, and she is in her third year. 

Sara’s aim is to get her bachelor's degree so that she can start helping her family financially. But she doesn't have enough money to pay for her upcoming semester fees. For that reason, Ayat wants to help her by applying for this loan.

loans.use: To pay her sister's upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Puthunilavu Shg-Andalampeetai Group

texts.en:
Rajeswari (with her hand raised) is the leader of the Puthunilavu Self Help group, which is managed by the local NGO “People’s Action for Transformation” (PAT). The group contains 13 other members from Andalampeetai in Tamil Nadu. 

Rajeswari is 52 years old and married. Her husband is a farmer by profession and they have two children.

The group has been receiving loans from PAT for the last five years. These loans have been instrumental in developing the quality of their livelihood. Due to these loans, they have been able to earn more income and are prompt in their repayments.

All the members are requesting a loan to buy a smokeless stove that lowers firewood consumption. As a result, these stoves reduce carbon emissions as well as indoor air pollution levels. This will help these women reduce fuel consumption, lower costs and create a better environment in their surrounding village.

loans.use: to buy a smokeless stove

loans.name: Omsakthi 1 Shg-Asur Group

texts.en:
Sangeetha is the leader of an Omsakthi Self-Help Group (SHG) managed by the local NGO, “People’s Action for Transformation” (PAT).   She  is married and living in Asur, a small village in Tanjore District. She is 32 years old and has a child. 

She has recently learned about Greenway Smart Stove, a sustainable stove that reduces smoke emissions up to 70%, resulting in better long-term health due to decreased inhalation of poisonous gas.

Sangeetha and the other 15 members are requesting a loan to buy this stove to give a healthier life to their families. They are extremely excited about the possibility of saving on fuel and having less smoke emissions in their houses.

loans.use: to buy smokeless stove

loans.name: Thulasi Shg - Kookur Group

texts.en:
Chitra is 40 years old and lives in her own house with her two children and husband. Her husband is a daily wage worker. They live in the village of Kookur in Tamil Nadu.

Chitra is leader of the Thulasi Self Help Group, which was formed by the local NGO, People Action for Transformation (PAT), in Tamil Nadu. The NGO  works very hard to improve the livelihood of the people in that region.

Chitra (holding the board with the SHG name) and the other members are requesting a loan to purchase a smokeless stove, which emits much less smoke and is better than the traditional mud stove. The smokeless stove is designed for daily use and is more efficient and clean. It promotes healthier lifestyles by limiting the toxic and hazardous effects of indoor pollution.

loans.use: to purchase a smokeless stove

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married mother of one child who attends school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. For the past three years, she has operated a clothes and shoes selling business, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of stiff competition in her business. 

She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. With the loan of Kes 20,000 that she is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of clothes and shoes for resale. Fatuma decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes and shoes for resale.

loans.name: Quennie

texts.en: Quennie has three siblings and she lives with her family in Zamboanga del Sur. She is a BEED student in the university, wanting to improve lives through better education. Her parents were earning by serving as government employees. She is taking a new loan from GDMPC to pay her school tuition fee for the first semester. In the future, she wants to become successful.

loans.use: to pay school tuition fees for the first semester.

loans.name: Auzenda

texts.pt:
Viúva a 17 anos, mãe de 3 filhos 2 maiores e 1 menor ainda a estudar, tem 44 anos de idade, estudou ate 7ª classe, vive na casa própria que construiu sozinha apos ter perdido marido, vive a base de negocio de venda de carne de vaca a mais de 10 anos, sua única fonte de renda e esta a repetir o credito pela 6ª vez  o qual tem investido todos no seu negocio.
Com  o empréstimo pretende comprar cabeças de gado para abater e fornecer aos seus clientes em Moamba e Maputo.
Seu maior sonho é poder comprar uma viatura que facilite o transporte da carne ate aos seus clientes.
Tem como desafio, o facto de neste momento não ter dinheiro com o qual possa comprar a viatura.
texts.en:
Auzenda, a widow for 17 years, is a mother of three and is 44 years old. Two of her children are grown and one is still in school, and she herself completed school through the 7th grade. She lives in the house that she built all on her own after losing her husband.  Her livelihood is her business as a butcher selling beef for over 10 years. This is her sole source of income and she has taken out six loans in the past, all of which she has used to invest in her business.   

With this loan she plans to buy several head of cattle to supply her customers in Moamba and Maputo. Her biggest dream is to be able to buy a vehicle that she can use to make deliveries to her customers. Her greatest challenge is that she currently does not have the money to buy a vehicle.

loans.use: to buy several head of cattle to supply her customers in Moamba and Maputo.

loans.name: Rimah

texts.en:
Rimah is a 22-year-old single man who has been distributing products for a well-known company since April 2013. The company he works at is very far from his house, which is why he uses his own car to distribute his goods and to make his transportation easier to his work.

His car is very important for him, so he is acquiring a Youth loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay for the necessary maintenance to keep the car in very good condition to cover his business needs.

Rimah hopes to improve his working level and be promoted to higher levels.

loans.use: To pay for necessary maintenance to his car

loans.name: Faton

texts.en:
Faton wants to thank all of the lenders for the previous loan. He used the first loan to renovate his house. He is still selling shoes for a low salary while his wife stays home taking care of the house and the children.

Faton's house has still an insulation problem; it loses a lot of heat. Every winter it costs a lot of money to buy the coal to keep the house warm. His family always feels cold and gets sick in the winter due to the lack of heat. Faton needs a second loan, this time to insulate his house. Renovation in this manner will allow his family to live a normal and healthy life. He really appreciates this help!

loans.use: To insulate his house which will allow his family to live a normal and healthy life.

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en:
Hadija is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has piped water but not electricity. 

She has operated a water vending business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Her dream is to have big water storage in the near future.

 With the KES 20,000 loan,  Hadija wants to purchase a water tank for storing water for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a water tank for storing water for resale

loans.name: Palmira

texts.en:
Palmira is requesting a loan of $600.00 to improve her business. She will use the loan to buy some additional supplies to keep in her kiosk such as sugar, salt, cooking oil, noodles, coffee, milk, soap, and other things to sell. 

Palmira started to open her kiosk in 2013 with her own working capital of $500.00. She is happy with the loan offered from Tuba Rai Metin for her to have more working capital to buy more goods. She is happy because the loan will improve her business in the future. She also has animals like pigs, chickens and cows.

loans.use: To buy sugar, salt, cooking oil, noodles, coffee, milk, soap, and other things.

loans.name: Omsakthi 2 Shg-Rajagiri Group

texts.en:
A group of 15 women is named Omsakthi Self-Help Group in, Rajagiri, a tiny village in Tanjore, Tamil Nadu. Most of their fellow villagers, including these 15 women, work during the days as laborers in nearby industries and farms. They make just enough money to return to a home in the evenings and feed themselves and be able to repeat the same thing all over again the next day. 

It is harder for the women, who also attend to the myriad domestic chores, such as cleaning and washing and cooking. Apart from the physical exertion, it is the lack of respite from the dust and smoke, at work and at home, that takes a toll and makes them susceptible to health hazards. Lung diseases are extremely common.   

PAT (Micrograam’s partner) works to address part of the problem. They promote clean, energy-efficient cooking stoves, so that, at least while cooking, the women’s exposure to soot and smoke is minimized. The stoves use dung, agro-waste, etc., as fuel and so, have low CO2 emissions. They are also very cheap to run and help save significant amounts of money, so Suganthi (featured borrower) and her group have decided to buy these stoves for which they requesting the loan. 

They are all married and most have young kids. They know it is imperative that they offer their kids as healthy a life as possible, so they can grow up and extricate their families from the poverty spiral they are trapped in. The women do not have enough money to buy these stoves outright. They seek to borrow the requisite amount and repay it back within the time.

loans.use: to buy a smokeless stove

loans.name: Razia

texts.en: Razia is 60, married, and a mother of 3. She is loving and caring towards her children. Her husband has a general store in their community. He is the sole earner in the family and wants to expand his business. Razia is requesting a new loan to help her husband buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock his general store. This purchase will help him to better meet the needs of his customers. She hopes that this new loan will assist her husband in increasing sales, and will also help him to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her husband's general store

loans.name: Claudina

texts.en: Claudina lives in Same and most of her daily income is from selling cows. She is now applying for a loan of $800.00. Claudina started her business a few years ago with her own working capital. With her ​​husband, she was going to add money to their principal amount to buy another cow, to improve their business, because it has become their activity. She is happy with the loan that was offered from Tuba Rai Metin for her to have more working capital to buy more cows in the future.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Elias

texts.pt:
Vive maritalmente, tem 33 anos de idade, de nível básico, pai de 1 filho ainda sem idade escolar, vive na casa própria e esta a repetir o crédito pela 3ª vez , é trabalhador dos Caminhos de Ferro de Moçambique e conta com ajuda da esposa negociante.
Com o empréstimo pretende comprar: um jogo de sofás, uma estante e mesinha de centro para mobilar a sua casa.
Ele tem a esperança de poder comprar uma viatura e melhorar as condições de vida de sua família.
A insuficiência de fundos é o seu maior desafio.
texts.en:
Elias, age 33, is married and father of one son who's not yet old enough for school. He lives with his wife in his own house and works for Mozambique Railways. He also relies on the support of his wife, who is a vendor. 

This will be his 3rd loan and with it he plans to buy a sofa set, a bookshelf, and coffee table to furnish his house.  His dream is to buy his own car and improve his family's living conditions. Lack of funds is his main challenge.

loans.use: to buy a sofa set, bookshelf, and coffee table to furnish his house.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet appreciates the previous loan that helped her expand her business.
	
For the past three years, she has operated a clothes and shoes selling business, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of stiff competition in her business. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 20,000, she wants to purchase bales of clothes and shoes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes and shoes for resale

loans.name: April Joy

texts.en:
April Joy lives with her family. She had four sibling and her parents were working as private body guards. She had her goal of finishing her studies in order to augment their living. 

She had joined GDMPC recently and was taking a new loan to pay the school tuition fees for this current semester, hopefully to find a better job in the near future.

loans.use: to pay the school tuition fees for this current semester

loans.name: Angelyn

texts.en:
Angelyn is studying Information Technology in the university to gain better education to be used for her future. She lives with her family and she had a big family of nine siblings. 

She joined GDMPC and recently took a new loan to pay her school tuition fee for the first semester. She is thankful to GDMPC for helping them find ways to improve their lives.

loans.use: to pay her school tuition fee for the first semester

loans.name: Bharathi Shg - Group

texts.en:
Bharathi is a group of nine women, led by Tamizharasi (featured borrower holding board with SHG name), and her group members who are on a mission to make a small but important change to their way of living. All of them are living in NatchiyarKovil village in Tamil Nadu. These women use traditional stoves for cooking in their homes. The noxious smoke and particulate matter that emanate from the stove is the primal cause for many respiratory illnesses. Their children often complain of breathlessness and their husbands’ productive years, not to mention their own, are reduced because of ill health.

Fortunately for these women, improved design and technology offers an alternative cook-stove which employs an efficient combustion process to reduce the smoke and hazards associated with the traditional cook-stoves. They requesting a loan to buy this cook-stove. Your contribution to meet their loan target will help them make a wise and necessary investment in a healthy future.

loans.use: to buy fuel-efficient cook-stoves

loans.name: Vishnu Shg - Perumpuliyur Group

texts.en:
The Vishnu group of six women led by Umarani (featured borrower) and her group members are on a mission to make a small but important change to their way of living, who all are living in Perumpuliyur village in Tamil Nadu. These women use traditional stoves for cooking in their homes. The noxious smoke and particulate matter that emanate from the stove is the primal cause for many respiratory illnesses. Their children often complain of breathlessness and their husbands’ productive years, not to mention their own, are reduced because of ill health.

Fortunately for these women, improved design and technology offers an alternative cook-stove which employs an efficient combustion process to reduce the smoke and hazards associated with the traditional cook-stoves. They are requesting a loan to buy this stove. Your contribution to meet their loan target will help them make a wise and necessary investment in a healthy future.

loans.use: to buy fuel-efficient cook-stove

loans.name: Maria

texts.pt:
TEM 24 ANOS DE IDADE, VIVE MARITALMENTE  E NUNCA TEVE FILHOS, MAS CUIDA DE DOIS ENTEADOS MENORES. VIVE DE NEGOCIO QUE FAZ NUMA BARRACA EM SUA CASA E CONTA COM AJUDA DO ESPOSO TRABALHADOR DO ESTADO. ESTA A REPETIR O CREDITO PELA 4ª VEZ. 
COM O CRÉDITO PRETENDE COMPRAR UMA MESA DE BILHARES PARA O SEU NEGÓCIO E TAMBEM INVESTIR NA COMPRA DE MERCADORIA PARA REFORCAR O SEU STOCK.
ELA TEM A ESPERANCA DE PODER AMPLIAR MAIS O SEU NEGOCIO E COM OS LUCROS CONSTUIR A SUA RESIDENCIA E NO FUTURO, UMA VIATURA PARA FACILITAR AS COMPRAS DO SEU NEGOCIO.
O SEU MAIOR DESAFIO É O CAPITAL QUE INVESTE QUE AINDA ESTA LONGE DAS SUAS ESPECTATIVAS
texts.en:
Maria, age 24, is married and doesn't have any children of her own, though she cares for two young stepsons. Her livelihood is her business, which she runs out of a stand in her house. She also has support from her husband, who is a state employee.

This will be her fourth loan and with it she plans to buy a pool table for her business and also to invest in merchandise to increase her stock. She has hopes of continuing to grow her business and using the profits to build a house, and in the future, to buy a car she can use to make purchases for her business. Her main challenge is her level of capital, which is far from her target goal.

loans.use: to buy a pool table for her business and also to invest in merchandise to increase her stock.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.pt:
O senhor António de 51 anos de idade  é militar, casado,pai de 4 filhos dos quais três estudam, vive na casa propria sustenta seus pais enviando lhes dinheiro e duas sobrinhas que vivem com ele.
Com o emprestimo quer comprar  cimento, varões, barrotes, tinta e chapas de zinco para a sua obra.
Diz que futuramente ira reabrir sua barraca que se encontra na sua casa, colocar portão no seu muro e pavimentar o chao de seu quintal.
Diz comprometer se a pagar pontualmente e voltar a solicitar mais emprestimos para concretizar seu plano e que com o apoio oferecido pela Hluvuku está conseguindo melhorar a condições de sua casa.
texts.en:
Antonio, age 51, is in the military, married, and has four children, three of whom are in school. He lives in his own house and also supports his parents, to whom he sends money along with two nieces who live with them.

With this loan he plans to buy cement, posts, rafter beams, paint, and sheet metal for his house. He tells us that in the future he will reopen his stand, which is located in his house, add a gate to the wall, and pave the path to his back yard.  He promises to make payments on time and to come back for future loans to realize his plans. With the support offered by Hluvuku, he is succeeding in improving the conditions of his home.

loans.use: to buy cement, posts, rafter beams, paint, and sheet metal.

loans.name: Chari

texts.en:
Chari is married and blessed with seven children who all attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food.

Over the years, she has operated a dry fish selling business, selling at the market to town dwellers and passers-by. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing a rental house in the near future.

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase prawns and dry fish for resale at a profit. She joined Yehu because of favorable loaning policies.

loans.use: to purchase prawns and dry fish for resale

loans.name: Asep

texts.en: Asep runs an internet cafe that also sells mobile phone accessories, mobile phone airtime credits, and includes a utility bill payment service. Asep lives with his wife and their 4-year-old daughter in Cianjur, a city located at the foot of Mount Gede-Pangrango, West Java. He was introduced to Ruma by a Ruma staff member who visited his stall and he quickly became interested in joining Ruma. Nowadays, he can process up to 40 transactions per day.  As the business continues to grow, he hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva to enable him to process more airtime sales on the weekends. This loan would help him in running the mobile airtime business and consequently supporting his plan to seek for more business opportunities in the future. In the photo, Asep is the one who is looking at us in his internet cafe. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone airtime credit and utility bill payment transactions.

loans.name: Veeramakali Shg-Gengatharapuram Group

texts.en:
Chitra (the featured borrower) and 13 other women hailing from Gengatharapuram in Tanjore, Tamil Nadu, have formed a Self-Help Group (SHG) named Veeramakali. Forty-year-old Chitra is a daily wage laborer, as are the other members of the group. They work long hours outside only to come back home and spend a lot of time cooking over traditional ‘chulha’ stoves that emit a lot of smoke that is detrimental to their health. The smoke affects the children at home too. Besides, there is always the danger of contracting respiratory ailments hovering over their heads.

So Chitra and her group have approached PAT, which is promoting cook stoves as part of their energy initiative with the financial support of Micrograam. The benefits of the Greenway cook stove are: fuel savings, using all solid fuels, minimized emissions of CO2, fast and convenient cooking, high durability, and they are maintenance free and smokeless. The stove operates on all solid fuels such as wood, agro-waste, charcoal, coal and dry dung and does not require any refurbishing or recurring cost. Due to all the above reasons, these cook stoves are preferred by the group.

Chitra and her group are, hence, seeking a loan of INR 1400 each, which is repayable in easy installments, to buy the Greenway cook stove. Your loan will help these hardworking women to ensure better health for themselves and their families.

loans.use: to buy a smokeless stove

loans.name: Felix

texts.es:
