loans.name: Jesusa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “KOSÑIPATA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Maranura, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Jesusa se dedica al negocio de agricultura, ella tiene un terreno donde cultiva cacao y café, la socia trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar su terreno de cultivo. La socia solicita le crédito para comprar semillas y fertilizantes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This communal bank member belongs to the communal bank "Kosñipata." This bank is located in the district of Maranura, which is part of the province of La Convención and the department of Cusco.

Communal bank member Jesusa works in agriculture. She has a plot of land where she raises cacao and coffee. She works from 6:00 am to 5:00 pm. She has already had a number of years of experience in this business, and it is going very well for her. Her dream is to expand her cultivated land. She is applying for the loan to buy seeds and fertilizers.

She is happy about the loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Senthamil Shg-Serukudi Group

texts.en:
Sudha is the leader of the Senthamil Self-Help Group (SHG), managed by the local NGO, “People’s Action for Transformation” (PAT).  
 
Sudha is married and living in Serukudi, a small village in Tamil Nadu. She is 28 years old and has two children. 

Sudha has recently learned about Greenway Smart Stove, a sustainable stove that reduces smoke emissions up to 70%, resulting in better long-term health due to decreased inhalation of poisonous gas.

Sudha (holding the board with the SHG name) and the other 16 members are requesting a loan to buy this stove to give a healthier life to their families. They are extremely excited about the possibility of saving on fuel and having less smoke emissions in their houses.

loans.use: to buy a smokeless stove

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
La Sra. Elizabeth hoy tiene 28 años, ella se dedica a la venta de perfumes y joyas, y por medio de este trabajado ayuda a su marido con los gastos del día a día. Ella comenta que con su préstamo anterior compró perfumes y joyas, con lo cual pudo mejorar sus ventas e ir mejorando cada día.
Hoy pide un nuevo préstamo para poder comprar aros de filigrana, y también para la compra de perfumes diferentes marcas.
texts.en:
Sra. Elizabeth is currently 28 years old. She sells perfumes and jewelry. Through her work, Elizabeth is able to help her husband with the daily expenses. She says that her previous loan was used to buy perfumes and jewelry. As a result, she was able to improve her sales and keep growing each day.

Today she is requesting a new loan in order to buy filigree rings. She will also purchase perfumes of different brands.

loans.use: to buy filigree rings and perfumes.

loans.name: José Dolores

texts.es:
José de 44 años de edad, se encuentra casado, es padre de 3 hijos, su esposa se dedica al oficio doméstico, mientras José se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, maicillo y frijoles.
 
José es agricultor, trabajo que aprendió desde muy pequeño, ya que fue su padre que le enseño. Trabaja también ayudándole  a otras personas en la agricultura y trabajos de construcción, el lugar donde cultiva se encuentra a una distancia de 25 minutos desde su casa. Su horario de trabajo es de 6:00 am a 12:00 pm. y también cuenta con la ayuda de sus hijos.
El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para cancelar  el alquiler de la tierra donde cultivan  y comprar fórmula,  sulfato y pago de mano de obra.  

Su sueño principal es mejorar su vivienda y con ello mejorar su calidad de vida, seguir trabajando para sacar adelante a sus hijos para darles una buena enseñanza que sean personas trabajadoras y de bien para la sociedad.
texts.en:
José is 44 years old. He is married and the father of three children. His wife is a homemaker and José is a farmer who grows corn, sorghum and beans. His children help him on the farm.

José learned to farm at a very young age and was taught by his father. He also works helping other people on their farms, and does construction work. The land which José grows his crops on is located 25 minutes away from his home. He works on the farm from 6 a.m. until 12 p.m.

The loan he is requesting from CREDICAMPO is to pay the rent on the land he cultivates. The loan will also be used to purchase formula and sulfate; and to pay laborers.
 
José's main dream is to make improvements to his home, which will improve his life. He also hopes to continue working to get his children ahead and to teach them to be hardworking and to contribute to society.

loans.use: to make the rent payment on his land; to purchase formula and sulfates; and to pay laborers.

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Mujeres Trabajadoras, ellas son de la ciudad de Villa Elisa, son mujeres muy luchadoras que quieren dar a sus familias todo lo que no pudieron tener, todo esto a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo.
Librada se dedica a la costura, hace todo tipo de confecciones, y comenta que sus clientes siempre quedan muy conformes con su trabajo y que con ello cada día se hace cada vez más conocida y así va creciendo. Pide este préstamo ya que quiere comprar telas en cantidad, de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo, ya que ella es el sostén de su familia
texts.en:
This group is called “Mujeres Trabajadoras” (Working Women). They are from the city of Villa Elisa. As a result of their effort and continuous work, these women are determined to provide their families with everything that they were not able to have.

Librada is a seamstress who produces all types of articles. She says that her customers are always satisfied with her work. Every day she is becoming more well-known, which is helping her to grow. Librada is requesting a loan in order to buy fabrics in quantity. This will help her to continue working as before since she is the breadwinner in her family.

loans.use: to buy fabric in bulk.

loans.name: Sathiyam Shg-Vairavankovil Group

texts.en:
Rani is married and the leader of the Sathiyam Self Help Group, which is managed by the local NGO, People Action for Transformation, in Tamil Nadu. 
Rani lives in her own house with her family. Her husband is a small marginal farmer. They live in Vairavankovil, a small village in Tamil Nadu. Rani has taken loans from PAT previously and has repaid the loans on time.
 
Rani and the other members of the group need a loan to purchase a smokeless stove, which is better than traditional stove. Smokeless stoves produce less carbon dioxide and maintain a healthy environment. It’s convenient for cooking and designed for daily use.

loans.use: to buy a smokeless stove

loans.name: Qubra

texts.en:
Qubra is a 38-year-old married woman.  She has been running a business selling animals.  She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, raises them and then sells them out in the market at higher prices.  At present she has three cows and two goats, and makes enough to contribute to her family's income.  She also sells milk to generate extra income. 

Qubra needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses, and therefore contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase more animals.  She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market.  With this loan, she will expand her business and income level.  She is in her 6th loan cycle with a good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase more animals.

loans.name: Manos Unidas Group

texts.es: Irene de 38 años soltera  y sin hijos,  Irene   se dedica ya hace 4  año a la venta de calzado de  zapatos tanto para damas como para caballeros en un pequeño local todos los días con el merito de salir adelante,  Con el fruto de su esfuerzo Irene  ha logrado mejorar su vivienda y Seguir mejorando su negocio.  Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá  en comprar más zapatos para su posterior venta y  tener más ingresos económicos. Irene está sentada es la tercera  de la mano izquierda se le distingue por su chompa de color fucsia y tiene anteojos, A la vez se despide con un abraso a Kiva y Edaprospo y  agradece el crédito brindado ya que hace posible su progreso.
texts.en:
Irene is 38 years old. She is single and does not have any children. 
For the past four years Irene has sold footwear for both women and men from a small shop. She works every day in order to get ahead. With the fruit of her labors, Irene has been able to improve her dwelling and continue building her business. 
She will invest this loan in the purchase of more shoes to fill back-orders. This will improve her earnings. 
Irene is seated third from the left, you can pick her out by her fuchsia sweater and her glasses. She bids farewell both to Kiva and to Edaprospo and expresses her thanks for the loan provided which helps her advance.

loans.use: to sell shoes.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem, age 40, is a married woman.  In order to support her husband in taking care of the family, she began a milk selling business.  Naseem is known in her town for providing quality milk from her 2 buffaloes, and is happily supporting her family with the income generated.  

Naseem is in her 7th loan cycle and has requested a loan of 60,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo.  She is hopeful that increased milk production will help her generate more income.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Fateh

texts.en:
Fateh is a 57 year old, hardworking, married woman. Her husband is a farmer and his income is not enough to support his family. 

Before starting a milk production business, Fateh’s family often lived in hand to mouth conditions. She decided to support her family for a better and secure future for her children. Now she has 1 cow and 9 buffaloes and has good sales of milk on a daily basis. Her customers are satisfied and give her value due to her honesty in business. She has a very good credit behavior with Kashf and she is currently in her 8th loan cycle. 

Fateh is requesting a loan of 55,000 PKR to purchase a new cow. She wants to increase milk production according to the customer needs and the increasing number of customers. She wants to use the profit from the business on her family needs and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase a new cow.

loans.name: Tasleem

texts.en:
Tasleem has successfully built her general store business with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. She has a large number of customers and makes a good amount of income that she contributes to the family income. 

Tasleem is in her seventh loan cycle and has applied for a loan of 55,000 PKR to purchase rice, sugar, flour, grains and biscuits. These items will increase the stock she has available in her store and will enable her to sell to more cities and make more profit.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, flour, grains and biscuits to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Zubaida

texts.en: Zubaida has successfully built her livestock business with the support of the Kashf Foundation and Kiva. She has a large number of customers and makes a good income to contribute to the family income. Previously, with the help of Kiva, she was able to expand her business. Now Zubaida is selling milk and is in her third loan cycle. She has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase another cow. This will enable her to increase her milk sales to more cities and to gain more profits.

loans.use: to purchase another cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and run two Fresh Life Toilets

loans.name: Sohail Ahmed

texts.en:
Sohail is 37 years old and lives in Karachi. He is married and has two children who go to school. For the past 10 years, Jonathan has been working hard to manage his retail shop, where he sells essential commodities. He is very organized and particular about the cleanliness of his shop which shows in the picture as well. He sells quality products to his customers. This is why he has been able to make a loyal customer base. 

In order to serve his customers better and increase his sales, Sohail has requested a loan from Brac Pakistan. The loan will be used to buy more essential inventory like groceries and other items for the business. The loan will also help Sohail to generate greater profits and stock more items in the shop to sell. He hopes that he will be able to save for his children's education and expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase general items for his general store.

loans.name: Armando

texts.es:
Armando es un hombre de 40 años de edad, casado, padre de cinco hijos y su negocio es la mecánica automotriz.
Él es emprendedor, alegre, divertido, constante, animado, responsable y muy trabajador. Su negocio lo realiza en el municipio de batallas en la región del altiplano del departamento de La Paz, pasando por su capital una de las vías que corresponde a los ejes de integración y paso obligado a la zona norte del lago Titicaca, el potencial productivo con que cuenta se encuentra dentro de su medio físico natural principalmente en la cordillera y lago, también cuenta con sitios arqueológicos, arquitectónicos, que construyen una imagen atractiva al viajero.
Armando es de tez morena, cabello corto negro, estatura mediana, su lengua natal es el aymara y utiliza el español para el comercio. Su negocio es la reparación de automóviles. Su sueño es mejorar la calidad de vida de sus cinco hijos mejorando sus ingresos económicos. El desea realizar la compra de ganado vacuno para la crianza y producción de leche y derivados, labor que es realizada por gran parte de la población de su comunidad.
Es por esos motivos que Armando solicita un préstamo para la compra de ganado vacuno y mejorar la calidad de vida de sus cinco hijos.
texts.en:
Armando is a 40-year-old man who is married, and the father of five children. His business is automotive mechanics. He is enterprising, cheerful, funny, persevering, lively, responsible, and very hardworking. He carries out his business in the municipality of Batallas, in the Altiplano Region of the department of La Paz.  

One of the routes that correspond to the integration corridors passes through its capital, the gateway to the northern zone of Lake Titicaca. Its productive potential lies in its natural physical environment, mainly in the mountain range and the lake. It also has archeological and architectural sites that form an interesting vista for the traveler. 

Armando has tan skin and short black hair. He is of medium height. His native language is Aymara, and he uses Spanish for business, which is automobile repair. 

His dreams are to improve the quality of life for his five children and to improve his income. He wants to purchase cattle, for breeding and for the production of milk and dairy products, which is the work in which a large part of his community’s population is engaged. 

That is why Armando is requesting a loan—for the purchase of cattle, and to improve the quality of life for his five children.

loans.use: to purchase cattle, and to improve the quality of life for his five children.

loans.name: Suriya

texts.en:
Suriya is a 40-year-old married, vigorous lady. She has been manufacturing carpets for many years to contribute to the family income. She offers various handmade carpets in different colors and designs for the people of her community and makes enough to lead a decent life. 

For the improvement of her business, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy good quality wool, nylon, polyester, and polypropylene fibers to increase her sales. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and dreams of expanding her business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy good quality wool, nylon, polyester, and polypropylene fibers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for groceries to resell.

loans.name: Munazza

texts.en: Munazza is a 39-year-old married woman who has three children. She has been running a business selling cloth for the past two years. She sells cloth in her locality after purchasing it wholesale at a slightly lower price. This business is the only source of income for her household. Munazza is in her fourth loan cycle with Kashf Foundation and shows a good repayment history. Now, she has requested a loan amount of 45,000 PKR. With this loan she intends to purchase a greater variety of cloth from the market. She hopes to get a good return from this loan, with which she wants to provide for her children.

loans.use: to purchase a greater variety of cloth from the market.

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en: Shahnaz is a 25-year-old married lady. She is a hardworking mother and has been supporting her family by stitching clothes. The income from her business has enabled her to meet the day-to-day expenses of her household. She is in her fifth loan cycle and has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. She intends to use this loan to purchase fabric, thread, zippers and buttons. She hopes that more investment in her business will help to generate more income and provide for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, thread, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
Asia is a 34-year-old vigorous lady.   She has been providing tailoring services for many years and is quite skilled at her job. Asia stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. She has two children. 

Asia requires financial aid to run her operational work as most of her income is spent for household expenditures. Therefore, in her 6th loan cycle, she has requested for 40,000 PKR. With this loan, Asia intends to purchase a new stitching machine and more stitching material such as needles, spools of threads etc. She wants to generate more income in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a new stitching machine and more stitching material such as needles, spools of threads etc.

loans.name: Yasamin

texts.en:
Yasamin is a 34-year-old divorced woman with two children. After she got divorced from her husband, she came back to live with her parents in their own house in the capital city of Sana'a, Yemen. Yasamin originally studied elementary education, but she couldn't complete her studies. Now, Yasamin is an employee with an elementary certificate. 

The salary Yasamin receives from her job is not enough to cover all the expenses of her family. She is a talented and responsible professional woman. She has strong determination inside herself to improve the living standards of her family, and to prepare her house with all the home appliances that the family needs. As a result, she decided to start her own business in addition to her job. 

Yasamin wants to purchase a minibus that she will rent to her brother, along with a monthly salary, so he can be a driver and transport people from one station to another inside the capital city of Sana'a. This will help to earn income in order to provide the family with a better future. Yasamin believes that this business will be very successful and profitable for her and for her brother, and that she can earn a lot of money. 

Unfortunately, Yasamin doesn't have enough money to purchase the minibus. As a result, she applied for loan of 500,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase a minibus and make this business another income source for her family. 

Yasamin looks forward to providing her family with a better future.

loans.use: to purchase a minibus for her own business

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en: At the age of 35, Shazia is continually providing income to her family members. Some years ago she started her business selling bedsheets in her locality. She offers a variety of bedsheets and covers of good quality. By this time she has retained a good number of buyers. She is a motivated mother of five children. She needs to provide them with a quality life.  In order to expand her business, she has availed herself of her sixth loan of 45,000 PKR. It will help her to buy good quality bedsheets in different colors and designs. She expects a boost in her earnings and wishes to provide a better standard of living for her family members.

loans.use: to buy good quality bedsheets in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Wendy Isamar

texts.es:
Wendy de 24 años de edad, estudio hasta 6 grado, debido a los falta de recursos económicos de su familia no pudo seguir con sus estudios, esta soltera pero ya tiene un niño de 2 años afortunadamente el padre del niño le ayuda con algunos gastos. Actualmente Wendy vive con su madre y demás hermanos.
 
Wendy desde la edad de 16 años comenzó a vender ropa casa por casa en las colonias, tiene aproximadamente 8 años de realizar este trabajo. Además, hoy también realiza ventas junto con su madre por las tardes en la colonia donde venden pupusas, papas fritas y panes. Wendy se dedicó a la venta de ropa debido a la necesidad de también aportar económicamente a la familia y hoy más que nunca necesita sacar a su hijo a adelante.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para reparar la plancha para hacer las pupusas y el resto del dinero lo invertirá nuevamente en la compra de ropa, hace algunas semanas ella sufrió un asalto después de haber vendido toda su mercadería y el cual perdió todo el dinero. 

EL sueño de Wendy es tener nuevamente su venta de ropa y tiene la fe en Dios que pronto podrá tener su puesto en el mercado de la ciudad. Además, que junto con su madre sacará adelante la pupusería para mejorar sus ingresos de la familia y así darle lo mejor a su hijo pero eso lo puede lograr con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo.
texts.en:
Wendy is 24 years old and studied until the 6th grade. Due to a lack of money, she could not continue with her studies.  She is single but has a 2 year-old child.  Fortunately, the father helps with some expenses.  Wendy currently lives with her mother and other siblings.
 
Wendy from the age of 16 started selling clothing door to door in the townships. She has approximately 8 years of doing this work.  Also, now she and her mother in the evenings in the townships sell pupusas, fried potatoes and breads. Wendy was also devoted to selling clothes due to the need to also contribute financially to the family and today more than to help her child get ahead.

The loan she is applying for is to fix the hot plate to make pupusas and the rest of the money to invest back into buying clothes, a few weeks ago she suffered an assault after selling all her merchandise, in which all the money was lost.

Wendy's dream is having her clothing for sale again and have faith in God that will soon take its place in the market town. Furthermore, together with her mother to bring forward the pupusería to improve their family income and thus provide the best for your child but that can be achieved with hard work and effort.

loans.use: to repair the hot plate to make pupusas and the rest of the money to invest back into buying clothes

loans.name: Janvier

texts.en: Janvier is 27 years old. He is married with two children aged between four and seven, one of whom goes to school. He has been selling shoes for three years. With the loan, he would like to buy more shoes to sell. The profit from the business will be used to improve their welfare.

loans.use: to buy more shoes to sell

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is a 43-year-old married woman and she is motivated to provide for her family.  In order to support her husband in taking care of the family, she began the business of milk selling. She is known in her town for providing good quality milk. At present, she has one buffalo and she is happily supporting her family with the income she generates. 

Razia is in her 7th loan cycle. She has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo. She is hopeful that the increase in milk production will help her generate more income.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en: Nadia is a 35-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small shop of lace and thread with her husband at the corner of her house. She has five years of experience in this field. Her husband also assists her by purchasing a variety of supplies from the market as he has maintained many contacts for years. She is the mother of four children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy spools of thread in larger quantities along with packs of lace, ribbons and buttons to meet the increasing demands of her customers. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future. She is in her third loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to buy spools of thread in larger quantities along with packs of lace, ribbons and buttons.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 41-year-old married woman and has two children. She has been successfully running a small grocery shop at the corner of her house. Nasreen has five years of experience in this field.  Over time, the customer base of her store has greatly increased. 

Nasreen is very thankful for previous loans. She is in her 7th loan cycle. Now, Nasreen has requested a loan of 50,000 PKR. With this loan she wants to buy stock of packed milk, biscuits, rice, oil, flour etc. 

With the help of income generated from this store, Nasreen has been able to provide her family with good living conditions. She wants to earn more income which she hopes to spend on the health and comfort of her family.

loans.use: to buy stock of packed milk, biscuits, rice, oil, flour etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase one Fresh Life toilet.

loans.name: Rubina

texts.en:
Rubina is 42, married and a mother of five. Her husband has an animal sales business and has 17 years of experience in this field. He is well known for his business and very respected among neighbors and friends. He is a farmer and buys and sells cattle at the municipal market. Most of the cattle are low priced and in need of care and recuperation before being sold to butchers.  

This business is the main source of Rubina and her husband's income. Nowadays, times are difficult, as their expenses have started to increase as their children are growing up along with their needs. 
 
Rubina has therefore requested a loan to help her husband. The loan will be used to buy buffaloes to be sold for a reasonable profit. The profit will be used to pay off their children's fees and cover household expenses. Rubina's husband is thankful to Brac Pakistan Kiva for their support.

loans.use: To help her husband buy buffaloes for reselling

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Lucy, one of the most hardworking and dedicated women on planet earth. She is based in Kirere, a remote village in the Thika area of Kenya. She is happily married to Joshua, who adds additional income to support their family. They are blessed with four lovely children. For the past 12 years she has been engaging in mixed farming and through selling milk, tea and a variety of food crops she has earned a decent income. Like many farmers in her village, she also plants trees on her farm to complement the region's natural forests. Although Lucy makes profits selling her farm produce at the market, the biggest challenge she faces is lack of water to irrigate her farm and water for home consumption. Lucy comes from an area where there is no water connection and she is always forced to walk for a long distance for this “precious commodity”. Being 59 years of age, she faces challenges carrying water on her back because of her failing health and she is quickly aging. Lucy is seeking a loan to buy a water tank and water pipes. Most of the farmers in Kenya depend on rain fed agriculture but Lucy wants to change that notion and start irrigation farming. Through the loan she intends to harvest rain water which always goes to waste and store it in the tanks. She intends to buy pipes that will be used to pump water from the river directly to her farm. With your loan Lucy will be saved the trouble of walking a long distance in search of water and she will have enough water for home consumption. Irrigating her farm will boast productivity since water is an important requirement in the germination of crops.

Lucy is very excited about this project and hopes her dream will be achieved through the loan from Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva lenders. Increased productivity means increased income and this will translate to improved living standards. She will use the additional income to improve and secure the future of her children. Lucy’s hope for the future is to live a fulfilling life.

loans.use: to purchase a water tank and water pipes.

loans.name: Solange

texts.en: Solange is 34 years old. She is married with four children aged between 9 and 15, and all of them go to school. She has been selling at a bar for seven years. With the loan, she would like to buy more beer to sell. The profit from the business will be used to increase her savings and to pay for school for her children.

loans.use: to buy more beer to sell

loans.name: Marie Francoise

texts.en:
Marie Francoise, aged 32 years, is married with four children, three of whom go to school. She has been farming for eight years. She will use Kiva loan to buy fertilizer and support labor costs during rice production. She needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase her production. With profits from her farming she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more  fertilizer and support labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Sri Murugan Shg-Keelarasur Group

texts.en:
Dhanakodi (the featured borrower wearing a blue colored sari, with her hand raised) and nine of her friends — Saroja, Nagarethinam, Uma, Vasantha, Dhanapakkiyam, Kaliyammal, Kalaiselvi, Nallammal and Maruthayee — have formed a group called Sri Murugan. All hail from Keelarasur village of Trichy in Tamil Nadu. Most of them are daily-wage laborers and help supplement their household income. These diligent women are unable to save money from their monthly income. A major chunk of their income goes towards buying firewood or kerosene, and a lot of their time is spent cooking over traditional "chulha" stoves. These chulhas, apart from being time consuming, also emit a lot of smoke, which plays havoc with their health. This adds to their medical expenses.

Hence, to tackle these problems, they have approached PAT (MicroGraam’s field partner) to buy Greenway cookstoves. The benefits of a Greenway cook stove are that it leads to fuel savings, uses all solid fuels, minimizes emissions of CO and CO2, supports fast and convenient cooking, and is highly durable, maintenance-free and smokeless. The stove operates on all solid fuels such as wood, agro-waste, charcoal, coal and dry dung and does not require any refurbishing or recurring cost. Hence, they are seeking a group loan of INR 1400 each to buy the stoves, which is repayable in easy installments. They intend to use the loan to purchase Greenway cookstoves. 

Your loan will help these women to have better health and also save a little more money.

loans.use: to buy a smokeless stove

loans.name: Jhuma

texts.en:
Jhuma is a 22-year-old married lady, with one toddler. She is originally from a remote village, Tekatuli in Maynaguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. She is only 22 years old and known for being hard-working and responsible, with a great desire for personal achievement. Due to  lack of economic resources and because of the poverty in which she lived, she did not get the opportunity of higher study and attended school till grade 9; after that, she got married.

Jhuma's husband, Pradip, handles his own business of selling fruits. He runs a small store in his home where he sells fruits like bananas, mangoes, watermelon, oranges, apples and other seasonal fruits.  He makes his purchases for cash from the markets and distributors in his area. His sales are for cash. He has regular and occasional customers. He began his business many years ago with his own funds and with the goal of helping with the expenses of his household. Today, it is the only source of income for his household.

One of his dreams is to be able to make an increase in the inventory in his business. The current income from the business is insufficient to cover all the expenses. So Jhuma is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner BJS. The purpose of this financing is to invest in working capital by buying more fruits for her husband's business. She hopes the loan will help the business to be a profitable one, will earn more income for the well-being of the family, and will strengthen their economic condition.

She appreciates the financial help of her generous lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fruits for her husband's fruit selling business.

loans.name: Kajali

texts.en:
Kajali is a 40-year-old woman from Maynaguri. She is married to Haripada, a 44-year-old farmer, and lives in a small village named Kathalbari of Jalpaiguri district in West Bengal, India. The couple has three children (two sons and one daughter) who are in school. Kajali lives with her children and, together with her husband, takes care of all the household work. 

In order to help with all the family expenses, Kajali's husband has been involved in doing paddy cultivation and selling it to the distributors for the past six years. He supplies his paddy and rice to the rice dealers in the nearby market. In order to strengthen the business and respond to client demand, he needs to grow more paddy on his farmland, but lacks the business capital.

So Kajali is requesting a loan from BJS( Kiva's partner) for purchasing fertilizers, pesticides, and seeds, and to cover the operational costs. Their goal is to increase their business activity. The loan will greatly help this family to organize cultivation work, and they hope for a good harvest. They hope it will be a lucrative business, as the crop has a tremendous demand in the market. She dreams of providing higher education to her children.

She thanks her lenders for the financial help.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies for the existing paddy cultivation.

loans.name: Kamala

texts.en:
Twenty-three-year-old Kamala is a young housewife who lives in a small village, Mouyamari in Maynaguri of Jalpaiguri district, with her husband and three children (one son and two daughters). They attend school. In her childhood, Kamala did not get much opportunity to study, as her parents could not afford it. She has a primary education.

Kamala’s husband, 28-year-old Sailen, is a cycle-van puller. This is a very common vehicle widely used in rural areas of India to carry loads and people. It is an irregular type of job, so there are days where he gets no work and no pay. He puts in a lot of hard labor and time, but the profit is low. Now he wants to generate more income for his family. He is thinking of buying a cycle-rickshaw to carry people for additional income. Having very few means of transport in the villages, cycle-rickshaws have a great demand.

So Kamala has sought a loan from BJS ( Kiva's partner), which gives business loans to rural women. She wants to purchase a cycle-rickshaw for her husband. It will help her husband to earn more by carrying people, and in the long run, give him more earnings. The loan will help Kamala and her husband take a step closer to their goal of improved earnings and a better future for their family and better education to her children.

She is grateful to her generous lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a rickshaw for her husband's business.

loans.name: Sbapana

texts.en:
Sbapana hails from Maynaguri. She is a 48-year-old married woman living with her spouse and a son in the village of Bongkandi in Jalpaiguri district. She studied up to grade nine.  She is providing an education to her only son, who is doing his graduation in Arts. She is a homemaker who looks after her household work.

She belongs to a poor family.  Her family is passing their lives hand to mouth. Her husband Sankar, 54 years old, runs a small clothing business. He has been running this business for many years and cherishes the whole family. Sbapana assists her husband and sells saris to her neighbors. A sari is a female garment consisting of a length of cotton or silk elaborately draped around the body, traditionally worn by women from South Asia. There is a great demand for saris in India. 

Due to an increase in family needs, her husband considers it necessary to grow his business. But the lack of availability of capital is the major problem for him. 

Sbapana and her husband have a good relationship with their customers. Now that festival season is arriving, they need to buy more clothing and saris for their customers. Thus, they need capital. Therefore, Sbapana took a loan from BJS for their business. She plans to use the loan to increase the inventory with a variety of saris, etc. She thinks a variety of stock will attract more customers. She hopes the loan will help her to reach to her goals, which include better living conditions for her family and a higher education for their only son.

Sbapana thanks Kiva and field partner, BJS.

loans.use: To purchase more saris for her clothing business.

loans.name: Mausumi

texts.en:
Mausumi is a 39-year-old married woman. She resides at Mouyamari in the Jalpaiguri district of West Bengal with her husband and two school-going daughters.  She has a higher secondary education. Her daughters are in different grades in primary school.

Mausumi’s husband is a university graduate. Because of the high rate of unemployment in the country, he could not find a job to look after his family. So he drives a car and earns for the family. Since his job does not provide a fixed income, the family was in financial hardship.

Mausumi is an energetic and hardworking lady. She has great determination inside herself to go ahead and does not surrender easily to her obstacles and problems. As a result, she decided to start her own business selling groceries and goods in a small shop in her house. As the source of income for her family, Mausumi started the business more than two years ago. She started this business with a small amount of capital. The profits from this business have allowed her to expand her sales volume.

To further develop her business, Mausumi turned to BJS (Kiva's partner). She is requesting a loan to buy more goods and items for the grocery store such as rice, oil, sugar, flour, salt, biscuits etc. in order to meet all the demands of her customers.

Mausumi plans to invest the earnings from the loan to increase the business. She is a very ambitious and dynamic woman who wants to strengthen the family's economy.

She is thankful for her lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery items for her grocery shop.

loans.name: Kohinoor

texts.en:
Kohinoor hails from Maynaguri. She is a 28-year-old married woman and a mother of three children (one son and two daughters). She is living with them in a house of their own in the small village of Kathalbari in Jalpaiguri district. She attended school until the primary level. Her children are in grade 1, grade 4 and grade 7, respectively. To give the family financial support, Kohinoor is engaged in a firewood-selling business.

Her husband, Jaynal, is a responsible young man. He has high determination inside himself. He didn't receive enough financial support from his family to study in school. Thus, he decided to start his own business. Over time, he has accumulated a good amount of money and purchased a cycle-van. One of the public services that is most important for the people of rural West Bengal is that of the van service. The people depend on this service in order to move from place to place and to carry loads. It is a kind of cycle-operated transport that is a very popular means of transport. In order to grow his business, he wants to purchase a new cycle-van and rent the old one to others to earn additional income.

So to help her husband, Kohinoor has taken a loan from BJS.  She will use the loan to purchase a new cycle-van. In order to improve the living standards of his family and to provide her children higher education, she thinks this business will be very profitable for them.

She gives her hearty thanks to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a cycle-van for her husband.

loans.name: Dulan

texts.en:
Dulan is an ambitious entrepreneur from Maynaguri in Jalpaiguri district, West Bengal. She resides with her husband and is blessed with two sons. Dulan has an elementary education but her husband is illiterate and can sign only his name. One of the sons reads in grade nine and the other is grown up and engaged in a water supply business. Dulan's husband Sadhan is a farmer by profession.  He cultivates seasonal vegetables on his farmland.  But his income is too low to give the family financial sustenance.

Dulan has been actively involved in dairy farming for years. She sells milk and various milk products like butter, curd, and paneer (cottage cheese) . She enjoys the dairy business. Milking her cows is her hobby. She started the business with the purchase of one cow. Her customers like her dairy products very much and the demand is increasing day by day. So Dulan thought of improving her business.

Dulan is seeking a loan from Kiva's partner BJS to purchase an additional dairy cow. She will be able to produce more milk and increase her sales volume. In the short run, she will be saving the returns to provide a better education to her younger son. In the long run, she will have saved enough money to buy better breeds of cows. Dulan's dream is to build her capital and asset base in order to lead a financially secure life in the future and to give a good education to her son.

Her full thanks go to her lenders.

loans.use: To purchase one dairy cow for her business.

loans.name: Brigida

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal KOSÑIPATA, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Maranura, provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Brigida tiene 50 años de edad  y tiene 05 hijos, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a la agricultura, la socia siembra lo que son frutas como naranjas, plátanos entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día su negocio, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante  a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the KOSÑIPATA communal bank. The bank is located in the Maranura district, La Convencion province, Cusco department. Member Brigida is 50 years old and has 5 children. 

The member alternates her daily jobs, working in farming, she plants fruits such as oranges, bananas etc. She has been in this business for a long time which is going very well thanks to the effort she puts into her business every day, as this is the way that she gets her family through.

This member is requesting a loan to buy seeds.

This member is grateful for the approved loan and commits to making her agreed payments.

loans.use: to buy seeds.

loans.name: Rubén Arístides

texts.es:
Rubén de 38 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer grado, está acompañado y tiene 3 hijos. Su compañera de vida se encarga de los oficios domésticos y al cuido de los niños uno de 7 años que estudia primer grado,  una niña de 4 años que aún no asiste a la escuela y otro que está recién nacido que tiene solamente un mes de nacido.

Rubén es agricultor trabajo que aprendió de su padre y que lo ha desempeñado desde muy joven, los ingresos de él dependen directamente de la agricultura; pero también muchas veces trabaja como ayudante de albañil en esta temporada de siembra él cultivara principalmente maíz, maicillo y frijol la distancia del lugar donde cultiva a su casa está 25 minutos caminando y comienza a trabajar desde la 5:00 de la mañana hasta 12:00 de medio día,  pero muchas veces realizan otras horas más para avanzar en el trabajo.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para pagar el alquiler de la tierra donde cultivara, el pago de las personas que le ayudaran a realizar la limpia de la tierra y a sembrar y la otra parte para la compra de herbicidas y los fertilizantes como fórmula y sulfato. 

Los planes a corto plazo son obtener una buena cosecha y lograr venderla a buen precio para cubrir las obligaciones que ha adquirido, seguir trabajando muy fuertemente para sacar adelante a sus tres hijos y brindarles una buena educación hasta que puedan sacar una carrera universitaria y que les permita forjarse un buen futuro y que sean muy productivos para la sociedad salvadoreña.
texts.en:
Ruben, 38 years old, studied up to the third grade. He is married and has 3 children. His partner in life takes care of the domestic chores and the children, a boy of 7 years old who is in first grade, and a girl of 4 who doesn't go to school yet and another who is newborn and is only one month old.

Ruben is a farmer, he learnt this trade from his father and he started very young. His income depends directly on farming; but also many times he works as a day laborer in the harvest season mainly of corn, sorghum and beans. It takes him 25 minutes to get to the place where he farms on foot and he works from 5am to 12 noon, but often he does more hours to make progress in his work.

The loan he is requesting from CrediCampo is to pay rent on the land he farms, to pay for manual labor to the people who will help him clear the land and do the planting and the other part is to buy herbicides and fertilizers such as formula and sulfate. 

His short term plans are to get a good harvest and sell it at a good price to cover the debt, keep working hard to get his three children ahead and provide them with a good education up to being able to get a university degree which will allow them to carve out a good future and be very productive in Salvadoran society.

loans.use: to pay rent on the land, pay for manual labor and also to buy herbicides and fertilizers such as formula and sulfate.

loans.name: Sperata

texts.en: Sperata is 32 years old. She is married with four children between one and nine years old. Two of them go to school. She has been selling local beer made from sorghum for five years. With the loan, she would like to buy more sorghum for making local beer for sale. The profit from the business will be used to increase her savings.

loans.use: To buy more sorghum for making local beer for sale.

loans.name: Anelyse

texts.en: Anelyse is 30 years old. She is married with four children between one and six years old. They do not yet go to school. She has been selling foodstuffs for three years. With the loan, she would like to buy more sorghum and beans to sell.

loans.use: To buy more sorghum and beans to sell.

loans.name: Laurence

texts.en: Laurence is 39 years old, she is married with 2 children aged 6 and 10, one of whom goes to school. She has been selling foodstuffs for 10 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more sorghum and beans for sale. The profit from the business will be used to buy land for farming.

loans.use: To buy more sorghum and beans for sale.

loans.name: Encarnacion

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal KOSÑIPATA, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Maranura, provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Encarnación tiene 56 años de edad  tiene 08 hijos y es conviviente, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a la agricultura, la socia siembra lo que son frutas como naranjas, plátanos entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, abono entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the KOSÑIPATA communal bank. This bank is located in the Maranura district, La Convención, Cusco department. Member Convención is 56 years old, she has 8 children and a partner. This member works daily in agriculture, she grows fruits such as oranges, bananas, etc. This member has been in this business for a long time and she is doing well thanks to the effort she puts in to her business every day. This member wants to continue working in order to continue supporting her family.

This member is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, etc. This member is grateful for the approved loan and commits to making her agreed payments.

loans.use: to buy seeds, etc.

loans.name: Marie Louise

texts.en:
Marie Louise is 39 years old, she is married with 7 children aged between 3 and 18, and 5 of them go school. She has been farming for 18 years. She will use the Kiva loan to support labor costs and fertilizer during rice production: they need to buy fertilizers in order to increase their production. With the profits from her farming she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity.
 
The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 39 years old, he is married with 7 children aged between 3 and 18, and all of them go to school. He has been farming for 13 years. He will use the Kiva loan to support labor costs and fertilizer during rice production: they need to buy fertilizer in order to increase their production. With the profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and support labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Charlotte

texts.en:
Charlotte is 27 years old, she is married with 3 children aged between 2 and 12, and 2 of them go to school. She has been farming for 7 years. She will use the Kiva loan to support labor costs and fertilizer during rice production: they need to buy fertilizers in order to increase their production. With the profits from her farming she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity.
 
The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and suppport labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal KOSÑIPATA, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Maranura, provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Julia tiene 51 años de edad es separada y tiene 03 hijos, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a la agricultura, la socia siembra lo que son frutas como naranjas, plátanos entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank “Kosñipata”. The bank is located in the district of Maranura, in the province of La Convención, in the department of Cusco.

Julia is 51 years old and separated. She has three children. She makes a living from agriculture. She plants fruit, such as oranges and bananas. She has had her business for a while and it is going well for her thanks to the effort she puts into her business every day. She wishes to be able to continue working so she can continue supporting her family.

She is requesting the loan in order to purchase seeds and other things.

She feels grateful for the loan and is committed to making her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy seeds and other things.

loans.name: Luis Raul

texts.es: Luis es un joven universitario de 21 años. Actualmente se encuentra cursando el octavo ciclo de su carrera de Ingeniería de Sistemas. Él decidió estudiar esta carrera porque le muestra un panorama muy amplio en el cual desarrollar sus habilidades. Comenta que quiere especializarse en Programas de Gestion de Riesgos. Además de ser un joven muy aplicado en sus ratos libres toca la guitarra y le gusta jugar al fútbol. Para obtener algún ingreso trabaja esporádicamente como asistente univeritario en los procesos de matricula en su universidad y dicta clases privadas de matemáticas.El solicitó el préstamo para poder pagar sus pensiones de estudios. ya se encuentra a un año de terminar su carrera. Se siente agradecido con las personas que la pueden ayudar a cumplir sus metas.
texts.en: Luis is a 21-year-old young man at university. Currently he is in the eighth course of his degree in Systems Engineering. He decided to study this degree because it shows him a very wide panorama in which to develop his skills. He says that he wants to specialize in Risk Management Programs. Besides being a very diligent young man, he plays the guitar in his free time and he likes to play football. In order to obtain some income, he occasionally works as an assistant at his university to help with enrolment and he gives private classes in mathematics. He requested the loan in order to be able to pay for his lodgings. He is now a year away from finishing his degree. He is grateful to the people who can help him achieve his goals.

loans.use: to pay for his lodgings at university

loans.name: Livia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal KOSÑIPATA, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Maranura, provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Livia tiene 64 años de edad es viuda y tiene 03 hijos, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a la agricultura, la socia siembra lo que son frutas como naranjas, plátanos entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día su negocio, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante  a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas y abono.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the comunal bank “Kosñipata”. The bank is located in the district of Maranura, in the province of La Convención, in the department of Cusco.

Livia is 64 years old. She is a widow and has three children. She makes a living from agriculture. She plants fruit, such as oranges and bananas. She has had her business for a while and it is going well for her thanks to the effort she puts into her business every day. This is how she supports her family.

The member is requesting the loan in order to buy seeds and compost.

She is grateful for the loan and is committed to making her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy seeds and compost

loans.name: Ayathan

texts.ru: Аятхан 55 лет, замужем, многодетная мать 6 детей. У Аятхан - среднее образование, в данное время занимается сельских хозяйством. Благодаря упорному труду Аятхан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 4 коровы, 20 овец, 9 лошадей. Также земельный надел мерою 2,40 ГА, где Аятхан выращивает клевер, кукурузу, горох для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. Ежемесячный доход составляет 20,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Аятхан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы от кредита Аятхан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины. Также она мечтает накопить средства на свадьбу младшего сына.
texts.en: Ayathan is 55 years old and is a mother of six children. Ayathan has a secondary education and is currently involved in agriculture. Thanks to Ayathan's hard work, today her business has 4 cows, 20 sheep and 9 horses. She also has 2.4 hectares of land, where she grows clover, corn and peas for household consumption and sale. Her monthly income amounts to 20,000 som (KGS). To further develop her business, Ayathan requested a loan in the amount of 60,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy livestock. Ayathan plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing her livestock headcount. She also dreams to save money for her youngest son's wedding.

loans.use: to purchase livestock to grow her business profitability

loans.name: Jerico Group

texts.fr: Balume est une brave commerçante, trésorière et membre d’un groupe d’affaires «Jerico», entrepreneur, dynamique, âgée de 52 ans et mère de 7 enfants, tous scolarisés. La cliente est vendeuse des pagnes. Elle installe ses marchandises dans le marché central de la ville. Elle commença ses affaires avec l’assistance de son mari. Son conjoint est sans emploi. Plus tard, elle bénéficia le prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a 8 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 125 pièces de pagnes. Ainsi, elle souhaite scolariser, et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs non bancables, surtout; pendant ce moment critique post conflits à l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
Balume is a courageous merchant, who is the treasurer and member of "Jerico", a dynamic business group. She is a 52-year-old entrepreneur, mother of seven children all attending school.

The member sells pagnes (colorful West-African fabric), and displays her wares in the city's central market. She started her business with help from her husband, who is currently unemployed.

Afterwards, she was granted a loan from Hekima. She has been running this business for the past eight years, and will use this new loan to buy 125 lengths of pagne fabric.

Her aim is to educate and feed her children. Finally, she is very thankful to Hekima for empowering non-bankable women entrepreneurs, especially during this critical post-conflict period in the Eastern part of the country.

loans.use: buy 125 lengths of pagnes (colorful West-African fabric)

loans.name: María Santos Gloria

texts.es:
María de 39 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado. Su esposo, trabaja como seguridad privada para una empresa en el Municipio. Ellos tienen cuatro hijos de los cuales 2 de ellos trabajan por su cuenta y solo  una señorita de 17 años que estudia el bachillerato y otra de 8 años que estudia tercer grado dependen directamente de ellos.
 
María es costurera, confecciona los uniformes de los alumnos de la comunidad, así como otros trabajos a personas particulares este trabajo lo aprendió cuando tenía 15 años de edad, su padres la inscribieron en un curso de corte y confección y fue así como aprendido y también logro costearse los gastos de los estudios de noveno grado y este mismo trabajo le ha ayudado a sacar adelante a su familia. También hace arreglos florales para el mes de noviembre que se celebra el día de los difuntos, ventas que realiza en el cementerio.
    
El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para repellar las paredes de la casa como arena, cemento, malla, clavos, madera, alambre de amarre y para cancelar la mano de obra calificada como a los ayudantes.

Sus planes a futuro son seguir ganando las licitaciones para la confección de los uniformes de la escuela de la comunidad y de otras cercanas y así brindarle empleo a otras mujeres de la comunidad que realizan esta labor y comprar más máquinas de coser para brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes, ella es muy consiente que esto lo lograra con la ayuda de Dios y con el esfuerzo y dedicación que ella coloque ante este sueño.
texts.en: María is 39 years old and studied up to the ninth form. Her husband works as a security guard for a firm in town. They have four children, two of whom are independent now. The other two, a 17-year-old and an 8-year-old, both girls, are still in school and live with them. María is a seamstress. She makes school uniforms and also takes other orders. She learned the trade when she was fifteen, her parents having signed her up to a course in the matter. This helped her pay for her own studies and now enables her to support her family. In November, she also makes flower arrangements for All Saint's Day, which she sells at the cemetery. She asks CREDICAMPO for a loan in order to buy materials and hire help to repair the walls of her house. She needs sand, concrete, mesh, nails, wood, and tie wire. Her plans for the future include continuing to win tenders for school uniforms, both in her own village and in others, in order to create jobs for other women in her village. She wants to buy more sewing machines so as to provide better service to her customers. She knows that God will help her achieve her goals if she puts in enough effort and dedication.

loans.use: to buy materials and hire help to repair the walls of her house.

loans.name: Zenovia

texts.es:
La socia Zenovia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de comida, la socia realiza diferentes platos como pollo al horno, sopas y saltados de carne, por medio de este negocio la socia quiere salir adelante,el sueño de la socia es abrir un restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos para cocinar como arroz, verduras y pollo.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Zenovia still works selling food. She makes different dishes like baked chicken, soups and sauteed beef dishes. This business is how she supports herself. Her dream is to have her own restaurant. She is asking for a loan in order to buy products for cooking, such as rice, vegetables, and chicken. She is happy to be requesting this loan and promises to be punctual in her repayments.

loans.use: in order to buy ingredients to make food to sell.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de aretes y pulseras, la socia por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio, el sueño de la socia es que su negocio sea más amplio. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar aretes y pulseras.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Francisca continues to work selling earrings and bracelets. She wants to support herself thanks to her business. She has had it for several years and dreams of expanding it. She is requesting the loan to buy earrings and bracelets. She is glad for the loan and promises to make her repayments.

loans.use: to buy earrings and bracelets to sell.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
La socia Maria Elena se sigue dedicando al negocio de restaurant, la socia realiza diferentes platos como pollo al horno, sopas y saltados de carne, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos para cocinar como arroz, verduras y pollo.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Maria Elena is continuing with her restaurant business. She serves baked chicken, soups, and sautéed beef. She works from 8 am  to 6 pm. She has spent eight years working on this business and it is going very well for her. She always dreamt of having a restaurant. She is asking for a loan to buy ingredients to cook, such as rice, vegetables, and chicken. She feels grateful for the loan and promises to be exact in her repayments.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to cook food to sell.

loans.name: Yunis Beatríz

texts.es:
Yunis es una joven de 26 años de edad, estudio hasta octavo grado. Su esposo estudio hasta sexto grado, hace un año decidieron formar su propio hogar y en estos momentos ellos esperan a su primer hijo, ella tiene 5 meses de embarazo.
 
Ella al igual que su esposo se dedican al trabajo en la agricultura, trabajo que ambos aprendieron de sus respectivas familias, su esposo también trabaja como ayudante de albañil en algunas construcciones que realizan en la comunidad, mientras ella trabaja ayudándole a otras familias con los trabajos del hogar; por lo que recibe un salario. Actualmente, poco lo está realizando debido al embarazo.

El préstamo que está solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para pagar el alquiler de la tierra y para comprar fórmula, sulfato, foliares y el pago de las personas que le ayudan a trabajar. 

Su principal objetivo en este momento, es que todo salga bien durante el parto, ya que tienen la fe en Dios de brindarle lo mejor a su primer hijo.  Así mismo, obtener una buena producción de granos básicos para cancelar los compromisos adquiridos y darle la seguridad alimentaria a su familia.
texts.en: Yunis is 26 and studied up to the eighth form. Her husband studied up to the sixth. A year ago, they decided to found a family, and she is expecting. She is five months pregnant. Both her and her husband are farmers, a trade they learned from their respective parents. The husband also works as an assistant bricklayer on some construction sites in the area, while Yunis also works as a domestic employee, something for which she receives a salary. However, due to her pregnancy, she scaled down on the latter activity. She asks CREDICAMPO for a loan in order to pay rent on the land, buy farm supplies (growth formula, sulphate, foliar fertiliser), and pay farm hands' wages. Her main goal at the moment is for the pregnancy to go without a hitch, since she wants to give her first child the best. Thus, she hopes for a bountiful harvest that would enable to repay her loan and keep her family well-fed.

loans.use: to pay rent on the land, buy farm supplies, and pay farm hands' wages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials and hire help to repair the walls of the house and lay a concrete floor.

loans.name: Bernardina

texts.es:
La socia Bernardina se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de granos secos como maiz, trigo entre otros, la socia por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de granos. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar maiz, cebada y trigo.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Bernardina continues to make a living from the sale of dried grains. She sells wheat, barley and sweetcorn. She hopes to be able to support herself with this business, and her dream is to expand it. She is requesting this loan to buy sweetcorn, wheat and barley. She is grateful for the loan and pledges to be punctual in her repayments.

loans.use: to buy sweetcorn, wheat, and barley.

loans.name: Juana Elizabeth

texts.es:
La socia Juana Elizabeth se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de accesorios para carros, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 6 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de accesorios para carros. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar llantas, espejos y parabrisas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Juana Elizabeth continues working selling automobile accessories. She works from 8:00 a.m. to 7:00 p.m. She has been working in this business for six years, and her business is doing well. Juana Elizabeth's dream is to grow her car accessories business. She is requesting a loan to buy tires, mirrors, and windshields. Juana is pleased to receive the loan and is committed to making the repayments.

loans.use: to buy tires, mirrors, and windshields

loans.name: Les Amis De La Paix Group

texts.fr: Surimuani est commerçante et presidente de la banque communautaire Les amis de la paix, cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée, âgée de 39 ans, mère de 2 enfants tous scolarisés. Elle commença son business avec de fonds de reçu de son mari. Elle est sociétaire d’un magasin de divers habillements et valises depuis 14 ans. Elle va acheter 25 valises, 30 pantalons et 40 chemises. Son conjoint est un commerçant. Elle souhaite obtenir plus des crédits, acheter la parcelle, construire, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Surimuani is a merchant, president of the "Amis de la Paix" community bank, and an affiliate of the Hekima MFI. She is a 39-year-old married mother of two children, both attending school.

She started her business with funds received from her husband. For the past 14 years she has been an associate in a store selling various types of clothing and suitcases. She will buy 25 suitcases, 30 pairs of trousers and 40 shirts. Her husband is also a merchant.

She wants more credit so she can buy some land to build on, and educate and feed her children. Finally, she is very thankful to Hekima for supporting non-bankable entrepreneurs.

loans.use: buy 25 suitcases, 30 pairs of trousers and 40 shirts.

loans.name: Robert Kazuo

texts.en:
The Brutti Co dba Brilliant Diamond Cleaner (“The Company”) was established in April, 2002 in California. The founder of the company, Robert, has been in the jewelry business for 30 years now, manufacturing jewelry cleaner for 12 years.  If someone ever goes to a jewelry store, and they have a spray cleaner with their name on it, it’s probably Robert's. He began when one day, when he was working at a retail jewelry store. Someone brought in a diamond ring that had to be over 100 years old, and she couldn’t clean it. Robert tried and couldn’t clean it either, until he noticed that the diamond had a white coating. No jewelry cleaner has a hard water remover, so he mixed some up and voila; “Brilliant Diamond Cleaner” was born. A few years later in 2006, his company was the first jewelry cleaner picked for the Oscars Gift Bags.

The Company had an amazing run until the economic crash of 2008, when 1/3 of Robert’s jewelry store clients went out of business. Sales plummeted, but it taught him the lesson of being “nimble” in business-to control his costs with vendors.   

Kiva is helping Robert by eliminating outsourcing a cost for his product with an equipment purchase. And as Robert has often found, this cost savings allows him more flexibility in sales to try new pricing and marketing campaigns.  And even if his sales remain flat from last year, a 15% reduction in costs is just like a 30% increase in sales!  Thank you Kiva!

loans.use: to purchase equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farming implements.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm supplies in order to keep achieving his entrepreneurial goals.

loans.name: Philadelphie A Group

texts.fr: Mwanvua est commerçante et présidente de la banque communautaire Philadelphie A, cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée, âgée de 45 ans, mère de 3 enfants, 2 vont à l’école et 1 marié. Elle commença son business avec de fonds de reçu de son mari. Elle est vendeuse des friperies depuis 12 ans. Elle va acheter 210 cartables, 2 ballons d'habits. Son conjoint est sans emploi. Elle souhaite obtenir plus des crédits, construire une belle maison, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Mwanvua is a merchant, president of the "Philadelphie A" community bank, and an affiliate of the Hekima MFI. She is a 45-year-old married mother of three children, of whom two attend school and one is married.

She started her business with funds received from her husband, and has been selling used clothing for the past 12 years. She will buy 210 schoolbags, and two bales of clothes. Her spouse is unemployed.

She would like more credit so she can build a nice house, educate and feed her children. Finally, she is very thankful to Hekima for its support to non-bankable entrepreneurs.

loans.use: buy 210 schoolbags, two bales of clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Philadelphie B Group

texts.fr: Mongane est femme d’affaires et trésorière du groupe solidaire Philadelphie B, cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée, âgée de 25 ans, mère de 3 enfants tous scolarisés. Elle commença son business avec de fonds de reçu  de son mari. Elle est sociétaire d’un magasin de divers habillements hommes depuis 6 ans. Elle va acheter 50 pantalons, 100 chemises et 3 vestes. Son conjoint est un commerçant. Elle souhaite acheter une parcelle, construire, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Mongane is a business-woman, treasurer of the "Philadelphie B" solidarity group, and an affiliate of the Hekima MFI. She is a 25-year-old married mother of three children, all of whom attend school.

She started her business with funds received from her husband, and has been an associate in a men's clothing store for the past six years.. She will buy 50 pairs of trousers, 100 shirts, and 3 jackets. Her husband is also a merchant.

She would like to buy some land to build on, educate and feed her children. Finally, she is thankful to Hekima for its support to non-bankable entrepreneurs.

loans.use: buy 50 pairs of trousers, 100 shirts, and 3 jackets.

loans.name: Triphine

texts.en:
Triphine is 35 years old, she is married with 5 children aged between 3 and 15; four of them go to school. She has been farming for 11 years. She will use her Kiva loan to support labor costs and fertilizer during rice production: they need to buy fertilizers in order to increase their production. She wants to invest the profits from her farming into her business so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity.
 
The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under-served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Luvuno

texts.en:
Luvuno is a married woman with three school-going children. They live in their own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past year, she has operated a tailoring business, operating from the market where neighbours and passersby are potential customers. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation.

With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase cloth materials, needles, and repair her broken sewing machine.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials, needles, and repair her broken sewing machine.

She will use her Kiva loan to support labor costs and fertilizer during rice production: they need to buy fertilizers in order to increase their production.
