loans.name: Prasansajana Shg Group

texts.en:
The group Prasansajana Self Help Group has nine members who are all from the same neighborhood. The lady standing with her hand raised in the photo is Silamani who is the leader of the group. Silamani is a 31-year-old woman who is married to a worker and is from Koraput district in Odisha, India. The couple has four children who are in school. Silamani lives with her children and, together with her husband, takes care of all the household expenses. In order to help with all the family's expenses, Silamani has been involved in selling rice in the nearby market and selling to the dealers of rice in the district supermarket, for the past eight years. She purchases rice directly from the farmers. Then she supplies it to the rice dealers and sells it in the nearby market. 

In order to strengthen the business and respond to client demand, Silamani, and the other members of the group, are requesting a loan from People's Forum to purchase rice in bulk to store in a warehouse in order to fulfill future demand and to cover their operational costs. Their goal is to increase their business activities.

loans.use: to purchase rice in bulk.

loans.name: Laurence

texts.en:
Laurence is 52 years old; she is married with four children and all of them go to school. She has been farming for 22 years. 

She will use the Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizer during rice production; they need to buy fertilizer in order to increase their production. With profits from her farming, she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity.
 
The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). loans.name: Grupo Mujeres Las Doñitas Group

texts.es:
De 27 años de edad ya con grandes aspiraciones en dar a conocer a su comunidad y a todos los que la visitan la actividad que ella realiza con tanto esfuerzo y dedicación, casada y vive con su esposo con el deseo de superar en la vida e alcanzar grandes sueños que ella quiere realizar en la vida, ella tiene tres hijos los primeros dos hijos ya tienen familias apartes y el ultimo es un excelente estudiante en la escuela de su comunidad, (Ana es la que se encuentra de 1ra de derecha a izquierda)
		
El trabajo que ella realiza con tanto esmero es la compra venta y tejedora de cortes típicas dicha actividad lo realiza en su casa y en lugares cercanos de su comunidad donde ella vive, la segunda actividad que ella realiza es la venta de frutas negocio que realiza con una hermana por más de cinco años porque les genera una ganancia para el bienestar de su familia y mejorar las condiciones económicas de su familia y comunidad.

Ella ha sido un ejemplo en su comunidad y es por ello que un grupo de mujeres se han unido a Ana para poder emprender sus negocios para que cada uno de ellas pueda supera y tener ingresos importantes.

El uso que ella le dará al préstamo que ella está realizando es para la compra de hilos para poder realizar su trabajo de tejer los trajes típicos par luego a su respectiva venta por los  alrededores. Uno de las aspiraciones de ella es tener un local en el mercado de su comunidad y ver que sus hijos se convierten en profesionales en la vida y construir casas para sus hijos.
texts.en: Ana is 27 years old and has a great desire to spread the word within her community and to the people who visit there about the work that she does with such dedication. Ana is married and lives with her husband and wants to get ahead in life and achieve her dreams. She has three children, two of whom already have their own families, and a third child, who is an excellent student and attends the community school. Ana is the woman on the right of the photo. She works very hard buying and selling traditional Guatemalan clothing and also carries out the painstaking work of weaving the clothing she sells. Ana works from home and also in neighboring communities. Ana also sells fruits - a business that she has run with her sister for over five years, as this generates income that ensures the well-being of her family and improves the finances of her family and their community. Ana has been an example for other people  in her community, and that is why they have joined with her to improve their businesses so that each one of them can get ahead and receive a greater income. Ana will use the loan to buy thread to use to weave the typical clothing that she creates to then sell in the surrounding area. One of Ana's hopes is to have her own stall at the community market and see her children become professionals, as well as building homes for her children.

loans.use: to buy supplies to produce traditional clothing

loans.name: Leoncie

texts.en:
Leoncie is 34 years old; she is married with five children, and three of them go to school. She has been farming for 10 years. 

She will use the Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizer during rice production; they need to buy fertilizer in order to increase their production. With profits from her farming, she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity.
 
The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer

loans.name: Walter Enoth

texts.es:
El señor Walter es un hombre de 60 años de edad quien por necesidad le toco alquilar la lavadora de su casa esperando tener un beneficio que le permitirá ingresar alimento a su casa, opto por esta opción pues a sus 60 años es difícil emplearse por estar próximo a jubilarse. 

Gracias a los buenos resultados el señor Walter se animó a acercarse a un entidad que le ayude y le de la mano para comprar más lavadoras y hacer de esto un negocio próspero y que le ayude a sostener su vejez y familia. 

Solicita aun crédito para comprar lavadoras para ampliar su cobertura y disponer de 2 lavadoras y se compromete a pagarlo muy puntualmente pues quiere tener más créditos que le permitan crecer
texts.en:
Walter is a 60-year-old man who, because of an economic need, decided to rent out the washing machine in his home, hoping to get an economic benefit that would permit him to continue providing sustenance to his household. He opted to do so because at his 60 years of age, it is difficult for him to obtain a job since he is close to retiring age.

Thanks to the good results he has obtained, Walter was encouraged to approach a [lending] entity to help and support him in the purchase of more washing machines to make this a prosperous business which will help sustain him in his old age and his family.

He is requesting a loan to buy washing machines to increase his coverage and to have 2 washing machines available. He is committed to pay pack the loan on time since he wishes to obtain more loans that will permit him to grow.

loans.use: to buy a washing machine to rent out since he currently uses the one in his home

loans.name: Maricela De Jesus

texts.es:
La  señora Maricela una persona emprendedora  honesta  y seria, vive con su esposo y sus  hijos   en el  sur de Honduras. Su negocio es la  compra y venta  de  ganado. 
Doña Maricela el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de vacas,  con el préstamo espera que las ventas en su negocio aumenten al tener más mercancía que ofrecer a los clientes y cubrir las necesidades de los mismos.
Doña Maricela con esto mejorar la situación  económica  de su  familia uno de sus sueños es que en unos 3 años  su negocio siga  creciendo y  consolidándose  para que se convierta en la más grande y  reconocido de la zona y poder así seguir  apoyando a su familia.

Choluteca, Honduras –  Agosto del   2014
texts.en:
Maricela is an entrepreneurial, honest and serious person. She lives with her husband and children in the south of Honduras. Her business is the purchase and sale of cattle.

Doña Maricela needs this loan to buy cows. She hopes that with this loan the sales of her business will increase since she will have more merchandise to offers customers and to cover their needs.

Doña Maricela hopes to improve the economic situation of her family with this. One of her dreams is that in about 3 years her business will have grown and consolidated into the biggest and most renown in the area, and so to keep supporting her family.guir  apoyando a su familia.

Choluteca, Honduras – August 2014

loans.use: to buy cows for her business

loans.name: Tabita Group

texts.fr: Mufungizi est commerçant et membre de la banque communautaire Tabita, client de l’IMF Hekima, marié, âgé de 49 ans, père de 9 enfants tous scolarisés. Il commença son business avec de fonds de reçu quand il fut enseignant. Il est sociétaire d’une boutique avec divers articles manufacturés depuis 2 ans. Il va acheter les savons, bougies, sardines, biscuits, stylos, cahiers etc. Sa conjointe est une commerçante. Il souhaite obtenir plus des crédits pour accroitre son chiffre d’affaires, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, il remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux petits entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en: Mufungizi is a shop owner and member of the Tabita Group, a client of IMF Hekima. He is married, 49 years old, and father of nine children who all attend school.  He started his business with funds received from when he was a teacher.  He has been an associate of a general store selling miscellaneous manufactured goods for two years. With his loan, he will buy to buy soap, candles, sardines, cookies, pens, notebooks, etc. His wife is a shop owner. He wishes to obtain more loans to increase his revenue and to pay for his children's food and school fees.  Finally, he thanks Hekima for supporting small entrepreneurs not served by traditional banks.

loans.use: to buy soap, candles, sardines, cookies, pens, notebooks, etc.

Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers. 
.

loans.name: Saouda's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe crée depuis Décembre 2011,est constitué de 23 membres qui habitent la même localité. Elles exercent toutes le commerce comme activité principale.

Fatoumata,se trouvant à gauche de la photo,levant la main, est la responsable du groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de neuf(09) enfants dont six(06)garçons. Elle est matrone et fait en même temps du commerce.

Avec son crédit,elle compte acheter 15 sacs de pain de singe de 50kg à 60 000f, 20 seaux de pâte d'arachide à 32 000f et 8 000f pour les frais de transport.

Avec ses bénéfices,elle souhaite renforcer son épargne et participer à  la prise en charge familiale.
texts.en: This group was created in December 2011 and consists of 23 members who live in the same area. They all run businesses as their main activity.  Fatoumata, at the right of the photo with her hand raised is the manager of the group.  She is married and mother of nine children, six of which are boys.  She is the head of household as well as a business owner.  With her loan, she plans to buy 15 50-kg bags of baobab fruits for 60,000 FCFA, 20 buckets of peanut butter for 32,000 FCFA, and to pay for the transportation costs.  With her profits, she wishes to strengthen her savings and to participate in taking care of family expenses.

loans.use: to buy baobab fruit, honey, and peanut butter.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Lenders! Meet Peter, 60 years of age and one of the most dedicated farmers in his rural town of Thika. He is happily married and blessed with 3 lovely school-going children. He is the bread winner in his family since his wife has no formal job. Through milk, eggs, tea and a variety of food crop he has been able to earn a decent income. Of all the activities he is involved in dairy farming is close to his heart. He passionately loves dairy farming and to prove this he has even nicknamed one of his cows “kairu”. Feeding his cows is his hobby. Waking up every day in the morning to milk his cows makes him feel fulfilled. To increase productivity of his dairy cows from the current 5-10 litres a day to 15-25 litres a day he needs to properly feed his cows and this is the only secret to success. 

He is requesting for a loan to buy a chaff cutter. The importance of a chaff cutter is to cut hay and straw into small pieces before mixing it with forage to feed the cows. Through the loan his cows will never have digestion complications and also the cows will never reject food and hence he will have increasing milk productivity. With your loan his cows will increase milk productivity and through increased income and profit margins he will meet the basic needs of his family. His family will enjoy an improved diet and apart from that he will secure the future of his grandchildren by paying tuition fees for them since they depend on him.

loans.use: To purchase a chaff cutter.

loans.name: Kuluda

texts.en:
Kuluda is a 41 year old married woman with three children all attending different schools. She is an agriculturalist who grows matooke (green plantain) and is also involved in maize milling. She works six days a week, six hours a day.
She also works as a primary school teacher, where she gets an additional income to support her family and has been a teacher since 1998. She was motivated by the desire to supplement the family income so that she can provide necessities for her family.
Kuluda hopes to use the loan to buy a maize milling machine so that she can improve her business. She usually sells her products to local customers and fellow traders around Kitonezi and surrounding areas. Her hopes and dreams are to diversify her agricultural business and start poultry farming.
However, she faces challenges of drought and pests and diseases, especially banana wilt, which affects her greatly. She is described as an honest and hard working woman and asks lenders to improve on the loan processing speed.

loans.use: To buy a maize milling machine

loans.name: Francois

Francois aged 30 years is married and has two children, one of whom goes to school. He has been farming for 10 years. He will use this Kiva loan to support labor costs and to buy fertilizer during rice production: he needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.name: Tabita B Group

texts.fr: Malemo est commerçante et trésorière de la banque communautaire Tabita B, cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée, âgée de 45 ans, mère de 2 enfants dont 1 scolarisé et 1 est gosse. Elle commença son business avec de fonds de reçu  de son mari. Elle est sociétaire d’une maison des pièces de rechange depuis 7 ans. Elle va acheter les pneus, amortisseurs, segments, coussinets et les huiles moteurs. Son conjoint est un fonctionnaire de la place. Elle souhaite obtenir plus des crédits pour accroitre son chiffre d’affaires, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish,  elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en: Malemo is a business owner and treasurer of the Tabita B borrowing group, a client of IMF Hekima. She is married, 45 years old, and mother of two children, one attending school and one still too young for school.  She started her business with funds received from her husband.  She has been an associate in a spare parts store for seven years. With her loan, she will  buy tires, shock absorbers, piston rings, bearings, and motor oils.  Her husband is a civil servant where they live.  She wishes to obtain more loans to increase her revenues and to pay for her children's food and school fees.  Finally, she thanks Hekima for supporting entrepreneurs not served by traditional banks.

loans.use: to buy tires, shock absorbers, piston rings, bearings, and motor oils.

loans.name: Augustin

texts.en:
Augustin, 32, is married with two children aged five and seven. Both children go to school.

Augustin has been farming for six years. He will use this Kiva loan to buy fertilizer and support labour costs during rice production. He needs to buy fertilizer to increase his production.

With profits from his farming, Augustin wishes to invest in his business so, in future, he can acquire machines and tractors and enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition, because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer and support labour costs during rice production

loans.name: Maa Gayatri Shg Group

texts.en:
The group Maa Gayatri Self Help Group (SHG) has 10 members who are all from the same neighborhood. The lady standing fourth from right wearing a sky colour sari in the photo is Subhabati. She is the leader of the group. Subhabati is a 40-year-old woman married to a farmer. The couple has two children who are in school. Subhabati lives with her children and, together with her husband, takes care of all the household expenses. In order to help with all the family expenses, Subhabati has been involved in doing paddy cultivation and selling it to distributors for the past 12 years. She supplies her rice to the rice dealers in the nearby market. 

In order to strengthen the business and respond to client demand, Subhabati, together with the group Maa Gayatri Shg, is requesting a loan from Peoples Forum to purchase fertilizers, pesticides, and seeds and to cover operational costs. Their goal is to increase their business activity.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, pesticides, and seeds

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel, 32, is married with three children. All the children go to school. 

Samuel has spent nine years in the rice farming business. He will use this Kiva loan to buy fertilizer and support labour costs during rice production. He  needs to buy fertilizer to increase his production.

With profits from his farming, Samuel wishes to invest in his business so, in future, he can acquire machines and tractors and enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition, because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer and support labour costs during rice production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in the purchase of men, women and baby clothes, toys and personal-use accessories

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “NUEVO AMANECER”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
El socio continua trabajando en una agencia de viajes, el socio es una persona responsable y empeñoso, él socio continua trasladando a sus turistas a los distintos tours que realizan, siendo de esta manera que el socio sale adelante.
El socio solicita el crédito para la compra de boletos de tren.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de frutas, negocio de vidriería, artesanía.
La socia que sale adjunta a la foto pidió permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
 El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en: The members belong to a communal bank called A New Dawn (Nuevo Amanecer). The group is located in the Cusco district, part of the Cusco province and Cusco department. One of the members, Richard, continues working in a travel agency and is responsible and persevering. He makes a living taking tourist on organized tours. He is requesting the loan to buy train tickets for the trips. The other members of the group work in fruit sales, glassware sales and crafts sales. The group member who can be seen in the inserted photo asked for permission to arrive late to the meeting as she was working. Richard is grateful to those who form part of his dream through this program and is committed to making his payments on time.

loans.use: to buy train tickets to take tourists on organized tours.

loans.name: Gabane Group

texts.en:
Ahmed is 60 years old and lives in Hargeisa City, Somaliland. He has his hand raised in the group photo. 

Ahmed is married with five children who have all finished school. For the past  year, he has been working hard to manage his clothing business. He sells clothes in the Hargeisa Market. 

Ahmed is the leader of this group, known as Gabane. Each member of this group has his or her own existing business, and they all need to expand their businesses.

To help expand his business, Ahmed has requested a loan of $700.  The loan will be used to buy more clothes and will help Ahmed to generate greater profits and increase his working capital. 

He hopes that, in the future, he will be able to open up another shop or enlarge his existing one.

loans.use: To expand his clothing sales shop

loans.name: Girasoles Del Centro Group

texts.en:
The Friendship Bridge trust bank “Girasoles del Centro” is located in De Cantel en Quetzaltenango, Guatemala and is a group of nine very active women who, above all, want to better their quality of life.

Rosa is 43 years old and a widow with 8 children who range in age from 12 years to 27 years.  She is a member of the group and is very excited to begin a second loan cycle through Friendship Bridge.  Rosa sells natural fruit juices and other healthy foods for daily needs.  Her business income is able only to pay for the costs of maintaining her home.   She is requesting a new loan in order to buy more product to cover all of her customer demands because without more investment capital, she feels that her own income is not sufficient. 

Besides the loans, Rosa and the other members of “Girasoles del Centro” also benefit from the Friendship “Microcredit Plus” combination of loans and education. The Friendship Bridge Loan Officer shares timely and useful information with the ladies on a variety of subjects like health, hygiene, and nutrition as well as self-esteem and violence against women. The women learn about effective business management practices and customer service, as well as gain essential knowledge about business planning, budgeting, accounting, customer service, marketing and pricing.  All of these subjects help them better their lives both economically and developmentally.  Thank you KIVA investors!

loans.use: to buy more fresh fruits and necessary ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Tujyinama Cb Group

texts.en:
Apollinaire is a group leader, age 32. She is married with three children who are between 1 and 4 years old, but who do not yet go to school. The group name is Tujyinama, which means "advisers" in English. The group members sell different items and they have same ideas to improve their business. 

Apollinaire sells bananas and has been selling them for ten years. With the loan, she would like to buy more bananas to sell. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and buy food stuffs.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell.

loans.name: Benirinda

texts.en:
Benirinda is 38 years old and married with five children between the ages of 2 and 8. Three of them go to school. She has been farming for 15 years. She will use the Kiva loan to pay for labor costs and fertilizer for her rice crop. She needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. With profits from her farming, she wants to acquire machines and tractors in the future to enhance her farming capacity.

The agricultural sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to purchase more fertilizer for her rice crop.

loans.name: Zigama Cb Group

texts.en: Marie Anne, age 32, is a group leader of Zigama. She is married with two children who are 5 and 2 years old. One of them goes to school. The group name means "saving" in English. They sell different items; all of them aim to improve their businesses to increase their standard of living. She sells bananas and has been running this business for four years. With the loan, she would like to buy more bananas for resale. The profit from the business will be used to buy domestic animals, such as goats and sheep.

loans.use: To buy more bananas for resale

loans.name: Esmeralda Group

texts.en:
Totonicapan is located in the Western Highlands of Guatemala.  Not long ago, a new Friendship Bridge Trust Bank called “Esmeralda” was formed in one of Totonicapan’s municipalities.  “Esmeralda” is made up of 10 entrepreneurial women who want to improve their different businesses that include selling tortillas, fruits, corn meal processing, animal husbandry, and typical woven textiles, as well as small shops with sundry daily items.

One of the group’s members is Celestina, who is 38 years old and married. She has 8 children - the oldest is 19 and the youngest is 6.  Her husband is a field worker whose income is not suffient enough for the family’s needs since their children are in school.  A few years ago, Celestina began a business selling tortillas in the market in Totonicapan.  After awhile she was able to open another tortilla stall in the market.  Now, with 2 stalls, she needs captital to maintain and grow the businesses.  She is requesting a loan in order to purchase several bags of corn, lime, wood, and other products that will make her businesses more successful.  Since Celestina’s businesses had increased in sales, she was able to hire two women to help her make her orders on time.

The members of the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Esmeralda” are very grateful to the KIVA investors for giving them the opportunity to receive loans which, with the new capital, makes it possible for their businesses to grow.  Thank you KIVA investors!

loans.use: to purchase several bags of corn, lime, wood, and other products that will make her businesses more successful.

loans.name: Nohemy Group

texts.en:
Santa Lucia is a municipality of the Guatemalan Department of Solola where the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Nohemy” is located. The majority of the population speaks the Mayan Quiche language. They also know and speak Spanish very well but don’t know how to write it. “Nohemy” is composed of seven women whose median age is 39 years. They are beginning their first loan cycle with Friendship Bridge.

The president of the group is Elidia, who is 42 years old, a single mother with three children, two of whom are in school, with the eldest attending the university.  Because she has her children in school, she is quite motivated to continue to strive to ensure their education.  Elidia’s business is making typical Guatemalan sweets, which she sells along with other food.  The sale of the sweets generates enough revenue to keep her family going. She is asking for a loan to buy fruits for her sweets, ingredients for her other edibles and material for her business to grow. 

Elidia and the other members of “Nohemy” thank the investors of Kiva around the world for giving them the opportunity to have much needed working capital so they can improve their businesses and thus improve their quality of life.

loans.use: To buy fruits for her sweets, ingredients for her other edibles and material for her business to grow.

loans.name: Kothari Shg Group

texts.en:
Lili, the lady standing with her raised hand, is the president of Kothari Self-Help Group (SHG). She is 26 and has two children, and she formed this group to help the women in her village improve their livelihoods so they can better support their families. Together, the women in the group live in a small village in the coastal region of Odisha, a state in Eastern India. Most of the women either raise fish, work in dairy farming, or operate small individual businesses in the village. 

Lili will use a portion of her group's 150,000 rupee loan to expand her fishery. Specifically, she will buy fish food and baby fish to raise in a pond near her house. She is confident that increasing the number of fishes she raises will increase her family income and allow her to have enough money to send her children to extra tutoring courses in the evenings so that they will be able to perform better in their studies and get a good education. It will help a lot for her family to be more independent, she says, and also earn a better standard of living. 

Her husband works as a mechanic and she will use some of the profits from her fishery to invest in his business as well. The women in Kothari SHG dream of purchasing a large pond so they can raise more fish together and earn more profits.

loans.use: To buy fish food and baby fish to raise in her fish pond.

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en:
Natividad, pictured with her husband, Mario, works selling candies and related products such as chocolates and peanuts in bulk. She sells in different flea markets located in the state of Mexico. She works in different markets depending on the day. She is 32 years old and has two children, ages 10 and 5. She likes to exercise and spend time with her children. 

She is asking for a loan to invest in more products for her business. By buying in bulk she is able to reduce her costs and increase her profits.

She started the business 10 years ago and says that she has been able to build a second floor in her parents' house and also buy a truck.

loans.use: to invest in candies and other related products for her business.

loans.name: Aleyda

texts.es:
La señora Aleyda  es una persona muy responsable, honesta y trabajadora, vive  con su  esposo y sus hijas al sur de Honduras. Su negocio es una pulpería. 
Doña Aleyda el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de refrescos, carne, maíz, leche, frijoles, manteca, jabón, etc. Con  el préstamo el  espera tener más mercadería que ofrecer para  poder cubrir los pedidos que en  esta temporada  recibe de sus clientes. 
Doña Aleyda  con los ingresos obtenidos espera mejorar su un poco su situación económica  y la de su familia. En el futuro el espera que su negocio sea  una pulpería más  grande y que gracias a la inversión hecha en el mismo logre sacarlos adelante para que tengan mejores oportunidades mejores oportunidades  para la  sociedad.



Choluteca, Honduras –  Agosto  del  2014
texts.en:
Aleyda's a very responsible, honest, and hardworking woman.  She lives with her husband and children in the south of Honduras.  Her business is a grocery store.

Aleyda needs the loan to buy soft drinks, meat, corn, milk, beans, shortening, soap, and so on.  With the loan she hopes to have more merchandise to sell so she can cover the requests she gets from her customers this time of year.

Aleyda hopes to improve her family's financial situation somewhat with the income she earns.  She hopes to have a bigger grocery store in the future and to get them ahead so they have better opportunities for society.

Choluteca, Honduras, August 2014

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, meat, corn, milk, beans, shortening, soap, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Ep Kabuye Group

texts.fr: Monsieur Dunia est le représentant de l’école primaire Kabuye, une institution éducative présente dans la ville.  Il a pris connaissance de l’existence du produit credit enseignant au sein de Hekima qui a retenu son  attention. Cet ainsi, qu’il vient de solliciter un crédit pour améliorer son habitat. Son objectif est d’offrir à sa famille les meilleures conditions de vie. Il remercie Hekima pour cette nouvelle initiative en faveur des enseignants.
texts.en: Mr. Dunia represents Kabuye primary school, an educational institution implanted in this town. He has learned of the existence of Hekima’s teacher loan offer, which attracted his attention. This is why he just requested a loan to improve his housing conditions. His initial goal is to give his family the best living conditions. He thanks Hekima for this new initiative in favor of teachers.

loans.use: improve his housing conditions.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to care for her cocoa crops.

loans.name: Madrine

texts.en:
Madrine is married with two children and lives in Kagadi, Uganda, where she has been selling second-hand clothes since 2003, together with farming for income generation. 

Her businesses are challenged by insufficient capital but through hardworking, she is determined to take her business to greater heights. Madrine is requesting a loan to buy bed sheets to sell.

loans.use: to buy bed sheets  to sell.

loans.name: Simeón

texts.es:
Simeón de 57 años d edad,  estudio apenas hasta el 3° grado, está acompañado desde hace diez años, ellos tiene 3 hijos en común, él es agricultor en pequeño y su compañero de vida no trabaja, ya que ella tampoco pudo superarse en su educación.

Simeón es un agricultor en pequeño, su padre fue quien muy corta edad le enseño todo lo necesario para el cultivo de maíz y maicillo, él trabaja arduamente en la agricultura ya que cuando su cosecha logra germinar toda, él vende cierta parte en el mercado para lograr un poco de ganancia en su cultivo. Su horario es de 6:00 am a 12:00 pm, él camina 2 kilómetros diariamente para poder llegar a la montaña donde cultiva su semilla.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar fertilizantes, veneno etc. la intensión de cultivar maíz, es de poder proporcionar los granos básicos para su familia y vender cierta parte que le provea a tener algo estable.

Simeón invertirá las ganancias que genere su cultivo, en la educación de sus hijos ya que el describe que ellos son su mayor prioridad, y a la vez mejorar su condición de vida tanto para él y su familia.
texts.en: Simeón is 57 years old and studied only up to the fifth form. He has been married for ten years. They have three children. He is a small farmer and his wife does not work, since she was not able to finish school either. Simeón learned the trade at a very young age from his father, who taught him how to grow sweetcorn and sorghum. He works very hard to till the land and it pays off, since, when he harvests, he manages to have seeds from every plant. He sells part of the harvest at the market in order to make some business. He works from 6 am to noon and has to walk 2 km each day to go to the mountain where he grows his crops. He asks CREDICAMPO for a loan in order to buy fertiliser and insecticide. He will use these supplies to keep growing sweetcorn in order to feed his family and sell part of his production so as to have a stable income. He will invest his profits back into his crops and part of it will go towards funding his children's education, since he describes the little ones as his greatest priority. He wants to improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Zoilo Adalverto

texts.es:
Zoilo Adalverto es un señor de 65 años, casado, padre de familia. Habita en el municipio de El Sauce, tierra de leche y miel ubicada al occidente de Nicaragua.
Don Zoilo se crió entre familia campesina y le heredaron el don de saber elaborar ladrillos y tejas el cual esa es su actividad principal.
Este material es el que generalmente utilizan los pobladores para construir viviendas el cual es a base de barro (tierra) y luego se somete a un horno de leña con temperaturas altas para quemar el ladrillo y la teja. El ladrillo es para levantar paredes y la teja para el techo.
Este negocio lo tiene ubicado en su vivienda en hectáreas grandes en el caserío llamado la Tejera que por su actividad los pobladores lo bautizaron con ese nombre.
Don Zoilo en este momento tiene la necesidad de un préstamo para la compra de leña y pago de mano de obra, ya que viene la temporada buena de verano donde las personas aprovechan para construir por lo que quiere agilizar la producción del ladrillo y la teja.
Espera que Kiva y Ceprodel le sigan apoyando como lo han hecho en varias ocasiones donde se siente muy agradecidos con ellos.
texts.en:
Zoilo Adalverto, age 65, is married and has children.  He lives in the El Sauce municipality.  It is a land of milk and honey located in western Nicaragua.

Zoilo was raised in a country family, and they passed on to him the gift of knowing how to make bricks and tiles.  This is his main business activity.  The population generally uses this material to build houses.  It is made from a base of clay (mud), and then it is put in a wood oven at high temperatures to burn the brick and tile.  The brick is to raise walls, and the tile is for the roof.

This business is located at his house, where he has a lot of hectares in the settlement called Tejera [teja means tile].  It is because of his business activity that the inhabitants baptized it with this name.

Zoilo now needs a loan to buy firewood and to pay for labor because the good summer season is approaching.  This is when people take advantage of the weather to build.  Therefore, he wants to accelerate the brick and tile production.

He hopes that Kiva and CEPRODEL continue supporting him as they have done on various occasions.  He is very grateful to them.

loans.use: to buy firewood and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy adobe, roof tiles, wooden beams, and cane for building her adobe house

loans.name: Sulma Fátima

texts.es:
Sulma de 28 años de edad, puedo realizar sus estudios hasta básica. Está casada y junto a su esposo ha emprendido su propio negocio (comercializan de carne de res) y a la vez comercializan ropa en las temporadas de vacaciones, ellos tienen una hija de tan solo 6 años de edad, junto a su esposa tratan la manera de darle lo mejor a su pequeña hija, para que pueda tener una mejor calidad de vida.

Sulma tiene 8 años de dedicarse al negocio de las ventas de carne, ella distribuye su producto a casi todos los restaurantes ubicados en la zona comercial. Ella proviene de una familia de comerciantes,  y ella sigue emprendiendo el negocio en el mercado como ha hecho su familia por muchos años, su esposo es quien le ayuda en su negocio, todos los días se trasladan 4 kilómetros en bus para poder ejercer sus ventas en su pequeño local el cual abren de 7:00, A.M a 4:00 PM

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar llinas, calzonetas, pelotas, zapatos etc. necesita aumentar el inventario de sus productos para generar a un más sus ventas y  generar más ganancias, lo cual ayudara a mejorar su estatus de vida de su familia.

Sulma planea a futuro terminar la construcción de una vivienda de su propiedad, ya que actualmente ella vive con sus suegros, con la ganancias generadas volverá a invertir en su negocio.
texts.en: Sulma is 28 and finished school. She is married and, together with her husband, has her own business: they sell beef. She also sells clothes during the holiday season. They have a daughter aged 6. They want the best for her. Sulma works 8 hours a day selling beef. She does business with almost every restaurant in the commercial district. She comes from a family of traders and took over the family business. Her husband helps her. They travel every day 4 km by bus in order to sell from their small shop, which they keep open from 7 am to 4 pm. She asks Credicampo for a loan in order to buy flip-flops, bathing suits, beach balls, shoes, etc. She needs to have more products to sell for the holiday season in order to generate more income. This would help her improve her family's standard of living. Her plans for the future include adding an extra room to her house, since her in-laws live with her. She will invest the profits from her sales back into her business.

loans.use: to buy more products to increase her sales.

loans.name: Tenez Bon Group

texts.fr: Mufabule est commerçante, dynamique, entrepreneur depuis 20 ans est membre d’une Association d’Affaires «Tenez Bon», âgée de 49 ans, mariée et mère de 5 enfants scolarisés. Elle est propriétaire d’une maison d’alimentation dans le centre commercial de la ville. Son conjoint est sans emploi. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre son activité. Elle va acheter des vins, liqueurs etc. Elle démarra ses affaires avec le fonds  reçu de son mari. Dans l’avenir, elle souhaite construire une maison, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux femmes entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Mufabule is a dynamic salesperson. An entrepreneur for 20 years, she belongs to a Business Group, “Tenez Bon” (“Hold On”). She is 49, married, and a mother of five children, who all attend school. She owns a food store in the town’s commercial center. Her husband is unemployed.

She requests a loan from Hekima to grow her business. She will purchase wines, liquors, etc. She started her business with funds received from her husband. 

In the future, she wants to build a house, send her children to school, and feed them. She thanks Hekima for supporting entrepreneur women without access to the banking system.

loans.use: to buy wines, liquors, etc.

loans.name: Keti

texts.en:
Keti, who operates a restaurant and rentals and also has sold clothes since 2006, is a friendly single woman of 29 years living in Kagadi, Uganda. 

She desires to strengthen her businesses despite the challenges of seasonal changes like Lent periods where customer turn-up is very low. Keti is asking for a loan to buy tables and plastic seats and to renovate her restaurant premises.

loans.use: to buy tables and plastic seats and to renovate her restaurant premises

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is a married Ugandan female with one child living in Kagadi. She has operated a retail shop since 2009 and earns a salary as a teacher to obtain additional income. 

Because she is hard-working, she desires to grow her business so that she can earn more income to enable her build a house. Aida is challenged by delayed payments by debtors and she is asking for a loan to buy sugar, crates of sodas, rice. and flour for selling.

loans.use: to buy  sugar, crates of sodas, rice, and flour for selling.

loans.name: Las Mercedes Group

texts.es:
GISELA vive en Palmareal - tiene 32 años de edad - vive con su esposo y 3 hijas. su esposo se dedica a la labor de pesca como la mayoría de los hombres de esta localidad. sus hijas asisten con normalidad a la escuela. en la comunidad cuentan con agua potable - energía eléctrica - centros de salud e iglesias.
GISELA se dedica a la venta de embutidos y lácteos desde su primer crédito. su negocio lo ha financiado con los prestamos que recibe de FODEMI. esta vez recibirá su 4to crédito con el cual tiene deseos de adquirir. yogurt - queso - y otros embutidos y lácteos.
menciona que también ahorrara algo de dinero para apoyarse en los pagos que realizara del presente crédito.

INFORMACION ADICIONAL
el grupo esta formado por 8 personas para uno de ellos es la primera vez que realiza un crédito y recibiran $500 dolares, los demás integrantes del grupo recibirán $900.  todos pertenecen a la misma comunidad y se esfuerzan por ofrecer
texts.en: Gisela, 32, lives in Palmareal with her husband and three daughters. His husband is a fisherman, like many men in this village. Her daughters go to school. The village has drinking water, electricity, medical facilities, and churches. Gisela sells sausages and dairy products and has been in business since she got her first loan. She has used loans from FODEMI to finance her business. This is her fourth loan. She will buy yoghurt, cheese, sausages, and other dairy products. She intends to also save some money in order to make repayments easier. Gisela belongs to a group comprised of 8 people, many of whom are on their first loan and will receive 500 dollars each, while the others will receive 900 each. All of them live in the same village and are very generous.

loans.use: to buy food to sell.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa (or Rosita like many who appreciate her call her) left her native country of Honduras in 1998 with the dream of making a better living. She started working in various restaurants for many years, until one day she decided that she wanted to be her own boss. She opened "Mi Rosita Restaurant" with dedication and effort in the Flemington NJ area, serving authentic and traditional Honduran food. 

She prides herself in using wholesome ingredients and keeping her costumers happy by providing excellent service at a good price. Her ambition was to open a second restaurant in the Bound Brook area that would allow her to tap into the Central American market in that area, but she also expected to attract the attention of other cultures as well. Rosita used the $5250 that was provided for her to buy a refrigeration room that was required by the city of Bound Brook.

loans.use: To pay for refrigeration equipment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy the materials she needs to build a washing sink in her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials to finish building a room in her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy two glass showcases, necklaces, bracelets, watches and bags; her greatest need is to have the capital for her son.

loans.name: Jose Javier

texts.es:
José es un ganadero de 39 años de edad que a pesar de todas las adversidades siempre supo cómo salir del problema, debido a la crisis de sequía que hubo por un largo periodo de tiempo algunos de sus ganados fallecieron creándolo un problema enrome. 

Ante la crisis y consciente que el ganado es su fuente primaria de ingresos y pensando obviamente en su familia, sus dos hijos de 15 y 7 años de edad y su amada esposa solicita un crédito para la compra de 4 ganados en etapa de nacimiento con los que iniciara nuevamente su empresa.
texts.en: José, 39, is a cattle-farmer. He always manages to find a way to overcome adversity. Now, he has a big problem, because, due to drought, he lost many heads of cattle. Faced with this crisis, knowing that cattle is his primary source of income and thinking of his family (two children aged 15 and 7, and his spouse), he asks for a loan to buy four young heads of cattle in order to restart his business.

loans.use: to buy cattle to replace the animals who succumbed to drought.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials to finish the walls of his house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy laminates, dressed timber, iron, tiles, cement and land to build his home.

loans.name: Alejandra Del Carmen

texts.es: Alejandra de 23 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida y su hijo de 8 meses de edad. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que se gana la vida elaborando y vendiendo pupusas, actividad que realiza frente a su vivienda desde hace mucho tiempo, experiencia por la cual cada día son más los clientes que buscan sus productos. Alejandra desea hacer mejoras en las paredes de su vivienda, por lo que solicita a FUSAI un crédito para comprar: cemento y arena para afinar las paredes de su vivienda y así evitar cualquier anidación de plagas.
texts.en: Alejandra is 23 years old. She lives in her own house with her life companion and her 8 month old son. She is an enterprising woman who makes a living making and selling pupusas. She has done this from the front of her house for quite some time. Every day she has more clients looking for her products. Alejamdra wants to make improvements on the walls of her house so she has requested a loan from FUSAI to buy cement and sand to plaster the walls of her house and avoid any nesting of pests.

loans.use: to buy cement and sand to plaster the walls of her house.

loans.name: Judith Aurora

texts.es:
Judith es una persona que desde muy joven ha trabajado, tiene 45 años de edad, es soltera y vive en Santa junto a su familia.
Siempre ha sabido superar las adversidades, actualmente trabaja como vendedora de calzados por reparto y le va muy bien porque ya es conocida por sus clientes y tiene muchos pedidos porque sus productos son de excelente calidad y brinda una atención personalizada a sus clientes.
Judith está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá comprar un televisor para su domicilio, de esta manera estará mejorando la calidad de vida de su familia y seguirá luchando para terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en: Judith began working at a very young age. She is 45 and single and lives in Santa with her family. She always manages to overcome adversity. She now sells shoes door-to-door and says she is doing very well because customers know her well, like her sense of customer service, and rush to order her high-quality products. Judith is grateful to Kiva lenders since, thanks to their help, she will be able to buy a television for her house, thus improving her family's standard of living. She will keep doing her best to finish building her house.

loans.use: to buy a television for her house.

loans.name: Edwin Antonio

texts.es: Edwin de 25 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su grupo familiar. Él es un joven trabajador que se gana la vida como fontanero, actividad que le permite salir adelante junto a su grupo familiar, además su padre se dedica a la agricultura vendiendo una cantidad de maíz y dejando la otra para el consumo del hogar. Edwin desea ampliar un cuarto de su vivienda, ya que su familia es extensa y siente que necesitan más espacio para estar cómodos, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: ladrillos, cemento, arena, grava y pagar mano de obra necesaria para ampliar un cuarto en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Edwin, 25, lives in his own home with his family. He is a young hard-working man who makes his living as a plumber, an activity which allows him to get ahead in life together with his family. In addition, his father works in agriculture, selling some corn and keeping the rest for household consumption. 

Edwin wants to extend a room in his home as his family is large, he feels that they need more space in order to feel comfortable which is why he is seeking a loan from Fusai to buy bricks, cement, sand, gravel and the labor needed to extend a room in his home.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, sand, gravel and pay for the labor need to extend a room in his home.

loans.name: Margarita Elvira

texts.es: Margarita de 50 años de edad habita junto a su esposo y sus 2 hijos de 20 y 29 años de edad en vivienda propia. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que se dedica a la venta de tamales de gallina y sopa de pata, actividad que realiza desde hace 20 años experiencia por la que cada día son mas los clientes que buscan sus productos. Margarita desea seguir mejorando el techo de su vivienda, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: lámina galvanizada, polines y pines para seguir cambiando el techo de su vivienda.
texts.en: Margarita is 50 years old and lives with her husband and her two children, aged 20 and 29 in her own house. She is an enterprising woman who works selling chicken tamales and sopa de pata (a hearty Salvadoran soup). She has been doing this work for 20 years and every day more people look for her products. Margarita wants to continue to improve the roof of her house so she has requested a loan from FUSAI. She will buy galvanized laminate, rafters and purlins to continue to repalce the roof of her house.

loans.use: to buy galvanized laminate, rafters and purlins to continue to replace the roof of her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cement and sand to cement the floor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cement, bricks, sand, iron, and gravel and to pay for laborers to build a bedroom in her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, gravel, bricks, iron, and to pay laborers to build a room on his house.

loans.name: Boresha Maisha Group

texts.fr: Muvingi est une femme ambitieuse et trésorière de la banque communautaire Boresha Maisha, cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée, âgée de 38 ans, mère de 4 enfants, qui vont  tous à l’école. Elle commença son business avec de fonds de reçu de son mari. Elle est vendeuse de friperie depuis 5 ans. Elle va acheter 4 ballons d'habits.  Son conjoint est un agent de l’Etat. Elle souhaite obtenir plus des crédits, construire une belle maison,  scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish,  elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Muvingi is an ambitious woman and the treasurer of community bank Boresha Maisha, a client of IMF Hekima. Married and 38 years old, she has four children, who all go to school.

She started her business with funds from her husband. She has sold used clothing for five years. She is going to buy four bundles of clothes. Her husband works for the State.

She wants to obtain more loans, build a beautiful house, send her children to school, and feed them. To conclude, she wants to thank Hekima for its support to entrepreneurs excluded from the banking system.

loans.use: to buy four bundles of clothing.

loans.name: Vidal Simeon

texts.es: Vidal de 56 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su hijo. Él es un hombre trabajador que presta sus servicios de seguridad en el centro de su municipio desde hace 7 años, además su hijo le apoya con la economía familiar gracias a su trabajo en una empresa. Vidal desea adquirir un crédito con FUSAI para afinar las paredes de su vivienda y el piso de la misma por lo que comprara con dicho crédito: cemento y arena para afinar las paredes y el piso de su vivienda.
texts.en: Vidal is 56 years old and lives in his own house with his son. He is s hard working man who has been working as security in a center owned by the municipality for seven years. His son also helps him with the household economy thanks to his work in a company. Vidal wants to get a loan from FUSAI to re-plaster the walls and floors of his house. With the loan he will buy cement and sand to re-plaster the walls and floors of his house.

loans.use: to buy cement and sand to re-plaster the walls and floors of his house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, galvanized zinc and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks and metal to build a sink in her home

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, gravel, metal sheeting, roofing beams, and pins to finish building his bathroom, build a roof, and cement the floor.

loans.name: Nohemy

texts.es:
Nohemy es una persona muy trabajadora que gracias a su esfuerzo diario ha podido forjarse un buen futuro y ha podido trabajar plenamente. 

Nohemy es una mujer muy responsable y trabajadora, siempre anda en busca de ideas y actividades que le permitan progresar y salir adelante.

Trabaja con la venta de mercancía como galletas, chocolates, golosinas, entre otros, a través de catálogos. Con esta actividad puede sostenerse y aportar para los gastos de su casa.

Vive con su madre en una pequeña casa en el municipio de La Ceja, y es la única que a través de su trabajo le brinda el sustento diario.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de surtido de galletas y chocolates para abastecer su negocio y poder aumentar sus ventas ya que algunos clientes le hacen unos pedidos medianos.

Apoya  a una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable con su madre a salir adelante con un préstamo!
texts.en:
Nohemy is a very hard-working person who, thanks to her hard work on a daily basis, has been able to forge a good future and has been able to work full time.

Nohemy is a very responsible and hard-working woman, she is always seeking ideas and activities that allow her to progress and get ahead in life. She is working in the sale of merchandise such as biscuits, chocolates, sweets and so on through catalogs. Through this activity, Nohemy is able to support and contribute to the household spending.

She lives with her mother in a small house in the municipality of La Ceja, and she is the only one who provides the daily sustenance through her work.

Nohemy is seeking a loan to buy a variety of biscuits and chocolates to stock her business and be able to increase her sales as some customers are making larger orders.

Support a very hard-working and responsible woman and her mother get ahead in life with a loan!

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as biscuits and chocolates to stock her small business and be able to support her mother.

loans.name: Luis Antonio

texts.es: Luis de 24 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su grupo familiar. Él es un joven emprendedor que se gana la vida comprando y vendiendo ganado y leche de vaca, además buscando tener un ingreso extra también vende diversidad de pescado y mariscos actividad que realiza en su cantón. Luis desea reparar el piso de su vivienda, ya que actualmente este se encuentra en mal estado, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar:cemento, arena y grava, además deberá pagar mano de obra necesaria para reparar el piso de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Luis, 24, lives in his own home together with his family. He is a young enterprising person who makes his living buying and selling cattle and dairy cows. Keen to find an additional income, Luis also sells a variety of fish and seafood in his area. 

Luis wants to repair the floor of his home, as he is currently encountering tough times, which is why he is seeking a loan from Fusai to buy cement, sand and gravel; he will also need to pay for the labor needed to repair the floor of his home.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand and gravel, in addition he will also need to pay for the labor needed to repair the floor of his home.

loans.name: Douglas Ines

texts.es: Douglas tiene 26 años de edad y trabaja como zapatero desde hace mucho tiempo. Douglas desea seguir mejorando las condiciones de su vivienda por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la mejora del piso de la misma. En el pasado tuvo un crédito con FUSAI con el cual mejoró las condiciones de las paredes de un cuarto de su vivienda. En esta ocasión usará el crédito para encementar el piso de la vivienda para el cual necesita comprar materiales como: cemento, arena y grava.
texts.en:
Douglas is 26 years old and has worked as a shoe maker for a long time. Douglas wishes to continue improving the conditions of his home, therefore he is requesting this loan from FUSAI in order to invest in the improvement of the floor in his home. 

In the past he had a loan with FUSAI with which he improved the conditions of the walls in a room in his house. On this occasion he will use the loan in order to put down a layer of cement over the floor of his home, for which he needs to buy materials such as cement, sand, and gravel.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, and gravel to put a cement layer on the floor of his home.

loans.name: Cristabel Irene

texts.es: Cristabel de 21 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida y su hija de 3 años de edad. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que desde hace 4 años se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir tales como: faldas, blusas, pantalones, camisas, ropa interior, etc. Su compañero de vida se gana la vida como mecánico automotriz. Cristabel desea construir una galera para proteger el vehículo que se observa en la fotografía, ya que la venta de ropa la realiza en dicho vehículo, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: cemento, arena, grava, lamina y madera para construir una galera para proteger su vehículo.
texts.en: Cristabel, 21, lives in her own home together with her life partner and their three-year-old daughter. She is an enterprising woman who, for the last four years has been selling clothes such as skirts, blouses, trousers, shirts, underwear and so on. Her life partner makes his living as a car mechanic. Cristabel wants to build a shed to protect the vehicle you can see in the photograph as she sells the clothes in this vehicle; hence why she is seeking a loan from Fusai to buy cement, sand, gravel, laminates and wood to build a shed to protect her vehicle.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, laminates and wood to build a shed to protect her vehicle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cement and sand, and to pay for the labor needed to plaster the walls of her home.

loans.name: Makhsat

texts.ru: Махсат 48 летняя жительница маленького района Дж.Расулова. Она живет вместе с мужем и сыном. Махсат домохозяйка. Она отвечает за домашние дела, за уют и порядок в доме. Также Махсат дома занимается разведением мелко рогатого скота. Такой бизнес приносит в дом важный источник дохода. На сегодняшний день у ее малое количество скот и Махсат с целью расширения бизнеса и купли мелко рогатых скотин обратилась за кредитом. Она надеется, что ей помогут, и у нее семье будет новые экономические возможности.
texts.en: Makhsat is a 48-year-old resident of the small region of J. Rasulova. She lives with her husband and son and is a homemaker, taking care of household tasks and making their home comfortable and organized. Makhsat also cares for small livestock. This business is an important source of income for the family. She now has a small number of animals and wants a loan to increase that number and expand her business. She hopes that you will help her so that her family can have new financial possibilities.

loans.use: to buy livestock with the goal of expanding her small business

loans.name: Zhibek

texts.ru: Жибек 46 лет, замужем, мать 4 детей. У нее среднее образование, с 2006 года занимается животноводством. В хозяйстве Жибек на сегодняшний день есть 15 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет около 15,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Жибек обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 25,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение поголовья овец с целью дальнейшей их перепродажи. Доходы от бизнеса помогут улучшить благосостояние Жибек, а также провести давно запланированный ремонт дома.
texts.en: Zhibek is 46 and married with four children. She has a high school education and has been working in animal husbandry since 2006. She now has 15 sheep with a monthly income of about 15,000 KGS. With the goal of further developing her business, Zhibek has turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 25,000 KGS to increase her number of sheep for eventual resale. Profits from the loan will help her increase her standard of living and also go toward long-awaited home renovations.

loans.use: to purchase five sheep and invest in her business

loans.name: Nuriniso

texts.ru: Нуринисо трудолюбивая женщина. Она уже давно трудится упорно на собственной земле. Она 20 лет назад начала свой бизнес выращиванием сельхоз культур. Она в основном выращивает лук. Нуринисо начала этот бизнес, тогда когда она очень нуждалась в деньгах, так как они жили крайне бедно, а ей необходимо было обеспечить 4 детей. Итак, она взяла на аренду землю и начала выращивать овощи. Постепенно она развевала свой бизнес. Вначале она продавала овощи в розницу на местном рынке, а теперь она имеет покупателей, которые покупают ее товар оптом у ее резиденции. Она благодарно своему мужу за то, что он все эти годы помогал и поддерживал ее введению данного бизнеса. Она планирует сделать второй посев лука и поэтому он запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки семена и минерального удобрения. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Nuriniso is a hardworking woman who has been working her own land diligently for a long time. 20 years ago she started her business growing crops, primarily onions. She started the business at a time when she really needed the money, since they lived in poverty and she had four children to care for. Therefore she rented land and started to grow vegetables. She gradually developed her business, first selling vegetables direct to customers at the local market, and now she sells to wholesale buyers who come to her. She is thankful to her husband for helping and supporting her in this business for all these years. Nuriniso plans to do a second planting of onions and therefore is requesting a loan of 5,000 somoni to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers for the new season

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables to continue growing the business, he is seeking the loan as he lives alone.

loans.name: Israel Antonio

texts.es: Israel de 24 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su grupo familiar. Él es un joven trabajador que se gana la vida prestando sus servicios en un restaurante desde hace 3 años, su padre aporta a la economía familiar gracias a su trabajo. En la casa de Israel se encuentra una galera que está en muy malas condiciones la cual le sirve como cocina artesanal, es por ello que Israel desea cambiarle  el techo y encementar el piso de la misma, para lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: lamina, madera, arena, cemento, hierro y grava para reparar la galera de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Israel, 24, lives in his own home together with his family. He is a hard-working young man who has been making his living for the last three years working in a restaurant. His father contributes to the family income through his work. 

There is a shed in Israel's home which is in a poor state and is used as an antique kitchen, as Israel wants to change the room and lay down cement on the floor, he is seeking a loan from Fusai to buy laminates, wood, sand, cement, steel and gravel to repair the shed of his home.

loans.use: to buy laminates, wood, sand, cement, steel and gravel to repair the shed in his home.

loans.name: Santos Elias

texts.es: Santos de 58 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposa y su hija de 22 años de edad. Él es un hombre emprendedor que cada día se gana la vida vendiendo diversidad de vitaminas para: niño, adulto, apetito infantil, cerebro,  nervios, etc. logrando gracias a su experiencia de 20 años, contar con una extensa cartera de clientes que lo recomiendan por ser una persona honesta y amigable. Santos ha observado que cada día son más sus clientes y además le demandan productos de mayor precio y calidad por lo que desea invertir en dichos productos. Por lo anterior Santos solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: mayor cantidad de vitaminas con mejor calidad.
texts.en:
Santos is 58 years old and lives in his own house with his wife and 22 year old daughter. He is an entrepreneurial man that each day makes his living selling a diversity of vitamins for children, adults, child appetite, brain, and nerves among others. He is achieving this thanks to his 20 years of experience, he counts on an extensive list of customers that recommend him for being an honest and kind person. 

Santos has observed that each day his customers are greater in number, and additionally they demand products that are higher in both price and quality, therefore he wishes to invest in said products. Therefore Santos is requesting a loan from FUSAI in order to invest in a greater quantity of higher quality vitamins.

loans.use: to invest in a greater quantity of higher quality vitamins.

loans.name: Zhyldyz

texts.ru: Жылдыз 20 лет, замужем, имеет 2 детей. У Жылдыз высшее образование, она учитель английского языка. В качестве дополнительно дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав в 2013 году. Благодаря упорному труду Жылдыз, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 2 дойные коровы, 2 лошади, 2 бычка. Также есть земельный надел мерою 1,05 ГА собственной и 0,50 ГА арендованной земли, где выращивают картофель, ячмень и эспарцет. На данный момент Жылдыз вместе со своей семьей проживает во времянке на территории дома свекра. Семья у Жылдыз молодая и в целях улучшения жилищных условий она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку энергоэффективных пластиковых окон и дверей, также на внутреннюю и внешнюю отделку стен. Жылдыз мечтает создать для своих детей достойные условия для жилья, также утепление дома позволит значительно снизить расходы на отопление.
texts.en:
Zhyldyz is 20 and married with two children. She has a higher education and is an English language teacher. Since 2013 she has been working in animal husbandry and agriculture as a means of supplementing her family's income. Thanks to her hard work, she now has two milking cows, two horses and two steers as well as 1.05 hectares of her own land and 0.5 hectares of rented land where she grows potatoes, barley and hay.

At the moment, Zhyldyz and her family are living in temporary housing on her mother-in-law's property. They are a young family and with the goal of improving their living conditions she has turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 KGS to buy energy-efficient plastic windows and doors and interior and exterior finishing for the walls. She dreams of creating good living conditions for her children, and insulating the house will also lower their heating costs.

loans.use: to purchase energy-efficient windows and doors and make improvements to her house in order to provide her family with good living conditions

loans.name: Elci Maria

texts.es:
Elci, a sus 39 años de edad, es una mujer carismática y servicial que se dedica a trabajar en su propio negocio, una tienda de abarrotes que inició por la necesidad de generar ingresos para sacar adelante a su familia. 

A pesar de las adversidades, ella tuvo la fortaleza y la determinación para levantarse y seguir adelante y, gracias a ello lleva 8 años de experiencia en esta actividad.

Su propósito en la vida es seguir progresando y por ello desea fortalecer su negocio acreditándolo con la compra de surtido de productos como abarrotes, granos, frituras, bebidas gaseosas y en general productos básicos de la canasta familiar, de esta forma podrá ofrecer a sus clientes una mejor calidad y servicio, logrando aumentar notablemente sus ventas y los ingresos que recibe de ellas.

Elci manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo con su negocio y, en un futuro desea convertirlo en un supermercado, en el que los clientes puedan encontrar todos los artículos que necesiten y así mejorar la rentabilidad y poder ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.

Apoyando a este crédito estarás contribuyendo con el emprendimiento de las mujeres Colombianas!
texts.en:
Elci, 39, is a charismatic and obliging woman who earns a living in her own business, a grocery store she started because she needed to make money to get her family ahead.  Despite some adversity, she had the strength and determination to pick herself up and move forward. Thanks to that, she has eight years of experience in her business.

Her goal in life is to keep on making progress.  She wants to strengthen her business by stocking products such as groceries, grains, fried food, soda, and basic staples.  That way she'll be able to give her customers better quality and better service, and significantly increase her sales and income.

Elci said her biggest desire is to keep on growing with her business.  In the future she wants to turn it into a supermarket where her customers might find everything they need.  That way she'll improve her profitability and be able to give her family a better quality of life.

Supporting this loan, you'll be contributing to the business ventures of Colombian women!

loans.use: to buy groceries, grains, soda, fried food, liquor, and other food

loans.name: Hafiza

texts.ru: Женщина с прекрасной душой и прекрасными мыслями нуждается финансовой поддержке, так как она должна оплатить наемным работникам. Хафиза уже более 18 лет занимается выращиванием риса. Она хорошо знает своё дело и имеет большой опыт в данной сфере. Хафиза продает рис на местном рынке. Ее члены семьи помогают ей введению бизнеса. Хафиза замужем и имеет 3 детей. Она планирует купить минеральные удобрения для земли, а также оплатить наёмным работникам. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 8000 сомони для покупки минерального удобрения, и оплатить наёмным работникам. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Hafiza is a woman with a beautiful soul and mind in need of financial support, since she needs to pay hired labourers. She has been growing rice for more than 18 years and knows her profession well, with a great deal of experience in the field. She sells rice at the local market and her family members - she is married with three children - help her with the business. She is requesting a loan of 8,000 somoni to buy mineral fertilizers for the land as well as to pay workers. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers and to pay for hired labourers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to apply for his professional degree.

loans.name: Rigoberto

texts.es: Rigoberto de 37 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañera de vida y sus 2 hijos de 10 y 12 años de edad. Él es un hombre emprendedor que se gana la vida elaborando pan francés en su vivienda, actividad que realiza desde hace 26 años, por lo que cada día son más los clientes que buscan sus productos, ya que gracias a su experiencia, sus productos tiene la fama de ser de excelente calidad. Rigoberto desea experimentar nuevos productos y así extender su negocio,  elaborando pan dulce y postres por lo que solicita un  crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: harina, latas, moldes para pastel, azúcar, etc.
texts.en:
Rigoberto, age 37, lives in his own home along with his life-companion and their two children, ages 10 and 12.

He is an enterprising man who earns a living by making French bread in his home. He has been engaged in this occupation for 26 years, so every day there are more customers seeking his products, which thanks to his experience, are famous for their excellent quality.

Rigoberto wants to experiment with new products, and thus extend his business by making sweet bread and desserts. That is why he is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in flour, trays, cake molds, sugar, etc.

loans.use: to invest in flour, trays, cake molds, sugar, etc.
